chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.252 - Hanan ibn Sudayr narrated from his father:
He said: 'I entered a bathhouse in Medina with my father, grandfather, and uncle. There was a man in the changing room.’
Imam (as) said: ”Where are you people from?" We replied: ”From the people of Al-Iraq” .
Imam (as) said: ”Which part of Al-Iraq?” We replied: ”From Al-Kufa”.
Imam (as) said: ”Welcome, O’ people of Kufa, you are the closest to us.”
Then He (as) said: ”Why are you not wearing a covering (waistcloth)? For Messenger of Allah (sw) has said that 'The private parts of a believer are forbidden for another believer to see.'"
My uncle then sent for a piece of cloth, cut it into four pieces, and each of us took one before we entered (bathhouse).
When we entered into the warm room (of bathhouse), the man turned to my grandfather and said: "O’ elderly man, why do you not use henna (dye)?"
My grandfather said: "I have seen someone better than you and me who did not use it."
Imam (as) said: "And Who is better than me?"
My grandfather replied: “I saw (Imam (as)) Ali ibn Abi Talib and he did not dye his hair."
He (as) lowered his head and sweat fell from him, and said: “You have spoken truth and sincere.
Then Imam (as) said: "O’ elderly man, if you dye your hair, the Messenger of Allah (sw) also dyed his hair, and He (sw) is better than (Imam (as)) Ali. And if you choose not to dye, then you have Sunnah of (Imam (as)) Ali as an example."
When we left the bathhouse, we asked about the man in the room, and it was told they are Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as), with his son Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).”
arabicText: 252- وَ رَوَى حَنَانُ بْنُ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ: دَخَلْتُ أَنَا وَ أَبِي وَ جَدِّي وَ عَمِّي حَمَّاماً فِي اَلْمَدِينَةِ فَإِذَا رَجُلٌ فِي بَيْتِ اَلْمَسْلَخِ فَقَالَ لَنَا مِمَّنِ اَلْقَوْمُ فَقُلْنَا مِنْ أَهْلِ اَلْعِرَاقِ فَقَالَ وَ أَيُّ اَلْعِرَاقِ فَقُلْنَا اَلْكُوفِيُّونَ فَقَالَ «مَرْحَباً بِكُمْ يَا أَهْلَ اَلْكُوفَةِ وَ أَهْلاً أَنْتُمُ اَلشِّعَارُ دُونَ اَلدِّثَارِ» ثُمَّ قَالَ «وَ مَا يَمْنَعُكُمْ مِنَ اَلْإِزَارِ » فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ «عَوْرَةُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِ عَلَى اَلْمُؤْمِنِ حَرَامٌ» قَالَ فَبَعَثَ عَمِّي إِلَى كِرْبَاسَةٍ فَشَقَّهَا بِأَرْبَعَةٍ ثُمَّ أَخَذَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا وَاحِداً ثُمَّ دَخَلْنَا فِيهَا فَلَمَّا كُنَّا فِي اَلْبَيْتِ اَلْحَارِّ صَمَدَ لِجَدِّي فَقَالَ «يَا كَهْلُ مَا يَمْنَعُكَ مِنَ اَلْخِضَابِ» فَقَالَ لَهُ جَدِّي أَدْرَكْتُ مَنْ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنِّي وَ مِنْكَ لاَ يَخْتَضِبُ فَقَالَ «وَ مَنْ ذَاكَ اَلَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنِّي» فَقَالَ أَدْرَكْتُ عَلِيَّ بْنَ أَبِي طَالِبٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ لاَ يَخْتَضِبُ فَنَكَسَ رَأْسَهُ وَ تَصَابَّ عَرَقاً وَقَالَ «صَدَقْتَ وَ بَرِرْتَ» ثُمَّ قَالَ «يَا كَهْلُ إِنْ تَخْتَضِبْ فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَدْ خَضَبَ وَ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنْ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ إِنْ تَتْرُكْ فَلَكَ بِعَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أُسْوَةٌ» قَالَ فَلَمَّا خَرَجْنَا مِنَ اَلْحَمَّامِ سَأَلْنَا عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ فِي اَلْمَسْلَخِ فَإِذَا هُوَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ وَ مَعَهُ اِبْنُهُ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.252 - Hanan ibn Sudayr narrated from his father:
thaqalaynMatn:
He said: 'I entered a bathhouse in Medina with my father, grandfather, and uncle. There was a man in the changing room.’
Imam (as) said: ”Where are you people from?" We replied: ”From the people of Al-Iraq” .
Imam (as) said: ”Which part of Al-Iraq?” We replied: ”From Al-Kufa”.
Imam (as) said: ”Welcome, O’ people of Kufa, you are the closest to us.”
Then He (as) said: ”Why are you not wearing a covering (waistcloth)? For Messenger of Allah (sw) has said that 'The private parts of a believer are forbidden for another believer to see.'"
My uncle then sent for a piece of cloth, cut it into four pieces, and each of us took one before we entered (bathhouse).
When we entered into the warm room (of bathhouse), the man turned to my grandfather and said: "O’ elderly man, why do you not use henna (dye)?"
My grandfather said: "I have seen someone better than you and me who did not use it."
Imam (as) said: "And Who is better than me?"
My grandfather replied: “I saw (Imam (as)) Ali ibn Abi Talib and he did not dye his hair."
He (as) lowered his head and sweat fell from him, and said: “You have spoken truth and sincere.
Then Imam (as) said: "O’ elderly man, if you dye your hair, the Messenger of Allah (sw) also dyed his hair, and He (sw) is better than (Imam (as)) Ali. And if you choose not to dye, then you have Sunnah of (Imam (as)) Ali as an example."
When we left the bathhouse, we asked about the man in the room, and it was told they are Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as), with his son Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).”

Hadith.253 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
'The thigh is not considered part of the 'awrah (private parts).'
arabicText: 253 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْفَخِذُ لَيْسَ مِنَ اَلْعَوْرَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.253 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: 'The thigh is not considered part of the 'awrah (private parts).'

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq

Hadith.254 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Nuura (depilatory paste) is a purifier."
arabicText: 254 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلنُّورَةُ طَهُورٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.254 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Nuura (depilatory paste) is a purifier."

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.255 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
'Remove the hair from your bodies, for it enhances (your appearance).'
arabicText: 255 - وَقَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَلْقُوا اَلشَّعْرَ عَنْكُمْ فَإِنَّهُ يُحَسِّنُ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.256 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Whoever wishes to use Nuura (depilatory paste), let him take some of it and place it on the tip of his nose and say:
Allāhumma irḥam Sulaymān ibn Dāwūd ‘alayhi al-salām kamā amarānā bil-nūrah
'O’ Allah (swt), have mercy on Solomon, son of David (as), as he instructed us regarding the depilatory paste (Nuura).'
If Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, wills, the paste will not cause him any harm.
arabicText: 256 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَتَنَوَّرَ فَلْيَأْخُذْ مِنَ اَلنُّورَةِ وَ يَجْعَلُهُ عَلَى طَرَفِ أَنْفِهِ وَ يَقُولُ: اَللَّهُمَّ اِرْحَمْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنَ دَاوُدَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ كَمَا أَمَرَنَا بِالنُّورَةِ فَإِنَّهُ لاَ تُحْرِقُهُ اَلنُّورَةُ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.»
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.256 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever wishes to use Nuura (depilatory paste), let him take some of it and place it on the tip of his nose and say:
Allāhumma irḥam Sulaymān ibn Dāwūd ‘alayhi al-salām kamā amarānā bil-nūrah
'O’ Allah (swt), have mercy on Solomon, son of David (as), as he instructed us regarding the depilatory paste (Nuura).'
If Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, wills, the paste will not cause him any harm.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.257 - It was narrated that "Whoever sits while applying Nuura (depilatory paste), he is at risk of developing a hernia."
arabicText: 257 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ مَنْ جَلَسَ وَ هُوَ مُتَنَوِّرٌ خِيفَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْفَتْقُ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.258 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"I like for a believer to use Nuura (depilatory paste) every fifteen days."
arabicText: 258 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أُحِبُّ لِلْمُؤْمِنِ أَنْ يَطَّلِيَ فِي كُلِّ خَمْسَةَ عَشَرَ يَوْماً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.258 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I like for a believer to use Nuura (depilatory paste) every fifteen days."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.259 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"The practice (sunnah) for using Nuura (depilatory paste) is every fifteen days. If twenty days pass without using it and you lack it, then borrow for the sake of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText: 259 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلسُّنَّةُ فِي اَلنُّورَةِ فِي كُلِّ خَمْسَةَ عَشَرَ يَوْماً فَإِنْ أَتَتْ عَلَيْكَ عِشْرُونَ يَوْماً وَ لَيْسَ عِنْدَكَ فَاسْتَقْرِضْ عَلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.259 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The practice (sunnah) for using Nuura (depilatory paste) is every fifteen days. If twenty days pass without using it and you lack it, then borrow for the sake of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.260 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Whoever believes in Allah (swt) and the Last Day (Qiyamah) should not leave the hair of their pubic region untrimmed for more than forty days, and it is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah (swt) and the Last Day (Qiyamah) to leave it untrimmed for more than twenty days."
arabicText: 260 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: « «مَنْ كٰانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللّٰهِ وَ اَلْيَوْمِ اَلْآخِرِ» فَلاَ يَتْرُكْ عَانَتَهُ فَوْقَ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً وَ لاَ يَحِلُّ لاِمْرَأَةٍ تُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ اَلْيَوْمِ اَلْآخِرِ أَنْ تَدَعَ ذَلِكَ مِنْهَا فَوْقَ عِشْرِينَ يَوْماً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.260 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever believes in Allah (swt) and the Last Day (Qiyamah) should not leave the hair of their pubic region untrimmed for more than forty days, and it is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah (swt) and the Last Day (Qiyamah) to leave it untrimmed for more than twenty days."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.261 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "Shave the abdomen hair for both males and females." (And in another version, it includes armpit hair).
arabicText: 261 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اِحْلِقُوا شَعْرَ اَلْبَطْنِ لِلذَّكَرِ وَ اَلْأُنْثَى.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.262 - And Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) would rub Nuura (depilatory paste) to his armpits in the bathhouse and say:
'Plucking the armpit hair weakens the shoulders and diminishes (weakens) the eyesight.'"
arabicText: 262 - وَ كَانَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَطْلِي إِبْطَيْهِ فِي اَلْحَمَّامِ وَ يَقُولُ «نَتْفُ اَلْإِبْطِ يُضْعِفُ اَلْمَنْكِبَيْنِ وَ يُوهِي وَ يُضْعِفُ اَلْبَصَرَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.262 - And Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) would rub Nuura (depilatory paste) to his armpits in the bathhouse and say:
thaqalaynMatn: 'Plucking the armpit hair weakens the shoulders and diminishes (weakens) the eyesight.'"

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.263 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Shaving (unwanted hair) is better than plucking them and using Nuura (depilatory paste) is better than shaving them."
arabicText: 263 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «حَلْقُهُ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ نَتْفِهِ وَ طَلْيُهُ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ حَلْقِهِ.»
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.263 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Shaving (unwanted hair) is better than plucking them and using Nuura (depilatory paste) is better than shaving them."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.264 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Removing armpit hair eliminates unpleasant odors and is a means of purification and a practice (Sunnah) that was commanded by the Good and Pure Prophet (sw)."

thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.264 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Removing armpit hair eliminates unpleasant odors and is a means of purification and a practice (Sunnah) that was commanded by the Good and Pure Prophet (sw)."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.265 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
'None of you should allow the hair under his armpits to grow long, for the devil takes it as a shield to hide behind.'
arabicText: 265 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «لاَ يُطَوِّلَنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ شَعْرَ إِبْطَيْهِ فَإِنَّ اَلشَّيْطَانَ يَتَّخِذُهُ مِجَنّاً يَسْتَتِرُ بِهِ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.267 – (Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Farisi Al-Fattal narrates from The Messenger of Allah (sw) ):
“Applying Nuura (depilatory paste) on Jumu’ah, it is said that it can lead to leprosy."
arabicText: 267 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهَا فِي يَوْمِ اَلْجُمُعَةِ تُورِثُ اَلْبَرَصَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.267 – (Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Farisi Al-Fattal narrates from The Messenger of Allah (sw) ):
thaqalaynMatn: “Applying Nuura (depilatory paste) on Jumu’ah, it is said that it can lead to leprosy."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.268 - Al-Rayyan ibn Al-Salt narrated from someone, who narrated from Abu Al-Hasan, Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), said:
"Whoever puts on Nuura (depilatory paste) on Jumu’ah and is afflicted with leprosy, let him blame no one but himself."
arabicText: 268 - وَ رَوَى اَلرَّيَّانُ بْنُ اَلصَّلْتِ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ - «مَنْ تَنَوَّرَ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ فَأَصَابَهُ اَلْبَرَصُ فَلاَ يَلُومَنَّ إِلاَّ نَفْسَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.268 - Al-Rayyan ibn Al-Salt narrated from someone, who narrated from Abu Al-Hasan, Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever puts on Nuura (depilatory paste) on Jumu’ah and is afflicted with leprosy, let him blame no one but himself."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.269 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Whoever applies depilatory substances (to remove body hair) and dyes with henna, Allah (swt), the Most High, protects him from three things: leprosy, vitiligo (a skin disorder), and ‘al-ākilah’ (a type of skin disease or severe wound infection) until the next time he applies it."
arabicText: 269 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «مَنِ اِطَّلَى وَ اِخْتَضَبَ بِالْحِنَّاءِ آمَنَهُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى مِنْ ثَلاَثِ خِصَالٍ اَلْجُذَامِ وَ اَلْبَرَصِ وَ اَلْآكِلَةِ إِلَى طَلْيَةٍ مِثْلِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.269 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever applies depilatory substances (to remove body hair) and dyes with henna, Allah (swt), the Most High, protects him from three things: leprosy, vitiligo (a skin disorder), and ‘al-ākilah’ (a type of skin disease or severe wound infection) until the next time he applies it."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.270 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Applying henna after the use of Nuura (depilatory paste) is a protection against leprosy and vitiligo."
arabicText: 270 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْحِنَّاءُ عَلَى أَثَرِ اَلنُّورَةِ أَمَانٌ مِنَ اَلْجُذَامِ وَ اَلْبَرَصِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.270 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Applying henna after the use of Nuura (depilatory paste) is a protection against leprosy and vitiligo."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.271 - It is narrated (from Ahmad ibn Abi Abdullah) that he narrates:
"Whoever applies a depilatory substance and massages himself with henna from head to toe, Allah (swt) removes poverty from him."
arabicText: 271 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ مَنِ اِطَّلَى وَ تَدَلَّكَ بِالْحِنَّاءِ مِنْ قَرْنِهِ إِلَى قَدَمِهِ نَفَى اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ اَلْفَقْرَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.271 - It is narrated (from Ahmad ibn Abi Abdullah) that he narrates:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever applies a depilatory substance and massages himself with henna from head to toe, Allah (swt) removes poverty from him."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.272 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "Dye with henna, for it improves eyesight, promotes hair growth, gives a pleasant fragrance, and calms the wife”.
arabicText: 272 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اِخْتَضِبُوا بِالْحِنَّاءِ فَإِنَّهُ يَجْلُو اَلْبَصَرَ وَ يُنْبِتُ اَلشَّعْرَ وَ يُطَيِّبُ اَلرِّيحَ وَ يُسَكِّنُ اَلزَّوْجَةَ»
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.272 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Dye with henna, for it improves eyesight, promotes hair growth, gives a pleasant fragrance, and calms the wife”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.273 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Henna removes the odors, increases radiance in the face, improves breath, and beautifies one's offspring."
arabicText: 273 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْحِنَّاءُ يَذْهَبُ بِالسَّهَكِ وَ يَزِيدُ فِي مَاءِ اَلْوَجْهِ وَ يُطَيِّبُ اَلنَّكْهَةَ وَ يُحَسِّنُ اَلْوَلَدَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.273 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Henna removes the odors, increases radiance in the face, improves breath, and beautifies one's offspring."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.274 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Dyeing (the hair or beard) is the tradition of Muhammad (sw) and it is part of the Sunnah."
arabicText: 274 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْخِضَابُ هَدْيُ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ هُوَ مِنَ اَلسُّنَّةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.274 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Dyeing (the hair or beard) is the tradition of Muhammad (sw) and it is part of the Sunnah."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.275 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"There is no harm in any kind of dyeing."
arabicText: 275 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ بَأْسَ بِالْخِضَابِ كُلِّهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.275 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in any kind of dyeing."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.276 - Al-Hasan ibn al-Jahm entered upon Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) who had dyed his hair with black dye.
Imam (as) said: "Indeed, there is a reward in dyeing. Dyeing and grooming are among those things which increase the chastity of women, and some women have abandoned chastity because their husbands have neglected grooming themselves."
(ibn Al-Jahm) replied to Him: "We have heard that henna increases gray hair?”
Imam (as) said: “What increases gray hair? Gray hair increases every day."
arabicText: 276 - وَ دَخَلَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ اَلْجَهْمِ عَلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: وَ قَدِ اِخْتَضَبَ بِالسَّوَادِ فَقَالَ «إِنَّ فِي اَلْخِضَابِ أَجْراً وَ اَلْخِضَابُ وَ اَلتَّهْيِئَةُ مِمَّا يَزِيدُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي عِفَّةِ اَلنِّسَاءِ وَ لَقَدْ تَرَكَتْ نِسَاءٌ اَلْعِفَّةَ بِتَرْكِ أَزْوَاجِهِنَّ اَلتَّهْيِئَةَ» فَقَالَ لَهُ بَلَغَنَا أَنَّ اَلْحِنَّاءَ تَزِيدُ فِي اَلشَّيْبِ فَقَالَ «أَيُّ شَيْءٍ يَزِيدُ فِي اَلشَّيْبِ وَ اَلشَّيْبُ يَزِيدُ فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ»
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.276 - Al-Hasan ibn al-Jahm entered upon Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) who had dyed his hair with black dye.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Indeed, there is a reward in dyeing. Dyeing and grooming are among those things which increase the chastity of women, and some women have abandoned chastity because their husbands have neglected grooming themselves."
(ibn Al-Jahm) replied to Him: "We have heard that henna increases gray hair?”
Imam (as) said: “What increases gray hair? Gray hair increases every day."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.277 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about dyeing the hair, and He said:
"The Messenger of Allah (sw) used to dye, and we still have some of his hair with us."
arabicText: 277 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْخِضَابِ فَقَالَ «كَانَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَخْتَضِبُ وَ هَذَا شَعْرُهُ عِنْدَنَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.277 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about dyeing the hair, and He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Messenger of Allah (sw) used to dye, and we still have some of his hair with us."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.278 - It is reported that The Prophet (sw) had seventeen gray hairs in his head and beard.
arabicText: 278 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ كَانَ فِي رَأْسِهِ وَ لِحْيَتِهِ سَبْعَ عَشْرَةَ شَيْبَةً.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.279 - The Prophet, Imam Hussain ibn Ali (as) and Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) used to dye their hair with katam (a plant-based dye often used in combination with henna to produce a darker color).
arabicText: 279 - وَ كَانَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ اَلْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ وَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَخْتَضِبُونَ بِالْكَتَمِ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.280 - And Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) used to dye his hair with both henna and Al-Katam (plant-based black)."
arabicText: 280 - وَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَخْتَضِبُ بِالْحِنَّاءِ وَ اَلْكَتَمِ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.281 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Dyeing (the hair or beard) with black brings comfort to women and inspires awe in enemies."
arabicText: 281 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْخِضَابُ بِالسَّوَادِ أُنْسٌ لِلنِّسَاءِ وَ مَهَابَةٌ لِلْعَدُوِّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.281 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Dyeing (the hair or beard) with black brings comfort to women and inspires awe in enemies."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.282 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) commented on the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted, "And prepare for them whatever force you can muster" (Surah Al-Anfal; 8:60).
Imam (as) said: "Among it is dyeing with black”.
(From Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) );
A man entered upon the Messenger of Allah (sw) with his beard dyed yellow (light color), and the Messenger of Allah (sw) said to him, "How good this is."
Then he entered again after that with his beard dyed with henna (reddish color), and the Messenger of Allah (sw) smiled and said: "This is better than the previous."
Then he entered again after having dyed it black, and the Prophet smiled and said:
"This is better than both of the previous”.
arabicText:
282 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ تَعَالَى «۝ وَ أَعِدُّوا لَهُمْ مَا اِسْتَطَعْتُمْ مِنْ قُوَّةٍ ۝»
قَالَ «مِنْهُ اَلْخِضَابُ بِالسَّوَادِ
وَ إِنَّ رَجُلاً دَخَلَ عَلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ قَدْ صَفَّرَ لِحْيَتَهُ فَقَالَ لَهُ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ «مَا أَحْسَنَ هَذَا»
ثُمَّ دَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ بَعْدَ هَذَا وَ قَدْ أَقْنَى بِالْحِنَّاءِ فَتَبَسَّمَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَقَالَ «هَذَا أَحْسَنُ مِنْ ذَاكَ» ثُمَّ دَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ وَ قَدْ خَضَبَ بِالسَّوَادِ فَضَحِكَ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ «هَذَا أَحْسَنُ مِنْ ذَاكَ وَ ذَاكَ».
thaqalaynMatn:
A man entered upon the Messenger of Allah (sw) with his beard dyed yellow (light color), and the Messenger of Allah (sw) said to him, "How good this is."
Then he entered again after that with his beard dyed with henna (reddish color), and the Messenger of Allah (sw) smiled and said: "This is better than the previous."
Then he entered again after having dyed it black, and the Prophet smiled and said:
"This is better than both of the previous”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.283 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"A woman should not neglect herself, even if it means wearing a necklace around her neck, Nor should She leave her hands without dyeing, even if it is by lightly applying henna, even if She is elderly."
arabicText: 283 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ يَنْبَغِي لِلْمَرْأَةِ أَنْ تُعَطِّلَ نَفْسَهَا وَ لَوْ أَنْ تُعَلِّقَ فِي عُنُقِهَا قِلاَدَةً وَ لاَ يَنْبَغِي لَهَا أَنْ تَدَعَ يَدَهَا مِنَ اَلْخِضَابِ وَ لَوْ أَنْ تَمْسَحَهَا بِالْحِنَّاءِ مَسْحاً وَ إِنْ كَانَتْ مُسِنَّةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.283 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman should not neglect herself, even if it means wearing a necklace around her neck, Nor should She leave her hands without dyeing, even if it is by lightly applying henna, even if She is elderly."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.284 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"When nails are affected by Nuura (depilatory paste), they can change their appearance, such that they may resemble the nails of the deceased. Therefore, there is no harm in changing (their appearance)."
arabicText: 284 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ اَلْبَاقِرُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّ اَلْأَظَافِيرَ إِذَا أَصَابَتْهَا اَلنُّورَةُ غَيَّرَتْهَا حَتَّى أَنَّهَا تُشْبِهُ أَظَافِيرَ اَلْمَوْتَى فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِتَغْيِيرِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.284 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When nails are affected by Nuura (depilatory paste), they can change their appearance, such that they may resemble the nails of the deceased. Therefore, there is no harm in changing (their appearance)."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.285 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as):
"O’ Ali, spending a dirham on dyeing is better than spending a thousand dirhams in other paths for the sake of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious. It has fourteen benefits: it repels odors from the ears, improves eyesight, softens the nostrils, freshens breath, strengthens the gums, removes ailments, reduces the whispering of Satan, brings joy to the angels, gladdens the believer, enrages the disbeliever, it is a form of adornment, a fragrance, it makes Munkar and Nakir (the angels who question the dead in their graves) feel shy, and it is a source of innocence (purity) in one's grave”.
arabicText: 285 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لِعَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «يَا عَلِيُّ دِرْهَمٌ فِي اَلْخِضَابِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ أَلْفِ دِرْهَمٍ فِي غَيْرِهِ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ فِيهِ أَرْبَعَ عَشْرَةَ خَصْلَةً يَطْرُدُ اَلرِّيحَ مِنَ اَلْأُذُنَيْنِ وَ يَجْلُو اَلْبَصَرَ وَ يُلَيِّنُ اَلْخَيَاشِيمَ وَ يُطَيِّبُ اَلنَّكْهَةَ وَ يَشُدُّ اَللِّثَةَ وَ يَذْهَبُ بِالضَّنَى وَ يُقِلُّ وَسْوَسَةَ اَلشَّيْطَانِ وَ تَفْرَحُ بِهِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ وَ يَسْتَبْشِرُ بِهِ اَلْمُؤْمِنُ وَ يَغِيظُ بِهِ اَلْكَافِرَ وَ هُوَ زِينَةٌ وَ طِيبٌ وَ يَسْتَحِي مِنْهُ مُنْكَرٌ وَ نَكِيرٌ وَ هُوَ بَرَاءَةٌ لَهُ فِي قَبْرِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.285 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "O’ Ali, spending a dirham on dyeing is better than spending a thousand dirhams in other paths for the sake of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious. It has fourteen benefits: it repels odors from the ears, improves eyesight, softens the nostrils, freshens breath, strengthens the gums, removes ailments, reduces the whispering of Satan, brings joy to the angels, gladdens the believer, enrages the disbeliever, it is a form of adornment, a fragrance, it makes Munkar and Nakir (the angels who question the dead in their graves) feel shy, and it is a source of innocence (purity) in one's grave”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.286 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"I indeed shave (the head) every Jumu’ah, from one washing to the next."
arabicText: 286 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنِّي لَأَحْلِقُ فِي كُلِّ جُمُعَةٍ فِيمَا بَيْنَ اَلطَّلْيَةِ إِلَى اَلطَّلْيَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.286 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I indeed shave (the head) every Jumu’ah, from one washing to the next."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.287 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said to a man:
"Shave (the head) for it enhances your beauty."
arabicText: 287 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لِرَجُلٍ: «اِحْلِقْ فَإِنَّهُ يَزِيدُ فِي جَمَالِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.287 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said to a man:
thaqalaynMatn: "Shave (the head) for it enhances your beauty."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.288 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Shaving the head outside of Hajj or 'Umrah is a form of humiliation for your enemies and a source of beauty for you."
The meaning of these words the Prophet became apparent, when He described the Khawarij, saying:
"They will exit from the religion as an arrow exits from the bow, and their sign is shaving (the head) completely.
arabicText:
288 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «حَلْقُ اَلرَّأْسِ فِي غَيْرِ حَجٍّ وَ لاَ عُمْرَةٍ مُثْلَةٌ لِأَعْدَائِكُمْ وَ جَمَالٌ لَكُمْ.
وَ مَعْنَى هَذَا فِي قَوْلِ اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: حِينَ وَصَفَ اَلْخَوَارِجَ فَقَالَ «إِنَّهُمْ يَمْرُقُونَ مِنَ اَلدِّينِ كَمَا يَمْرُقُ اَلسَّهْمُ مِنَ اَلرَّمِيَّةِ وَ عَلاَمَتُهُمُ اَلتَّسْبِيدُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.288 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Shaving the head outside of Hajj or 'Umrah is a form of humiliation for your enemies and a source of beauty for you."
The meaning of these words the Prophet became apparent, when He described the Khawarij, saying:
"They will exit from the religion as an arrow exits from the bow, and their sign is shaving (the head) completely.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.289 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Removing hair from the nose enhances the appearance of the face."
arabicText: 289 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَخْذُ اَلشَّعْرِ مِنَ اَلْأَنْفِ يُحَسِّنُ اَلْوَجْهَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.289 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Removing hair from the nose enhances the appearance of the face."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.290 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or a plant known as marshmallow root) every Jumu’ah provides protection from vitiligo and insanity."
arabicText: 290 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «غَسْلُ اَلرَّأْسِ بِالْخِطْمِيِّ فِي كُلِّ جُمُعَةٍ ' أَمَانٌ مِنَ اَلْبَرَصِ وَ اَلْجُنُونِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.290 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or a plant known as marshmallow root) every Jumu’ah provides protection from vitiligo and insanity."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.291 – (Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) ) states:
"Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or marshmallow root) removes poverty and increases sustenance."
arabicText: 291 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «غَسْلُ اَلرَّأْسِ بِالْخِطْمِيِّ يَنْفِي اَلْفَقْرَ وَ يَزِيدُ فِي اَلرِّزْقِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.291 – (Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) ) states:
thaqalaynMatn: "Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or marshmallow root) removes poverty and increases sustenance."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.292 - In another report, (Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) ) states:
"Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or marshmallow root) is a remedy and a form of refreshment”.
arabicText: 292 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «غَسْلُ اَلرَّأْسِ بِالْخِطْمِيِّ نُشْرَةٌ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.293 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or marshmallow root) removes dirt and purifies impurities”.
arabicText: 293 - قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «غَسْلُ اَلرَّأْسِ بِالْخِطْمِيِّ يَذْهَبُ بِالدَّرَنِ وَ يُنَقِّي اَلْأَقْذَاءَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.293 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Washing the head with Al-khatmi (a type of herbal shampoo or marshmallow root) removes dirt and purifies impurities”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.294 - And when the Messenger of Allah (sw) was distressed, Archangel Jibril (as) instructed him to wash his head with sidr (lote tree leaves), and this sidr was from the lote tree of Sidrat al-Muntaha (the utmost boundary in the heavens)."
arabicText: 294 - وَ إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اِغْتَمَّ فَأَمَرَهُ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنْ يَغْسِلَ رَأْسَهُ بِالسِّدْرِ وَ كَانَ ذَلِكَ سِدْراً مِنْ سِدْرَةِ اَلْمُنْتَهَى.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.295 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
"Washing the head with sidr (lote tree leaves) brings sustenance abundantly."
arabicText: 295 - وَقَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «غَسْلُ اَلرَّأْسِ بِالسِّدْرِ يَجْلِبُ اَلرِّزْقَ جَلْباً».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.295 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Washing the head with sidr (lote tree leaves) brings sustenance abundantly."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.296 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Wash your heads with sidr (lote) leaves, for every Muqarrab Angel and every Mursil Prophet has sanctified it. Whoever washes their head with sidr leaves, Allah (swt) will remove the whisperings of Shaytan (Satan) from them for seventy days. Whoever is free from the whisperings of Shaytan for seventy days will not disobey Allah (swt), and whoever does not disobey Allah (swt) will enter Paradise."
arabicText: 296 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اِغْسِلُوا رُءُوسَكُمْ بِوَرَقِ اَلسِّدْرِ فَإِنَّهُ قَدَّسَهُ كُلُّ مَلَكٍ مُقَرَّبٍ وَ كُلُّ نَبِيٍّ مُرْسَلٍ وَ مَنْ غَسَلَ رَأْسَهُ بِوَرَقِ اَلسِّدْرِ صَرَفَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ وَسْوَسَةَ اَلشَّيْطَانِ سَبْعِينَ يَوْماً وَ مَنْ صَرَفَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ وَسْوَسَةَ اَلشَّيْطَانِ سَبْعِينَ يَوْماً لَمْ يَعْصِ اَللَّهَ وَ مَنْ لَمْ يَعْصِ اَللَّهَ دَخَلَ اَلْجَنَّةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.296 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Wash your heads with sidr (lote) leaves, for every Muqarrab Angel and every Mursil Prophet has sanctified it. Whoever washes their head with sidr leaves, Allah (swt) will remove the whisperings of Shaytan (Satan) from them for seventy days. Whoever is free from the whisperings of Shaytan for seventy days will not disobey Allah (swt), and whoever does not disobey Allah (swt) will enter Paradise."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.297 - Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as) came out of the bathhouse, and a man met him and said:
"May your (backside) bathing be good."
Imam (as) said: "O’ fool, what business do you have mentioning the ‘backside’ here ?"
(The man) replied: "May your bath be pleasant"
Imam (as) said: "And if my bath is pleasant, what benefit is that to me?"
(The man) replied: "May your warm water be pleasant."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to you! Do you not know that 'Hamim' (hot water) is sweat?"
(The man) asked Him: “So what should I say?”
Imam (as) said: "Say: 'May what is purified from you be pleasant, and may what is pleasant from you be purified.'".
arabicText:
297 - وَ خَرَجَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مِنَ اَلْحَمَّامِ
فَقَالَ لَهُ رَجُلٌ طَابَ اِسْتِحْمَامُكَ فَقَالَ لَهُ «يَا لُكَعُ وَ مَا تَصْنَعُ بِالاِسْتِ هَاهُنَا»
فَقَالَ طَابَ حَمَّامُكَ قَالَ «إِذَا طَابَ اَلْحَمَّامُ فَمَا رَاحَةُ اَلْبَدَنِ مِنْهُ»
فَقَالَ طَابَ حَمِيمُكَ فَقَالَ «وَيْحَكَ أَ مَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَّ اَلْحَمِيمَ اَلْعَرَقُ»
قَالَ لَهُ كَيْفَ أَقُولُ قَالَ «قُلْ طَابَ مَا طَهُرَ مِنْكَ وَ طَهُرَ مَا طَابَ مِنْكَ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.298 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"If your brother says to you after you come out of the bath, 'May your bath be pleasant,' then reply with, 'May Allah (swt) grant you well-being.'"
arabicText: 298 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا قَالَ لَكَ أَخُوكَ وَ قَدْ خَرَجْتَ مِنَ اَلْحَمَّامِ طَابَ حَمَّامُكَ فَقُلْ أَنْعَمَ اَللَّهُ بَالَكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.298 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If your brother says to you after you come out of the bath, 'May your bath be pleasant,' then reply with, 'May Allah (swt) grant you well-being.'"

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.299 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Disease is of three types, and the cure is of three types : As for the ailments, they are blood, bile, and phlegm. The cure for blood is with cupping, the cure for phlegm is the bathhouse, and the cure for bile is walking."
arabicText: 299 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اَلدَّاءُ ثَلاَثَةٌ وَ اَلدَّوَاءُ ثَلاَثَةٌ فَأَمَّا اَلدَّاءُ فَالدَّمُ وَ اَلْمِرَّةُ وَ اَلْبَلْغَمُ فَدَوَاءُ اَلدَّمِ اَلْحِجَامَةُ وَ دَوَاءُ اَلْبَلْغَمِ اَلْحَمَّامُ وَ دَوَاءُ اَلْمِرَّةِ اَلْمَشِيُّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.299 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Disease is of three types, and the cure is of three types : As for the ailments, they are blood, bile, and phlegm. The cure for blood is with cupping, the cure for phlegm is the bathhouse, and the cure for bile is walking."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.300 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"There are three things that can weaken and potentially destroy the body: eating dried meat excessively, entering the bathhouse on a full stomach, and marrying an elderly woman."
It is also reported: "Intimacy on a full stomach."
arabicText:
300 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «ثَلاَثَةٌ يَهْدِمْنَ اَلْبَدَنَ وَ رُبَّمَا قَتَلْنَ أَكْلُ اَلْقَدِيدِ اَلْغَابِّ وَ دُخُولُ اَلْحَمَّامِ عَلَى اَلْبِطْنَةِ وَ نِكَاحُ اَلْعَجُوزِ.
وَ رُوِيَ: «اَلْغِشْيَانُ عَلَى اَلاِمْتِلاَءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.300 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There are three things that can weaken and potentially destroy the body: eating dried meat excessively, entering the bathhouse on a full stomach, and marrying an elderly woman."
It is also reported: "Intimacy on a full stomach."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.301 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said: "Trimming the nails on Jumu’ah provides protection from leprosy, insanity, vitiligo, and blindness. If you do not need to trim them, then scrape or clean them."
arabicText: 301 - وَ رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «تَقْلِيمُ اَلْأَظْفَارِ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ يُؤْمِنُ مِنَ اَلْجُذَامِ وَ اَلْجُنُونِ وَ اَلْبَرَصِ وَ اَلْعَمَى فَإِنْ لَمْ تَحْتَجْ فَحُكَّهَا حَكّاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.301 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Trimming the nails on Jumu’ah provides protection from leprosy, insanity, vitiligo, and blindness. If you do not need to trim them, then scrape or clean them."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.302 - In another report, it is stated:
"If you do not need to trim them (your nails), then pass a knife or scissors over them."
arabicText: 302 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: «فَإِنْ لَمْ تَحْتَجْ فَأَمِرَّ عَلَيْهَا اَلسِّكِّينَ أَوِ اَلْمِقْرَاضَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.302 - In another report, it is stated:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you do not need to trim them (your nails), then pass a knife or scissors over them."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.303 - Abd al-Rahim al-Qasir narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that He said: "Whoever trims their nails and mustache every Jumu’ah and says while doing so:
Bismillāhi wa billāhi wa ‘alā sunnati Muḥammad wa āli Muḥammad ṣalawātu Allāhi ‘alayhim
In the name of Allah (swt), and by Allah (swt), and upon the Sunnah of Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, may the blessings of Allah (swt) be upon them,'
That no nail or hair clipping will fall except that Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious, will record it as freeing a soul, and such a person will not become ill except for the illness that causes their death."
arabicText: 303 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَلرَّحِيمِ اَلْقَصِيرُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «مَنْ أَخَذَ مِنْ أَظْفَارِهِ وَ شَارِبِهِ كُلَّ جُمُعَةٍ وَقَالَ حِينَ يَأْخُذُهُ: بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ وَ بِاللَّهِ وَ عَلَى سُنَّةِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَوَاتُ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِمْ لَمْ تَسْقُطْ مِنْهُ قُلاَمَةٌ وَ لاَ جُزَازَةٌ إِلاَّ كَتَبَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَهُ بِهَا عِتْقَ نَسَمَةٍ وَ لَمْ يَمْرَضْ إِلاَّ مَرَضَهُ اَلَّذِي يَمُوتُ فِيهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.303 - Abd al-Rahim al-Qasir narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever trims their nails and mustache every Jumu’ah and says while doing so:
Bismillāhi wa billāhi wa ‘alā sunnati Muḥammad wa āli Muḥammad ṣalawātu Allāhi ‘alayhim
In the name of Allah (swt), and by Allah (swt), and upon the Sunnah of Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, may the blessings of Allah (swt) be upon them,'
That no nail or hair clipping will fall except that Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious, will record it as freeing a soul, and such a person will not become ill except for the illness that causes their death."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.304 - It is also reported in another narration:
"Whoever trims their nails on Jumu’ah should start with the little finger of the left hand and finish with the little finger of the right hand."
arabicText: 304 - وَ رُوِيَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: «أَنَّهُ مَنْ يُقَلِّمْ أَظَافِيرَهُ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ ' يَبْدَأْ بِخِنْصِرِهِ مِنَ اَلْيَدِ اَلْيُسْرَى وَ يَخْتِمْ بِخِنْصِرِهِ مِنَ اَلْيَدِ اَلْيُمْنَى.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.304 - It is also reported in another narration:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever trims their nails on Jumu’ah should start with the little finger of the left hand and finish with the little finger of the right hand."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.305 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Trimming the mustache from one Jumu’ah to the next (Jumu’ah) is protection from leprosy."
arabicText: 305 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَخْذُ اَلشَّارِبِ مِنَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ إِلَى اَلْجُمُعَةِ أَمَانٌ مِنَ اَلْجُذَامِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.305 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Trimming the mustache from one Jumu’ah to the next (Jumu’ah) is protection from leprosy."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.306 - Al-Hussain ibn Abi al-'Ala asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
'What is the reward for someone who trims their moustache and cuts their nails every Jumu’ah?'
Imam (as) replied: 'They will remain purified until the next Jumu’ah.'
arabicText: 306 - وَقَالَ اَلْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ أَبِي اَلْعَلاَءِ لِلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: مَا ثَوَابُ مَنْ أَخَذَ مِنْ شَارِبِهِ وَ قَلَّمَ أَظْفَارَهُ فِي كُلِّ جُمُعَةٍ قَالَ «لاَ يَزَالُ مُطَهَّراً إِلَى اَلْجُمُعَةِ اَلْأُخْرَى.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.306 - Al-Hussain ibn Abi al-'Ala asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
'What is the reward for someone who trims their moustache and cuts their nails every Jumu’ah?'
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: 'They will remain purified until the next Jumu’ah.'

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.307 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"None of you should allow their moustache grow long, for Shaytan uses it as a shield to conceal himself”.
arabicText: 307 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «لاَ يُطَوِّلَنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ شَارِبَهُ فَإِنَّ اَلشَّيْطَانَ يَتَّخِذُهُ مِجَنّاً يَسْتَتِرُ بِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.307 -
thaqalaynMatn:
The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"None of you should allow their moustache grow long, for Shaytan uses it as a shield to conceal himself”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.308 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever trims their nails on Jumu’ah will not have disheveled fingertips."
arabicText: 308 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ قَلَّمَ أَظْفَارَهُ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ ' لَمْ تَشْعَثْ أَنَامِلُهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.308 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever trims their nails on Jumu’ah will not have disheveled fingertips."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.309 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever trims their nails on Thursday but leaves one nail to trim on Jumu’ah, Allah (swt) will remove poverty from them."
arabicText: 309 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ قَصَّ أَظْفَارَهُ يَوْمَ اَلْخَمِيسِ وَ تَرَكَ وَاحِداً لِيَوْمِ اَلْجُمُعَةِ نَفَى اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ اَلْفَقْرَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.309 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever trims their nails on Thursday but leaves one nail to trim on Jumu’ah, Allah (swt) will remove poverty from them."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.310 - Abdullah ibn Abi Ya'fur said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"May I be your ransom. It is said that no act brings down sustenance like ta'qeeb (supplications and prayers) between the dawn and sunrise."
Imam (as) replied: "Indeed, but I will tell you something even better than that: trimming the mustache and cutting the nails on Jumu’ah."
arabicText: 310 - وَقَالَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ لِلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ يُقَالُ مَا اُسْتُنْزِلَ اَلرِّزْقُ بِشَيْءٍ مِثْلِ اَلتَّعْقِيبِ فِيمَا بَيْنَ طُلُوعِ اَلْفَجْرِ إِلَى طُلُوعِ اَلشَّمْسِ فَقَالَ «أَجَلْ وَ لَكِنْ أُخْبِرُكَ بِخَيْرٍ مِنْ ذَلِكَ أَخْذِ اَلشَّارِبِ وَ تَقْلِيمِ اَلْأَظْفَارِ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.310 - Abdullah ibn Abi Ya'fur said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"May I be your ransom. It is said that no act brings down sustenance like ta'qeeb (supplications and prayers) between the dawn and sunrise."
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, but I will tell you something even better than that: trimming the mustache and cutting the nails on Jumu’ah."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.311 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"Whoever trims their nails every Thursday, their child will not suffer from eye ailments”.
arabicText: 311 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ أَخَذَ مِنْ أَظْفَارِهِ كُلَّ يَوْمِ خَمِيسٍ ' لَمْ يَرْمَدْ وَلَدُهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.311 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever trims their nails every Thursday, their child will not suffer from eye ailments”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.312 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Whoever trims their nails on Saturday and Thursday and trims their mustache will be protected from toothache and eye pain."
arabicText: 312 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «مَنْ قَلَّمَ أَظْفَارَهُ يَوْمَ اَلسَّبْتِ وَ يَوْمَ اَلْخَمِيسِ وَ أَخَذَ مِنْ شَارِبِهِ عُوفِيَ مِنْ وَجَعِ اَلضِّرْسِ وَ وَجَعِ اَلْعَيْنِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.312 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever trims their nails on Saturday and Thursday and trims their mustache will be protected from toothache and eye pain."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.313 - Musa ibn Bakr said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"Our companions say that trimming the mustache and nails is only on Jumu’ah."
Imam (as) replied: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! Trim them if you wish on Jumu’ah, or if you wish, on any other day."
arabicText: 313 - وَقَالَ مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ لِلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: إِنَّ أَصْحَابَنَا يَقُولُونَ إِنَّمَا أَخْذُ اَلشَّارِبِ وَ اَلْأَظْفَارِ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ فَقَالَ «سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ خُذْهَا إِنْ شِئْتَ فِي يَوْمِ اَلْجُمُعَةِ وَ إِنْ شِئْتَ فِي سَائِرِ اَلْأَيَّامِ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.314 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: " Trim it when it grows long."
arabicText: 314 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «قُصَّهَا إِذَا طَالَتْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.314 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "
thaqalaynMatn: Trim it when it grows long."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.315 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
For men: ‘trim your nails’, and for women: ‘let your nails grow a bit, for it is (source of) beauty for you.’
arabicText: 315 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: لِلرِّجَالِ «قُصُّوا أَظَافِيرَكُمْ» وَ لِلنِّسَاءِ «اُتْرُكْنَ مِنْ أَظْفَارِكُنَّ فَإِنَّهُ أَزْيَنُ لَكُنَّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.315 -
thaqalaynMatn:
The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
For men: ‘trim your nails’, and for women: ‘let your nails grow a bit, for it is (source of) beauty for you.’

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.316 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "A man should bury his nails and hair when he trims them, and this is a Sunnah."
arabicText: 316 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «يَدْفِنُ اَلرَّجُلُ أَظَافِيرَهُ وَ شَعْرَهُ إِذَا أَخَذَ مِنْهَا وَ هِيَ سُنَّةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.316 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A man should bury his nails and hair when he trims them, and this is a Sunnah."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.318 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious:
'Take your adornment at every place of worship.' (Surah Al-A’raf 7:31).
Imam (as) said: "Part of that includes combing one's hair before every prayer”.
arabicText: 318 - وَ سُئِلَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: «خُذُوا زِينَتَكُمْ عِنْدَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ» قَالَ «مِنْ ذَلِكَ اَلتَّمَشُّطُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.317 - And it is narrated: "Among the Sunnah (traditions) is the burial of hair, nails, and blood."
arabicText: 317 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ مِنَ اَلسُّنَّةِ دَفْنَ اَلشَّعْرِ وَ اَلظُّفُرِ وَ اَلدَّمِ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.319 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Combing the hair removes ailments, and combing the beard strengthens the teeth."
arabicText: 319 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَشْطُ اَلرَّأْسِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ وَ مَشْطُ اَللِّحْيَةِ يَشُدُّ اَلْأَضْرَاسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.319 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Combing the hair removes ailments, and combing the beard strengthens the teeth."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.320 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
"When you comb your beard and head, pass the comb over your chest as well, for it removes worry and lethargy”.
arabicText: 320 - وَقَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا سَرَّحْتَ لِحْيَتَكَ وَ رَأْسَكَ فَأَمِرَّ اَلْمُشْطَ عَلَى صَدْرِكَ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْهَمِّ وَ اَلْوَنَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.320 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When you comb your beard and head, pass the comb over your chest as well, for it removes worry and lethargy”.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.321 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever combs their beard seventy times and counts it one by one will not be approached by Shaytan (Satan) for forty days."
arabicText: 321 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ سَرَّحَ لِحْيَتَهُ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةً وَ عَدَّهَا مَرَّةً مَرَّةً لَمْ يَقْرَبْهُ اَلشَّيْطَانُ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.321 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever combs their beard seventy times and counts it one by one will not be approached by Shaytan (Satan) for forty days."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.322 - Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
"Comb your hair with combs made of ivory, for it removes ailments."
arabicText: 322 - وَقَالَ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «تَمَشَّطُوا بِالْعَاجِ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.322 - Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Comb your hair with combs made of ivory, for it removes ailments."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.323 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Combing the hair removes ailments," referring specifically to fever.
In a narration by Ahmad ibn Abi Abdullah al-Barqi, it is stated: 'It removes fatigue,' meaning weakness.
Allah (swt), the Exalted, said:
'And do not slacken in My remembrance,' (Surah Taha 20:42) meaning do not become weak.
arabicText:
323 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْمَشْطُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ. وهو الحمى.
وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْبَرْقِيِّ: «يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَنَا. وَ هُوَ اَلضَّعْفُ قَالَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: «وَ لاٰ تَنِيٰا فِي ذِكْرِي» أَيْ لاَ تَضْعُفَا.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.324 - Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
"There are three things which, if a person understands them, they will not abandon: trimming the hair, shortening the garment, and marrying bondwomen."
arabicText: 324 - وَقَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «ثَلاَثٌ مَنْ عَرَفَهُنَّ لَمْ يَدَعْهُنَّ جَزُّ اَلشَّعْرِ وَ تَشْمِيرُ اَلثَّوْبِ وَ نِكَاحُ اَلْإِمَاءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.324 - Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There are three things which, if a person understands them, they will not abandon: trimming the hair, shortening the garment, and marrying bondwomen."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.325 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said to some of his companions:
"Cut your hair short to reduce its dirt, pests, and grime; it will strengthen your neck, improve your eyesight, and provide relief for your body."
arabicText: 325 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِبَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ: «اِسْتَأْصِلْ شَعْرَكَ يَقِلُّ دَرَنُهُ وَ دَوَابُّهُ وَ وَسَخُهُ وَ تَغْلُظُ رَقَبَتُكَ وَ يَجْلُو بَصَرَكَ وَ يَسْتَرِيحُ بَدَنُكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.325 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said to some of his companions:
thaqalaynMatn: "Cut your hair short to reduce its dirt, pests, and grime; it will strengthen your neck, improve your eyesight, and provide relief for your body."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.326 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "Whoever grows their hair should take good care of it or cut it short."
arabicText: 326 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «مَنِ اِتَّخَذَ شَعْراً فَلْيُحْسِنْ وِلاَيَتَهُ أَوْ لِيَجُزَّهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.326 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "Whoever grows their hair should take good care of it or cut it short."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.327 - He (as) said: "Beautiful hair is part of Allah’s (swt) provision, so honor it."
arabicText: 327 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلشَّعْرُ اَلْحَسَنُ مِنْ كِسْوَةِ اَللَّهِ تَعَالَى فَأَكْرِمُوهُ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.328 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever grows their hair and does not part it, Allah (swt) will part it with a saw of fire."
arabicText: 328 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنِ اِتَّخَذَ شَعْراً فَلَمْ يَفْرُقْهُ فَرَقَهُ اَللَّهُ بِمِنْشَارٍ مِنْ نَارٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.328 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever grows their hair and does not part it, Allah (swt) will part it with a saw of fire."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.329 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "Trim your mustaches and let your beards grow, and do not resemble the Jews."
arabicText: 329 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «حُفُّوا اَلشَّوَارِبَ وَ أَعْفُوا اَللِّحَى وَ لاَ تَشَبَّهُوا بِالْيَهُودِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.329 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Trim your mustaches and let your beards grow, and do not resemble the Jews."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.330 - "The Messenger of Allah (sw) once saw (looked) a man with a long beard, and said: "It would have been better if he had trimmed his beard.
When the man heard this, he trimmed his beard to a moderate length. Then entered to see the Prophet. When the Prophet saw him, He (sw) said: "This is how you should do it. "
arabicText: 330 - وَ نَظَرَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِلَى رَجُلٍ طَوِيلِ اَللِّحْيَةِ فَقَالَ «مَا كَانَ هَذَا لَوْ هَيَّأَ مِنْ لِحْيَتِهِ » فَبَلَغَ اَلرَّجُلَ ذَلِكَ فَهَيَّأَ مِنْ لِحْيَتِهِ بَيْنَ اَللِّحْيَتَيْنِ ثُمَّ دَخَلَ عَلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَلَمَّا رَآهُ قَالَ «هَكَذَا فَافْعَلُوا.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.331 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "The Magians (Zoroastrians) trim their beards and let their mustaches grow long, but we trim the mustaches and let the beards grow, and this is the natural disposition (fitrah)."
arabicText: 331 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «إِنَّ اَلْمَجُوسَ جَزُّوا لِحَاهُمْ وَ وَفَّرُوا شَوَارِبَهُمْ وَ إِنَّا نَجُزُّ اَلشَّوَارِبَ وَ نُعْفِي اَللِّحَى وَ هِيَ اَلْفِطْرَةُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.331 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Magians (Zoroastrians) trim their beards and let their mustaches grow long, but we trim the mustaches and let the beards grow, and this is the natural disposition (fitrah)."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.332 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Whatever extends beyond a fist-length of the beard is in the Fire."
arabicText: 332 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَا زَادَ مِنَ اَللِّحْيَةِ عَنْ قَبْضَةٍ فَهُوَ فِي اَلنَّارِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.332 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whatever extends beyond a fist-length of the beard is in the Fire."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.333 - Muhammad ibn Muslim said: "I saw Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) while the barber was trimming his beard, and Imam (as) said: 'Shape it evenly.'
arabicText: 333 - وَقَالَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ: رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ اَلْبَاقِرَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ اَلْحَجَّامُ يَأْخُذُ مِنْ لِحْيَتِهِ فَقَالَ «دَوِّرْهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.333 - Muhammad ibn Muslim said: "I saw Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) while the barber was trimming his beard, and Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: 'Shape it evenly.'

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.334 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Hold your beard with your hand (in a fist) and trim what is excess."
arabicText: 334 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «تَقْبِضُ بِيَدِكَ عَلَى لِحْيَتِكَ وَ تَجُزُّ مَا فَضَلَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.334 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Hold your beard with your hand (in a fist) and trim what is excess."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.335 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Gray hair at the front of the head is a sign of blessing, at the temples is a sign of generosity, at the hair ends is a sign of courage, and at the nape of the neck is a sign of ill-omen."
arabicText: 335 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اَلشَّيْبُ فِي مُقَدَّمِ اَلرَّأْسِ يُمْنٌ وَ فِي اَلْعَارِضَيْنِ سَخَاءٌ وَ فِي اَلذَّوَائِبِ شَجَاعَةٌ وَ فِي اَلْقَفَا شُؤْمٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.335 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Gray hair at the front of the head is a sign of blessing, at the temples is a sign of generosity, at the hair ends is a sign of courage, and at the nape of the neck is a sign of ill-omen."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.336 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "The first person to have gray hair was Ibrahim (as), the Friend (Khaleel) of Allah (swt). When he saw a white strand in his beard, He (as) said:
'O’ Archangel Jibril (as), what is this?'
Archangel Jibril (as) said: "'This is dignity (Waqar).'
So Ibrahim (as) replied: 'O’ Allah (swt), increase me in dignity.'
arabicText: 336 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَوَّلُ مَنْ شَابَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ اَلْخَلِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ إِنَّهُ ثَنَى لِحْيَتَهُ فَرَأَى طَاقَةً بَيْضَاءَ فَقَالَ يَا جَبْرَئِيلُ مَا هَذَا فَقَالَ هَذَا وَقَارٌ فَقَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ اَللَّهُمَّ زِدْنِي وَقَاراً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.336 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The first person to have gray hair was Ibrahim (as), the Friend (Khaleel) of Allah (swt). When he saw a white strand in his beard, He (as) said:
'O’ Archangel Jibril (as), what is this?'
Archangel Jibril (as) said: "'This is dignity (Waqar).'
So Ibrahim (as) replied: 'O’ Allah (swt), increase me in dignity.'

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.337 - Imam (as) said: "Whoever grows a gray hair in Islam, it will be a light for them on the Day of Judgment."
arabicText: 337 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ شَابَ شَيْبَةً فِي اَلْإِسْلاَمِ كَانَتْ لَهُ نُوراً يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.337 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever grows a gray hair in Islam, it will be a light for them on the Day of Judgment."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.338 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said: "Gray hair is light, so do not pluck it."
arabicText: 338 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اَلشَّيْبُ نُورٌ فَلاَ تَنْتِفُوهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.338 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Gray hair is light, so do not pluck it."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.339 - "It is reported that Imam Ali (as) saw no harm in cutting gray hair but disliked plucking it."
arabicText: 339 - «وَ كَانَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لاَ يَرَى بِجَزِّ اَلشَّيْبِ بَأْساً وَ يَكْرَهُ نَتْفَهُ.

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.340 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) says: "There is no harm in cutting gray hair or plucking it, but cutting it is more beloved to me than plucking it."
arabicText:
340 - اَلصَّادِقَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: «لاَ بَأْسَ بِجَزِّ اَلشَّمَطِ وَ نَتْفِهِ وَ جَزُّهُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ نَتْفِهِ.
فأخبارهم عليهم السلام لا تختلف في حالة واحدة لان مخرجها من عند الله تعالى ذكره، وإنما تختلف بحسب اختلاف الأحوال.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.340 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) says:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in cutting gray hair or plucking it, but cutting it is more beloved to me than plucking it."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.341 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"There are four traits of the Prophets: using fragrance, grooming with a razor, shaving the body with Nuura (depilatory paste), and frequenting the mosque."
arabicText: 341 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَرْبَعٌ مِنْ أَخْلاَقِ اَلْأَنْبِيَاءِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلتَّطَيُّبُ وَ اَلتَّنْظِيفُ بِالْمُوسَى وَ حَلْقُ اَلْجَسَدِ بِالنُّورَةِ وَ كَثْرَةُ اَلطَّرُوقَةِ.»
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.341 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There are four traits of the Prophets: using fragrance, grooming with a razor, shaving the body with Nuura (depilatory paste), and frequenting the mosque."

chapter: The Ritual Bath of jumu’ah, Entering the Bathhouse, Its Etiquette, and Teachings on Cleanliness and Beautification
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.342 - Imam (as) said: "Trim your nails on Tuesday, bathe on Wednesday, fulfil your need for cupping (hijama) on Thursday, and use your best fragrance on Jumu’ah."
arabicText: 342 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «قَلِّمُوا أَظْفَارَكُمْ يَوْمَ اَلثَّلاَثَاءِ وَ اِسْتَحِمُّوا يَوْمَ اَلْأَرْبِعَاءِ ' وَ أَصِيبُوا مِنَ اَلْحِجَامَةِ حَاجَتَكُمْ يَوْمَ اَلْخَمِيسِ وَ تَطَيَّبُوا بِأَطْيَبِ طِيبِكُمْ يَوْمَ اَلْجُمُعَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.342 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Trim your nails on Tuesday, bathe on Wednesday, fulfil your need for cupping (hijama) on Thursday, and use your best fragrance on Jumu’ah."

chapter: Washing of the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.396 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Do not leave your deceased alone, for Shaytan may disturb them within their body."
arabicText: 396 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ تَدَعَنَّ مَيِّتَكَ وَحْدَهُ فَإِنَّ اَلشَّيْطَانَ يَعْبَثُ بِهِ فِي جَوْفِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.396 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not leave your deceased alone, for Shaytan may disturb them within their body."

chapter: Washing of the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.343 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "The Messenger of Allah (sw) entered upon a man from the Banu Hashim who was in the throes of death and said to him: 'Say :
La ilaha illa Allah al-Haleemu al-Kareem, la ilaha illa Allah al-‘Aliyyu al-‘Azheem. Subhana Allah Rabbi as-samawati as-sab‘ wa Rabbi al-ardhina as-sab‘ wa ma feehinna wa ma baynahunna wa ma tahtahunna wa Rabbi al-‘Arsh al-‘Azheem. Wa salamun ‘ala al-mursaleen, wal-hamdu lillahi Rabb al ‘alameen
'There is no Allah (swt) but Allah (swt), the Forbearing, the Generous; there is no God but Allah (swt), the Most High, the Most Great; Glory be to Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of the seven heavens and the Lord (azj) of the seven earths and what is in them and what is between them and what is beneath them, and the Lord (azj) of the Mighty Throne. Peace be upon the messengers, and all praise is due to Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of all the worlds.'
The man said thusly, and the Messenger of Allah (sw) said: 'Praise be to Allah (swt) who has saved him from the Fire.'".
arabicText: 343 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ دَخَلَ عَلَى رَجُلٍ مِنْ بَنِي هَاشِمٍ وَ هُوَ فِي اَلنَّزْعِ فَقَالَ لَهُ «قُلْ: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ اَلْحَلِيمُ اَلْكَرِيمُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ اَلْعَلِيُّ اَلْعَظِيمُ سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ رَبِّ اَلسَّمَاوَاتِ اَلسَّبْعِ وَ رَبِّ اَلْأَرَضِينَ اَلسَّبْعِ وَ مَا فِيهِنَّ وَ مَا بَيْنَهُنَّ وَ مَا تَحْتَهُنَّ وَ رَبِّ اَلْعَرْشِ اَلْعَظِيمِ «وَ سَلاٰمٌ عَلَى اَلْمُرْسَلِينَ `وَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ اَلْعٰالَمِينَ» » فَقَالَهَا فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ « اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ اَلَّذِي أَنْقَذَهُ مِنَ اَلنَّارِ » »
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.343 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Messenger of Allah (sw) entered upon a man from the Banu Hashim who was in the throes of death and said to him: 'Say :
La ilaha illa Allah al-Haleemu al-Kareem, la ilaha illa Allah al-‘Aliyyu al-‘Azheem. Subhana Allah Rabbi as-samawati as-sab‘ wa Rabbi al-ardhina as-sab‘ wa ma feehinna wa ma baynahunna wa ma tahtahunna wa Rabbi al-‘Arsh al-‘Azheem. Wa salamun ‘ala al-mursaleen, wal-hamdu lillahi Rabb al ‘alameen
'There is no Allah (swt) but Allah (swt), the Forbearing, the Generous; there is no God but Allah (swt), the Most High, the Most Great; Glory be to Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of the seven heavens and the Lord (azj) of the seven earths and what is in them and what is between them and what is beneath them, and the Lord (azj) of the Mighty Throne. Peace be upon the messengers, and all praise is due to Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of all the worlds.'
The man said thusly, and the Messenger of Allah (sw) said: 'Praise be to Allah (swt) who has saved him from the Fire.'".

chapter: Washing of the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.344 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said: "You instruct your deceased to say 'There is no god but Allah (swt)' at the time of death, while we instruct our deceased to say 'Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (sw).'".
arabicText: 344 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّكُمْ تُلَقِّنُونَ مَوْتَاكُمْ: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ عِنْدَ اَلْمَوْتِ وَ نَحْنُ نُلَقِّنُ مَوْتَانَا مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ.

chapter: Washing of the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
