Hadith.422 - Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) was asked about a man who dies and whether he can be shrouded in three garments without a shirt (Qamis).
Imam (as) said: "There is no problem with that, but having a shirt is more preferred to me."
arabicText: 422 - وَ سُئِلَ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ أَ يُكَفَّنُ فِي ثَلاَثَةِ أَثْوَابٍ بِغَيْرِ قَمِيصٍ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ وَ اَلْقَمِيصُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.422 - Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) was asked about a man who dies and whether he can be shrouded in three garments without a shirt (Qamis).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no problem with that, but having a shirt is more preferred to me."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.423 - Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a woman who dies in a state of postpartum bleeding (nifas).
Imam (as) said: "She is washed just like a pure woman is washed, as is the case for a menstruating woman or someone in a state of major ritual impurity (janabah). They are washed with one washing."
arabicText: 423 - وَ سَأَلَ عَمَّارُ بْنُ مُوسَى اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ إِذَا مَاتَتْ فِي نِفَاسِهَا كَيْفَ تُغَسَّلُ قَالَ «تُغَسَّلُ مِثْلَ مَا تُغَسَّلُ اَلطَّاهِرَةُ وَ كَذَلِكَ اَلْحَائِضُ وَ كَذَلِكَ اَلْجُنُبُ إِنَّمَا يُغَسَّلُ غُسْلاً وَاحِداً.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.423 - Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a woman who dies in a state of postpartum bleeding (nifas).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "She is washed just like a pure woman is washed, as is the case for a menstruating woman or someone in a state of major ritual impurity (janabah). They are washed with one washing."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.424 - Abu Al-Hasan al-Thalith, Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as) was asked whether musk and incense (bukhoor) should be brought near the deceased.
Imam (as) replied: "Yes."
arabicText: 424 - وَ سُئِلَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ اَلثَّالِثُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: هَلْ يُقَرَّبُ إِلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ اَلْمِسْكُ وَ اَلْبَخُورُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.424 - Abu Al-Hasan al-Thalith, Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as) was asked whether musk and incense (bukhoor) should be brought near the deceased.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "Yes."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.425 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"If a woman dies in a state of postpartum bleeding (nifas) and her bleeding is heavy, She is washed up to the navel using a leather garment or something similar.
Then She is cleaned thoroughly, and cotton is placed in the front and back (private areas), and She is shrouded afterward."
arabicText: 425 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْمَرْأَةُ إِذَا مَاتَتْ نُفَسَاءَ وَ كَثُرَ دَمُهَا أُدْخِلَتْ إِلَى اَلسُّرَّةِ فِي اَلْأَدَمِ أَوْ مِثْلِ اَلْأَدَمِ وَ تُنَظَّفُ ثُمَّ يُحْشَى اَلْقُبُلُ وَ اَلدُّبُرُ ثُمَّ تُكَفَّنُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.425 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a woman dies in a state of postpartum bleeding (nifas) and her bleeding is heavy, She is washed up to the navel using a leather garment or something similar.
Then She is cleaned thoroughly, and cotton is placed in the front and back (private areas), and She is shrouded afterward."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.426 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a woman who passes away among a group of men with no male relative (mahram) present. Should they wash her while She remains clothed?
Imam (as) replied: "If they do that, it will be burdensome for them. Rather, they should wash only her hands."
arabicText: 426 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَمُوتُ مَعَ رِجَالٍ لَيْسَ مَعَهُمْ ذُو مَحْرَمٍ هَلْ يُغَسِّلُونَهَا وَ عَلَيْهَا ثِيَابُهَا فَقَالَ «إِذاً يُدْخَلَ ذَلِكَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَ لَكِنْ يَغْسِلُونَ كَفَّيْهَا.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.426 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a woman who passes away among a group of men with no male relative (mahram) present. Should they wash her while She remains clothed?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If they do that, it will be burdensome for them. Rather, they should wash only her hands."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.427 - Abdullah ibn Abi Ya’fur asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who dies while traveling in the company of women, with no other men present. What should they do?
Imam (as) replied: "They should wrap him in his clothes and bury him without washing him."
arabicText: 427 - وَ سَأَلَهُ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ مَعَ اَلنِّسَاءِ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُنَّ رَجُلٌ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعْنَ بِهِ قَالَ «يَلْفُفْنَهُ لَفّاً فِي ثِيَابِهِ وَ يَدْفِنَّهُ وَ لاَ يُغَسِّلْنَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.427 - Abdullah ibn Abi Ya’fur asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who dies while traveling in the company of women, with no other men present. What should they do?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "They should wrap him in his clothes and bury him without washing him."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.428 - Al-Halabi asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a woman who dies while traveling, with no male relative (mahram) or other women present.
Imam (as) replied: "She should be buried as She is, in her clothes”.
He (Halabi) asked; Regarding a man who dies with only women present and no other men.
Imam said: "They should bury him as he is, in his clothes."
arabicText: 428 - وَ سَأَلَهُ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ: عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَمُوتُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهَا ذُو مَحْرَمٍ وَ لاَ نِسَاءٌ قَالَ «تُدْفَنُ كَمَا هِيَ بِثِيَابِهَا » وَ اَلرَّجُلُ يَمُوتُ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُ إِلاَّ اَلنِّسَاءُ لَيْسَ مَعَهُنَّ رِجَالٌ قَالَ «يَدْفِنَّهُ كَمَا هُوَ بِثِيَابِهِ.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.429 - Abu al-Numeir, the freed slave of al-Harith ibn al-Mughira, asked Imam Al-Sadiq (as): "Tell me about the age up to which a child can be washed by women." The
Imam (as) replied: "Up to three years old."
arabicText: 429 - وَ سَأَلَهُ أَبُو اَلنُّمَيْرِ مَوْلَى اَلْحَارِثِ بْنِ اَلْمُغِيرَةِ فَقَالَ: حَدِّثْنِي عَنِ اَلصَّبِيِّ إِلَى كَمْ تُغَسِّلُهُ اَلنِّسَاءُ فَقَالَ «إِلَى ثَلاَثِ سِنِينَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.429 - Abu al-Numeir, the freed slave of al-Harith ibn al-Mughira, asked Imam Al-Sadiq (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"Tell me about the age up to which a child can be washed by women." The
Imam (as) replied: "Up to three years old."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.430 - Mansour ibn Hazim asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man traveling with his wife, and She dies. Should he wash her?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, as well as his mother, sister, and similar relatives. He should cover her private parts with a cloth and then perform the washing."
arabicText: 430 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مَنْصُورُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُسَافِرُ مَعَ اِمْرَأَتِهِ فَتَمُوتُ أَ يُغَسِّلُهَا قَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ أُمَّهُ وَ أُخْتَهُ وَ نَحْوَهُمَا يُلْقِي عَلَى عَوْرَتِهَا خِرْقَةً وَ يُغَسِّلُهَا.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.430 - Mansour ibn Hazim asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man traveling with his wife, and She dies. Should he wash her?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, as well as his mother, sister, and similar relatives. He should cover her private parts with a cloth and then perform the washing."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.431 - Sama’a ibn Mehran asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who dies and is only accompanied by women.
Imam (as) replied: "A woman who is his mahram (close relative) should wash him, and the other women should pour water over him without removing his clothes. If it is a woman who dies among men, with no women or mahram present, She should be buried as She is in her clothing. If a mahram is present, he may wash her from over her clothes."
arabicText: 431 - وَ سَأَلَهُ سَمَاعَةُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ: عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُ إِلاَّ نِسَاءٌ فَقَالَ «تُغَسِّلُهُ اِمْرَأَةٌ ذَاتُ مَحْرَمٍ مِنْهُ وَ تَصُبُّ اَلنِّسَاءُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْمَاءَ وَ لاَ تَخْلَعُ ثَوْبَهُ وَ إِنْ كَانَتِ اِمْرَأَةٌ مَاتَتْ مَعَ رِجَالٍ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُمُ اِمْرَأَةٌ وَ لاَ مَحْرَمٌ لَهَا فَلْتُدْفَنْ كَمَا هِيَ فِي ثِيَابِهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَ مَعَهَا ذُو مَحْرَمٍ لَهَا غَسَّلَهَا مِنْ فَوْقِ ثِيَابِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.431 - Sama’a ibn Mehran asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who dies and is only accompanied by women.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman who is his mahram (close relative) should wash him, and the other women should pour water over him without removing his clothes. If it is a woman who dies among men, with no women or mahram present, She should be buried as She is in her clothing. If a mahram is present, he may wash her from over her clothes."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.432 - Ammar al-Sabati asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a young girl for whom no woman is available to wash her.
Imam (as) replied: "The one most closely related to her among the men should wash her."
arabicText: 432 - وَ سَأَلَهُ عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ: عَنِ اَلصَّبِيَّةِ لاَ تُصَابُ اِمْرَأَةٌ تُغَسِّلُهَا قَالَ «يُغَسِّلُهَا أَوْلَى اَلنَّاسِ بِهَا مِنَ اَلرِّجَالِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.432 - Ammar al-Sabati asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a young girl for whom no woman is available to wash her.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one most closely related to her among the men should wash her."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.433 - The Imam was asked about a Muslim man who dies while traveling, with no other Muslim men present but with a group of Christian men and two Muslim women (his paternal aunt and maternal aunt). How should his washing be performed?
Imam (as) replied: "His paternal aunt and maternal aunt should wash him while he is in his shirt, and the Christian men should not approach him”.
Similarly, he was asked about a Muslim woman who dies while traveling, with no Muslim women present but accompanied by Christian women, along with her Muslim paternal uncle and maternal uncle.
The Imam said: "Her uncles should wash her, but the Christian women should not approach her. She should wear a protective garment, and water should be poured over the garment."
arabicText: 433 - وَ سَأَلَهُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ يَمُوتُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُ رَجُلٌ مُسْلِمٌ وَ مَعَهُ رِجَالٌ نَصَارَى وَ عَمَّتُهُ وَ خَالَتُهُ مُسْلِمَتَانِ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ فِي غُسْلِهِ قَالَ «تُغَسِّلُهُ عَمَّتُهُ وَ خَالَتُهُ فِي قَمِيصِهِ وَ لاَ تَقْرَبُهُ اَلنَّصَارَى » وَ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَمُوتُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهَا اِمْرَأَةٌ مُسْلِمَةٌ وَ مَعَهَا نِسَاءٌ نَصَارَى وَ مَعَهَا عَمُّهَا وَ خَالُهَا مُسْلِمَانِ فَقَالَ «يُغَسِّلاَنِهَا وَ لاَ تَقْرَبُهَا اَلنَّصْرَانِيَّةُ غَيْرَ أَنَّهُ يَكُونُ عَلَيْهَا دِرْعٌ فَيُصَبُّ اَلْمَاءُ مِنْ فَوْقِ اَلدِّرْعِ.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.434 - The Imam was asked about a Christian who dies while traveling among Muslims.
Imam (as) said: "A Muslim should not wash him, nor bury him, nor give him any honor, and should not stand by his grave, even if he was his father."
arabicText: 434 - وَ سَأَلَهُ: عَنِ اَلنَّصْرَانِيِّ يَكُونُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ وَ هُوَ مَعَ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ فَيَمُوتُ قَالَ «لاَ يُغَسِّلُهُ مُسْلِمٌ وَ لاَ يَدْفِنُهُ وَ لاَ كَرَامَةَ وَ لاَ يَقُومُ عَلَى قَبْرِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَبَاهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.434 - The Imam was asked about a Christian who dies while traveling among Muslims.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "A Muslim should not wash him, nor bury him, nor give him any honor, and should not stand by his grave, even if he was his father."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.435 - Al-Mufaddal ibn Umar asked Imam Al-Sadiq (as): "May I be your ransom, what is your ruling about a woman who dies while traveling with men, none of whom are her mahram (close relatives), and no women are present? What should be done with her?"
Imam (as) replied: "Only those parts that Allah (swt) has required for tayammum (dry ablution) should be washed, and She should not be touched or any of her private features, which Allah (swt) has commanded to be covered, uncovered."
He then asked: "How should it be done?"
Imam (as) replied: "Her inner palms should be washed first, then her face, followed by washing the backs of her hands”.
arabicText: 435 - وَ سَأَلَهُ اَلْمُفَضَّلُ بْنُ عُمَرَ: فَقَالَ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ مَا تَقُولُ فِي اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَكُونُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ مَعَ اَلرِّجَالِ لَيْسَ فِيهِمْ لَهَا ذُو مَحْرَمٍ وَ لاَ مَعَهُمُ اِمْرَأَةٌ فَتَمُوتُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ مَا يُصْنَعُ بِهَا قَالَ «يُغْسَلُ مِنْهَا مَا أَوْجَبَ اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلتَّيَمُّمَ وَ لاَ تُمَسُّ وَ لاَ يُكْشَفُ لَهَا شَيْءٌ مِنْ مَحَاسِنِهَا اَلَّتِي أَمَرَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِسَتْرِهَا» فَقَالَ لَهُ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ بِهَا قَالَ «يُغْسَلُ بَاطِنُ كَفَّيْهَا ثُمَّ يُغْسَلُ وَجْهُهَا ثُمَّ يُغْسَلُ ظَهْرُ كَفَّيْهَا.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.436 - Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who dies and is accompanied by no Muslim men or female Muslim relatives. Instead, there are Christian men and Muslim women unrelated to him.
The Imam said: "The Christian man should first perform ghusl (ritual washing for himself), then wash the deceased, as it is a case of necessity”.
arabicText: 436 - وَ سَأَلَهُ عَمَّارُ بْنُ مُوسَى اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ: عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُ رَجُلٌ مُسْلِمٌ وَ لاَ اِمْرَأَةٌ مُسْلِمَةٌ مِنْ ذَوِي قَرَابَتِهِ وَ مَعَهُ رِجَالٌ نَصَارَى وَ نِسَاءٌ مُسْلِمَاتٌ لَيْسَ بَيْنَهُنَّ وَ بَيْنَهُ قَرَابَةٌ قَالَ «يَغْتَسِلُ اَلنَّصْرَانِيُّ ثُمَّ يُغَسِّلُهُ فَقَدِ اُضْطُرَّ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.436 - Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who dies and is accompanied by no Muslim men or female Muslim relatives. Instead, there are Christian men and Muslim women unrelated to him.
The Imam said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Christian man should first perform ghusl (ritual washing for himself), then wash the deceased, as it is a case of necessity”.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.437 - The Imam was asked about a Muslim woman who dies and is accompanied by no Muslim women or male Muslim relatives, but there is Christian woman and Muslim men present.
Imam (as) replied: "The Christian woman should first perform ghusl (ritual washing for herself), and then She should wash the deceased."
arabicText: 437 - وَ سَأَلَهُ: عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ اَلْمُسْلِمَةِ تَمُوتُ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهَا اِمْرَأَةٌ مُسْلِمَةٌ وَ لاَ رَجُلٌ مُسْلِمٌ مِنْ ذَوِي قَرَابَتِهَا وَ مَعَهَا نَصْرَانِيَّةٌ وَ رِجَالٌ مُسْلِمُونَ فَقَالَ «تَغْتَسِلُ اَلنَّصْرَانِيَّةُ ثُمَّ تُغَسِّلُهَا.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.438 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "When a person dies at sea, they are washed, anointed (with Hunut), and shrouded. Then a stone should be tied to their leg, and they should be cast into the water."
arabicText: 438 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا مَاتَ اَلْمَيِّتُ فِي اَلْبَحْرِ غُسِّلَ وَ حُنِّطَ وَ كُفِّنَ ثُمَّ يُوثَقُ فِي رِجْلِهِ حَجَرٌ وَ يُرْمَى بِهِ فِي اَلْمَاءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.438 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a person dies at sea, they are washed, anointed (with Hunut), and shrouded. Then a stone should be tied to their leg, and they should be cast into the water."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.439 - It has been narrated that a deceased person should be placed in a large jar (khabiyah), which is then sealed, and the jar is thrown into the water.
arabicText: 439 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ يُجْعَلُ فِي خَابِيَةٍ وَ يُوكَى رَأْسُهَا وَ يُرْمَى بِهَا فِي اَلْمَاءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.439 - It has been narrated that
thaqalaynMatn: a deceased person should be placed in a large jar (khabiyah), which is then sealed, and the jar is thrown into the water.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.440 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said : "The man and woman sentenced to stoning should be washed, embalmed, and dressed in shrouds before being stoned, then they are to be stoned and prayers are to be offered for them (Salat Al Janazah).
The person subject to retaliation (Qisas) is treated similarly: they should be washed, embalmed, and dressed in shrouds before the execution, and funeral prayers should be offered for them (Salat Al Janazah).
arabicText: 440 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْمَرْجُومُ وَ اَلْمَرْجُومَةُ يُغَسَّلاَنِ وَ يُحَنَّطَانِ وَ يُلْبَسَانِ اَلْكَفَنَ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ ثُمَّ يُرْجَمَانِ وَ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِمَا وَ اَلْمُقْتَصُّ مِنْهُ بِمَنْزِلَةِ ذَلِكَ يُغَسَّلُ وَ يُحَنَّطُ وَ يُلْبَسُ اَلْكَفَنَ ثُمَّ يُقَادُ وَ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.440 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said :
thaqalaynMatn:
"The man and woman sentenced to stoning should be washed, embalmed, and dressed in shrouds before being stoned, then they are to be stoned and prayers are to be offered for them (Salat Al Janazah).
The person subject to retaliation (Qisas) is treated similarly: they should be washed, embalmed, and dressed in shrouds before the execution, and funeral prayers should be offered for them (Salat Al Janazah).

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.441 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who has been devoured by a wild animal or birds, leaving only his bones without flesh. He asked what should be done in such a case.
Imam (as) replied: "He should be washed, shrouded, funeral prayers should be offered for him, and he should be buried”.
arabicText: 441 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَأْكُلُهُ اَلسَّبُعُ أَوِ اَلطَّيْرُ فَتَبْقَى عِظَامُهُ بِغَيْرِ لَحْمٍ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ بِهِ قَالَ «يُغَسَّلُ وَ يُكَفَّنُ وَ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ وَ يُدْفَنُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.441 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who has been devoured by a wild animal or birds, leaving only his bones without flesh. He asked what should be done in such a case.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "He should be washed, shrouded, funeral prayers should be offered for him, and he should be buried”.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.442 - In another report, "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), did not wash Ammar ibn Yasir and Hashim ibn Utbah (known as al-Mirqal). He buried them in their clothing with their blood and did not offer funeral prayers for them”.
[AL SADUQ]
This is how it was narrated, it is understood that no member of the community should be left without a funeral prayer upon their death.
arabicText:
442 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: «إِنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لَمْ يُغَسِّلْ، عَمَّارَ بْنَ يَاسِرٍ وَ لاَ هَاشِمَ بْنَ عُتْبَةَ وَ هُوَ اَلْمِرْقَالُ وَ دَفَنَهُمَا فِي ثِيَابِهِمَا بِدِمَائِهِمَا وَ لَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيْهِمَا.
هكذا روى، لكن الأصل أن لا يترك أحد من الأمة إذا مات بغير صلاة.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.443 - Abu Mariam Al-Ansari narrated that Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"If a martyr has a remaining breath (sign of life), then he should be washed, shrouded, embalmed, and funeral prayers should be offered for him. But if there is no remaining breath, he should be shrouded in his own clothes."
arabicText: 443 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو مَرْيَمَ اَلْأَنْصَارِيُّ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «اَلشَّهِيدُ إِذَا كَانَ بِهِ رَمَقٌ غُسِّلَ وَ كُفِّنَ وَ حُنِّطَ وَ صُلِّيَ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ بِهِ رَمَقٌ كُفِّنَ فِي أَثْوَابِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.443 - Abu Mariam Al-Ansari narrated that Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a martyr has a remaining breath (sign of life), then he should be washed, shrouded, embalmed, and funeral prayers should be offered for him. But if there is no remaining breath, he should be shrouded in his own clothes."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.444 - Aban ibn Taghlib asked Him about a man who is killed in the path of Allah (swt): Should he be washed, shrouded, and embalmed (with Hunut)?"
Imam (as) replied: "He should be buried as he is, in his clothing with his blood, unless there is a sign of life remaining. If he has a sign of life and then dies, he should be washed, shrouded, embalmed, and the funeral prayer should be offered for him. This is because the Messenger of Allah (sw) prayed over Hamza, shrouded him, and embalmed him because he had been stripped (of his clothing)”.
arabicText: 444 - وَ سَأَلَهُ أَبَانُ بْنُ تَغْلِبَ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُقْتَلُ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ أَ يُغَسَّلُ وَ يُكَفَّنُ وَ يُحَنَّطُ فَقَالَ «يُدْفَنُ كَمَا هُوَ فِي ثِيَابِهِ بِدَمِهِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ بِهِ رَمَقٌ فَإِنْ كَانَ بِهِ رَمَقٌ ثُمَّ مَاتَ فَإِنَّهُ يُغَسَّلُ وَ يُكَفَّنُ وَ يُحَنَّطُ وَ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ لِأَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ صَلَّى عَلَى حَمْزَةَ وَ كَفَّنَهُ وَ حَنَّطَهُ لِأَنَّهُ كَانَ جُرِّدَ.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.445 - Hanzalah ibn Abu 'Amir, known as "the Rahib," was martyred at the Battle of Uhud.
The Prophet Muhammad (sw) did not command that he be washed, saying: "I saw the angels washing Hanzalah with water from the clouds, using silver vessels."
Because of this, he was given the title "Ghasil al-Malaika" (The One Washed by the Angels).
arabicText: 445 - وَ اُسْتُشْهِدَ حَنْظَلَةُ بْنُ أَبِي عَامِرٍ اَلرَّاهِبُ بِأُحُدٍ فَلَمْ يَأْمُرِ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِغُسْلِهِ وَقَالَ «رَأَيْتُ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةَ بَيْنَ اَلسَّمَاءِ وَ اَلْأَرْضِ تُغَسِّلُ، حَنْظَلَةَ بِمَاءِ اَلْمُزْنِ فِي صِحَافٍ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَ كَانَ يُسَمَّى غَسِيلَ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةِ.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.446 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"From a martyr, the fur, shoes, cap, turban, belt, and trousers should be removed, unless they have been stained with blood ; if they are stained with blood, they are to be left on. No tied item should remain on the body; it must be untied."
arabicText: 446 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «يُنْزَعُ عَنِ اَلشَّهِيدِ اَلْفَرْوُ وَ اَلْخُفُّ وَ اَلْقَلَنْسُوَةُ وَ اَلْعِمَامَةُ وَ اَلْمِنْطَقَةُ وَ اَلسَّرَاوِيلُ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ أَصَابَهُ دَمٌ فَإِنْ أَصَابَهُ دَمٌ تُرِكَ وَ لاَ يُتْرَكُ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ مَعْقُودٌ إِلاَّ حُلَّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.446 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "From a martyr, the fur, shoes, cap, turban, belt, and trousers should be removed, unless they have been stained with blood ; if they are stained with blood, they are to be left on. No tied item should remain on the body; it must be untied."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.447 - It has been narrated that when Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) passed away, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) continued to have a lamp lit in the room where Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) lived, until Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) also passed away.
Then Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) also instructed to do the same in the room of Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) to remain lit until He was taken to Iraq, after which it is unknown what happened”.
arabicText: 447 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ لَمَّا قُبِضَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ اَلْبَاقِرُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لَمْ يَزَلْ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَأْمُرُ بِالسِّرَاجِ فِي اَلْبَيْتِ اَلَّذِي كَانَ يَسْكُنُهُ حَتَّى قُبِضَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ ثُمَّ أَمَرَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ بِمِثْلِ ذَلِكَ فِي بَيْتِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ حَتَّى أُخْرِجَ بِهِ إِلَى اَلْعِرَاقِ ثُمَّ لاَ يُدْرَى مَا كَانَ.

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.448 - Sulayman ibn Khalid asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"Does one who washes the deceased need to perform ghusl (ritual purification)?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes."
He then asked: "What about someone who places the deceased in the grave?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, because he only touches the clothing."
arabicText: 448 - وَ سَأَلَ سُلَيْمَانُ بْنُ خَالِدٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: أَ يَغْتَسِلُ مَنْ غَسَّلَ اَلْمَيِّتَ قَالَ «نَعَمْ» قَالَ فَمَنْ أَدْخَلَهُ اَلْقَبْرَ قَالَ «لاَ إِنَّمَا مَسَّ اَلثِّيَابَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.448 - Sulayman ibn Khalid asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"Does one who washes the deceased need to perform ghusl (ritual purification)?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Yes."
He then asked: "What about someone who places the deceased in the grave?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, because he only touches the clothing."

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.449 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"When (my son) Ismail died, I ordered that his body, while covered, be uncovered so that I could kiss his forehead, chin, and neck.
Then, I had him covered again and later ordered that he be uncovered a second time, and I kissed his forehead, chin, and neck once more. Then, I had him covered again.
After that, I instructed that he be washed. When the washing was completed, I entered while he was being shrouded and said: 'Uncover his face,' and I kissed his forehead, chin, and neck and then recited protective supplications over him.
I then said: 'Wrap him.'
Someone asked: 'With what did you offer the protective supplication?'
Imam (as) replied: 'With the Qur'an.'"
arabicText: 449 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لَمَّا مَاتَ إِسْمَاعِيلُ أَمَرْتُ بِهِ وَ هُوَ مُسَجًّى أَنْ يُكْشَفَ عَنْ وَجْهِهِ فَقَبَّلْتُ جَبْهَتَهُ وَ ذَقَنَهُ وَ نَحْرَهُ ثُمَّ أَمَرْتُ بِهِ فَغُطِّيَ ثُمَّ قُلْتُ اِكْشِفُوا عَنْهُ فَقَبَّلْتُ أَيْضاً جَبْهَتَهُ وَ ذَقَنَهُ وَ نَحْرَهُ ثُمَّ أَمَرْتُهُمْ فَغَطَّوْهُ ثُمَّ أَمَرْتُ بِهِ فَغُسِّلَ ثُمَّ دَخَلْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَ قَدْ كُفِّنَ فَقُلْتُ اِكْشِفُوا عَنْ وَجْهِهِ فَقَبَّلْتُ جَبْهَتَهُ وَ ذَقَنَهُ وَ نَحْرَهُ وَ عَوَّذْتُهُ ثُمَّ قُلْتُ أَدْرِجُوهُ فَقِيلَ لَهُ بِأَيِّ شَيْءٍ عَوَّذْتَهُ فَقَالَ بِالْقُرْآنِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.449 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When (my son) Ismail died, I ordered that his body, while covered, be uncovered so that I could kiss his forehead, chin, and neck.
Then, I had him covered again and later ordered that he be uncovered a second time, and I kissed his forehead, chin, and neck once more. Then, I had him covered again.
After that, I instructed that he be washed. When the washing was completed, I entered while he was being shrouded and said: 'Uncover his face,' and I kissed his forehead, chin, and neck and then recited protective supplications over him.
I then said: 'Wrap him.'
Someone asked: 'With what did you offer the protective supplication?'
Imam (as) replied: 'With the Qur'an.'"

chapter: Chapter on Touching the Deceased
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.450 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"The Messenger of Allah (sw) kissed ‘Uthman ibn Maz'un after his death."
arabicText: 450 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَبَّلَ، عُثْمَانَ بْنَ مَظْعُونٍ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.450 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Messenger of Allah (sw) kissed ‘Uthman ibn Maz'un after his death."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.451 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever follows a funeral procession, Allah (swt) will record four qirats for them : one qirat for following the procession, one qirat for offering the funeral prayer, one qirat for waiting until the burial is completed, and one qirat for offering condolences."
arabicText: 451 - قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ تَبِعَ جَنَازَةً كَتَبَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ أَرْبَعَةَ قَرَارِيطَ قِيرَاطٍ لاِتِّبَاعِهِ إِيَّاهَا وَ قِيرَاطٍ لِلصَّلاَةِ عَلَيْهَا وَ قِيرَاطٍ لِلاِنْتِظَارِ حَتَّى يَفْرُغَ مِنْ دَفْنِهَا وَ قِيرَاطٍ لِلتَّعْزِيَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.451 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever follows a funeral procession, Allah (swt) will record four qirats for them : one qirat for following the procession, one qirat for offering the funeral prayer, one qirat for waiting until the burial is completed, and one qirat for offering condolences."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.452 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"Whoever walks with a funeral procession until the funeral prayer is offered and then returns will receive one qirat (measure of reward). If they continue walking with it until the deceased is buried, they will receive two qirats, and one qirat is like the size of Mount Uhud."
arabicText: 452 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ مَشَى مَعَ جَنَازَةٍ حَتَّى يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهَا ثُمَّ رَجَعَ كَانَ لَهُ قِيرَاطٌ وَ إِذَا مَشَى مَعَهَا حَتَّى تُدْفَنَ كَانَ لَهُ قِيرَاطَانِ وَ اَلْقِيرَاطُ مِثْلُ جَبَلِ أُحُدٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.452 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever walks with a funeral procession until the funeral prayer is offered and then returns will receive one qirat (measure of reward). If they continue walking with it until the deceased is buried, they will receive two qirats, and one qirat is like the size of Mount Uhud."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.453 - Imam (as) said: "Whoever follows the funeral procession of a Muslim will be granted four intercessions on the Day of Judgment. Whatever supplication or statement they make, the angel will say to them, 'And for you is the same.'"
arabicText: 453 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ تَبِعَ جَنَازَةَ اِمْرِئٍ مُسْلِمٍ أُعْطِيَ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ أَرْبَعَ شَفَاعَاتٍ وَ لَمْ يَقُلْ شَيْئاً إِلاَّ قَالَ لَهُ اَلْمَلَكُ وَ لَكَ مِثْلُ ذَلِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.453 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever follows the funeral procession of a Muslim will be granted four intercessions on the Day of Judgment. Whatever supplication or statement they make, the angel will say to them, 'And for you is the same.'"

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.454 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever takes hold of the four sides of the bier (funeral bier) will have forty major sins forgiven by Allah (swt)."
arabicText: 454 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ أَخَذَ بِجَوَانِبِ اَلسَّرِيرِ اَلْأَرْبَعَةِ غَفَرَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ أَرْبَعِينَ كَبِيرَةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.454 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever takes hold of the four sides of the bier (funeral bier) will have forty major sins forgiven by Allah (swt)."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.455 - Imam (as) said: "Whoever accompanies the funeral of a believer until they are buried in their grave, Allah (swt) will assign seventy angels to accompany and seek forgiveness for that person when they rise from their grave to stand at the gathering (on the Day of Judgment)."
arabicText: 455 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ شَيَّعَ جَنَازَةَ مُؤْمِنٍ حَتَّى يُدْفَنَ فِي قَبْرِهِ وَكَّلَ اَللَّهُ بِهِ سَبْعِينَ مَلَكاً مِنَ اَلْمُشَيِّعِينَ يُشَيِّعُونَهُ وَ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ لَهُ إِذَا خَرَجَ مِنْ قَبْرِهِ إِلَى اَلْمَوْقِفِ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.456 - Imam (as) said:
"The first gift given to a believer in their grave is the forgiveness granted to those who followed their funeral procession."
arabicText: 456 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَوَّلُ مَا يُتْحَفُ بِهِ اَلْمُؤْمِنُ فِي قَبْرِهِ أَنْ يُغْفَرَ لِمَنْ تَبِعَ جَنَازَتَهُ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.457 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"When a believer enters their grave, it is proclaimed: 'Behold, your first gift is Paradise! And the first gift for those who followed your funeral procession is forgiveness.'"
arabicText: 457 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا دَخَلَ اَلْمُؤْمِنُ قَبْرَهُ نُودِيَ أَلاَ إِنَّ أَوَّلَ حِبَائِكَ اَلْجَنَّةُ ، أَلاَ وَ أَوَّلُ حِبَاءِ مَنْ تَبِعَكَ اَلْمَغْفِرَةُ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.458 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said: “Whoever carries their deceased brother on all four sides of the bier, Allah (swt) will erase forty major sins from them."
arabicText: 458 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ حَمَلَ أَخَاهُ اَلْمَيِّتَ بِجَوَانِبِ اَلسَّرِيرِ اَلْأَرْبَعَةِ مَحَا اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ أَرْبَعِينَ كَبِيرَةً مِنَ اَلْكَبَائِرِ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.459 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Whoever takes hold of the handles of the bier, Allah (swt) will forgive twenty-five major sins for them. And if they carry it on all four sides, they will be cleansed of their sins."
arabicText: 459 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ أَخَذَ بِقَوَائِمِ اَلسَّرِيرِ غَفَرَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ خَمْساً وَ عِشْرِينَ كَبِيرَةً وَ إِذَا رَبَّعَ خَرَجَ مِنَ اَلذُّنُوبِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.459 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever takes hold of the handles of the bier, Allah (swt) will forgive twenty-five major sins for them. And if they carry it on all four sides, they will be cleansed of their sins."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.460 - Imam (as) said to Ishaq ibn Ammar:
"When you carry the sides of the bier of the deceased, you will be cleansed of your sins as if you were just born from your mother."
arabicText: 460 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِإِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ إِذَا حَمَلْتَ جَوَانِبَ اَلسَّرِيرِ سَرِيرِ اَلْمَيِّتِ خَرَجْتَ مِنَ اَلذُّنُوبِ كَمَا وَلَدَتْكَ أُمُّكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.460 - Imam (as) said to Ishaq ibn Ammar:
thaqalaynMatn: "When you carry the sides of the bier of the deceased, you will be cleansed of your sins as if you were just born from your mother."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.461 - Abu Ja'far, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said:
"Walking behind the funeral procession is better than walking in front of it, but there is no harm if you walk in front."
arabicText: 461 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّ اَلْمَشْيَ خَلْفَ اَلْجَنَازَةِ أَفْضَلُ مِنَ اَلْمَشْيِ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهَا وَ لاَ بَأْسَ إِنْ مَشَيْتَ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.461 - Abu Ja'far, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Walking behind the funeral procession is better than walking in front of it, but there is no harm if you walk in front."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.462 - Hussein ibn Saeed wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), asking about the bier of the deceased: Is there a specific side that should be carried first from among its four sides, or can one carry it from any side that is easiest?
Imam (as) replied: "From whichever side he wishes."
arabicText: 462 - وَ كَتَبَ اَلْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ سَعِيدٍ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَسْأَلُهُ: عَنْ سَرِيرِ اَلْمَيِّتِ يُحْمَلُ أَ لَهُ جَانِبٌ يُبْدَأُ بِهِ فِي اَلْحَمْلِ مِنْ جَوَانِبِهِ اَلْأَرْبَعَةِ أَوْ مَا خَفَّ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ يَحْمِلُ مِنْ أَيِّ اَلْجَوَانِبِ شَاءَ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «مِنْ أَيِّهَا شَاءَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.462 - Hussein ibn Saeed wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), asking about the bier of the deceased: Is there a specific side that should be carried first from among its four sides, or can one carry it from any side that is easiest?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "From whichever side he wishes."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.463 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a funeral procession in which fire (torches or lamps) is carried.
Imam (as) replied: "The daughter of the Messenger of Allah (sw) was taken out at night, and lamps accompanied her."
arabicText: 463 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْجَنَازَةِ يُخْرَجُ مَعَهَا بِالنَّارِ فَقَالَ «إِنَّ اِبْنَةَ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أُخْرِجَ بِهَا لَيْلاً وَ مَعَهَا مَصَابِيحُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.463 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a funeral procession in which fire (torches or lamps) is carried.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The daughter of the Messenger of Allah (sw) was taken out at night, and lamps accompanied her."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.464 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of them (Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) or Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) ) that he asked about walking with the funeral procession.
Imam (as) replied: "In front of it, on its right side, on its left side, and behind it."
arabicText: 464 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ - سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمَشْيِ مَعَ اَلْجَنَازَةِ فَقَالَ «بَيْنَ يَدَيْهَا وَ عَنْ يَمِينِهَا وَ عَنْ شِمَالِهَا وَ خَلْفِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.464 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of them (Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) or Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) ) that he asked about walking with the funeral procession.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "In front of it, on its right side, on its left side, and behind it."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.465 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"When Adam (as) passed away and it was time to perform the prayer for him, the son of Adam, Hibatullah (Seth), said to Archangel Jibril (as):
'Advance, O’ Messenger (intermediary) of Allah (swt), and lead the prayer over the Prophet of Allah (swt).'
Archangel Jibril (as) replied: 'Allah (swt), the Exalted, commanded us to prostrate to your father, and we do not go ahead of the best of his progeny. You are among the most righteous of them, so you should lead.'
Hibatullah advanced and performed five takbirs over him, corresponding to the number of prayers that Allah (swt) made obligatory for the Ummah of Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon
arabicText: 465 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «لَمَّا مَاتَ آدَمُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَبَلَغَ إِلَى اَلصَّلاَةِ عَلَيْهِ قَالَ هِبَةُ اَللَّهِ لِجَبْرَئِيلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ تَقَدَّمْ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ فَصَلِّ عَلَى نَبِيِّ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَمَرَنَا بِالسُّجُودِ لِأَبِيكَ فَلَسْنَا نَتَقَدَّمُ أَبْرَارَ وُلْدِهِ وَ أَنْتَ مِنْ أَبَرِّهِمْ فَتَقَدَّمَ فَكَبَّرَ عَلَيْهِ خَمْساً عِدَّةَ اَلصَّلَوَاتِ اَلَّتِي فَرَضَهَا اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى عَلَى أُمَّةِ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ هِيَ اَلسُّنَّةُ اَلْجَارِيَةُ فِي وُلْدِهِ إِلَى يَوْمِ اَلْقِيَامَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.465 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When Adam (as) passed away and it was time to perform the prayer for him, the son of Adam, Hibatullah (Seth), said to Archangel Jibril (as):
'Advance, O’ Messenger (intermediary) of Allah (swt), and lead the prayer over the Prophet of Allah (swt).'
Archangel Jibril (as) replied: 'Allah (swt), the Exalted, commanded us to prostrate to your father, and we do not go ahead of the best of his progeny. You are among the most righteous of them, so you should lead.'
Hibatullah advanced and performed five takbirs over him, corresponding to the number of prayers that Allah (swt) made obligatory for the Ummah of Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.466 - When the Messenger of Allah (sw) offered the funeral prayer over a deceased person, he would recite the first takbir and then recite the testimony of faith (shahada).
He would then recite the second takbir, send blessings upon the Prophet and his family, and make supplications.
Upon the third takbir, he would pray for the believing men and women.
After the fourth takbir, he would supplicate for the deceased,
And then conclude with a fifth takbir before leaving.
When Allah (swt), the Exalted, forbade him from praying over the hypocrites,
he recited the first takbir, recited the shahada,
then recited the second takbir, sent blessings upon the Prophet and his family,
recited the third takbir, and prayed for the believing men and women.
Upon the fourth takbir, he did not offer any supplication for the deceased and then concluded.
arabicText: 466 - وَ كَانَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِذَا صَلَّى عَلَى مَيِّتٍ كَبَّرَ فَتَشَهَّدَ ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ فَصَلَّى عَلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ وَ آلِهِ وَ دَعَا ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ وَ دَعَا لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ اَلْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ اَلرَّابِعَةَ وَ دَعَا لِلْمَيِّتِ ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ وَ اِنْصَرَفَ فَلَمَّا نَهَاهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ عَلَى اَلْمُنَافِقِينَ فَكَبَّرَ وَ تَشَهَّدَ ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ فَصَلَّى عَلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ وَ آلِهِ ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ وَ دَعَا لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ اَلْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ اَلرَّابِعَةَ وَ اِنْصَرَفَ فَلَمْ يَدْعُ لِلْمَيِّتِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.466 -
thaqalaynMatn:
When the Messenger of Allah (sw) offered the funeral prayer over a deceased person, he would recite the first takbir and then recite the testimony of faith (shahada).
He would then recite the second takbir, send blessings upon the Prophet and his family, and make supplications.
Upon the third takbir, he would pray for the believing men and women.
After the fourth takbir, he would supplicate for the deceased,
And then conclude with a fifth takbir before leaving.
When Allah (swt), the Exalted, forbade him from praying over the hypocrites,
he recited the first takbir, recited the shahada,
then recited the second takbir, sent blessings upon the Prophet and his family,
recited the third takbir, and prayed for the believing men and women.
Upon the fourth takbir, he did not offer any supplication for the deceased and then concluded.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.467 - It has been narrated that the reason behind this practice is that Allah (swt), the Exalted, has prescribed five obligatory prayers for people, and thus, one takbir is designated for the deceased from each of these obligatory prayers.
arabicText: 467 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ اَلْعِلَّةَ فِي ذَلِكَ أَنَّ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى فَرَضَ عَلَى اَلنَّاسِ خَمْسَ صَلَوَاتٍُ فَجَعَلَ مِنْ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ فَرِيضَةٍ لِلْمَيِّتِ تَكْبِيرَةً.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.468 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) recited seventy takbirs (Allahu Akbar) over Hamza.
arabicText: 468 - وَ كَبَّرَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَلَى حَمْزَةَ سَبْعِينَ تَكْبِيرَةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.468 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (sw) recited seventy takbirs (Allahu Akbar) over Hamza.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.469 - Imam Ali (as) recited twenty-five takbirs (Allahu Akbar) over Sahl ibn Hunayf.
arabicText: 469 - وَ كَبَّرَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَى سَهْلِ بْنِ حُنَيْفٍ خَمْساً وَ عِشْرِينَ تَكْبِيرَةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.469 -
thaqalaynMatn: Imam Ali (as) recited twenty-five takbirs (Allahu Akbar) over Sahl ibn Hunayf.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.470 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said: "The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to recite takbirs five at a time over the deceased. When people would arrive late and say, 'O’ Commander of the Faithful, we did not catch the prayer over Sahl ibn Hunayf,' he would place the bier down and recite five takbirs over him again, repeating this process until he reached the grave, doing so five times”.
arabicText: 470 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُكَبِّرُ خَمْساً خَمْساً كَانَ إِذَا أَدْرَكَهُ اَلنَّاسُ قَالُوا يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ لَمْ نُدْرِكِ اَلصَّلاَةَ عَلَى سَهْلِ بْنِ حُنَيْفٍ فَيَضَعُهُ فَيُكَبِّرُ عَلَيْهِ خَمْساً حَتَّى اِنْتَهَى إِلَى قَبْرِهِ خَمْسَ مَرَّاتٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.470 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to recite takbirs five at a time over the deceased. When people would arrive late and say, 'O’ Commander of the Faithful, we did not catch the prayer over Sahl ibn Hunayf,' he would place the bier down and recite five takbirs over him again, repeating this process until he reached the grave, doing so five times”.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.471 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"If a person catches one or two takbirs of the funeral prayer over the deceased, they should complete the remaining takbirs consecutively."
arabicText: 471 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «إِذَا أَدْرَكَ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلتَّكْبِيرَةَ وَ اَلتَّكْبِيرَتَيْنِ مِنَ اَلصَّلاَةِ عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ فَلْيَقْضِ مَا بَقِيَ مُتَتَابِعاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.471 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a person catches one or two takbirs of the funeral prayer over the deceased, they should complete the remaining takbirs consecutively."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.472 - Omar ibn Yazid narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), that He said: "If a believer passes away and forty men from among the believers attend their funeral and say:
Allāhumma innā lā na‘lam minhu illā khayran wa anta a‘lamu bihi minnā
'O’ Allah (swt), we do not know of anything but good from this person, and You know him better than we do,'
Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, responds, 'I have accepted your testimony and forgiven him for what I know that you do not.'"
arabicText: 472 - وَ رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِذَا مَاتَ اَلْمُؤْمِنُ فَحَضَرَ جَنَازَتَهُ أَرْبَعُونَ رَجُلاً مِنَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ قَالُوا: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا لاَ نَعْلَمُ مِنْهُ إِلاَّ خَيْراً وَ أَنْتَ أَعْلَمُ بِهِ مِنَّا قَالَ اَللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وتَعَالَى قَدْ أَجَزْتُ شَهَادَاتِكُمْ وَ غَفَرْتُ لَهُ مَا عَلِمْتُ مِمَّا لاَ تَعْلَمُونَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.472 - Omar ibn Yazid narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a believer passes away and forty men from among the believers attend their funeral and say:
Allāhumma innā lā na‘lam minhu illā khayran wa anta a‘lamu bihi minnā
'O’ Allah (swt), we do not know of anything but good from this person, and You know him better than we do,'
Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, responds, 'I have accepted your testimony and forgiven him for what I know that you do not.'"

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.473 - Al-Fadl ibn Abd al-Malik asked Imam (as): "Is it permissible to perform the funeral prayer for the deceased in the mosque?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes”.
arabicText: 473 - وَ سَأَلَهُ اَلْفَضْلُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْمَلِكِ: هَلْ يُصَلَّى عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ فِي اَلْمَسْجِدِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.474 - Abu Basir asked Imam (as) about who has the most right to perform the funeral prayer for a woman who has passed away.
Imam (as) replied: "Her husband."
Abu Basir then asked: "Does the husband have more right than her father, son, or brother?"
The Imam said: "Yes, and he may also wash her."
[AL SADUQ]
My father wrote in his message to me:
"Know, my son, that the person with the most right to lead the funeral prayer for the deceased is whoever is designated by the deceased's guardian (Wali). If there is a man from the Banu Hashim among the people, he has priority for leading the prayer if designated by the guardian of the deceased. If someone leads without being appointed by the deceased’s guardian, then they are usurping that right."
arabicText:
474 - وَ سَأَلَهُ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ: عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَمُوتُ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِالصَّلاَةِ عَلَيْهَا قَالَ «زَوْجُهَا» فَقَالَ لَهُ اَلزَّوْجُ أَحَقُّ مِنَ اَلْأَبِ وَ اَلْوَلَدِ وَ اَلْأَخِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ يُغَسِّلُهَا.
وقال أبي رحمه الله في رسالته إلي: إعلم يا بني أن أولى الناس بالصلاة على الميت من يقدمه ولي الميت، وإن كان في القوم رجل من بني هاشم فهو أحق بالصلاة عليه إذا قدمه ولي الميت، فان تقدم من غير أن يقدمه ولي الميت فهو غاصب.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.475 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"If you miss the funeral prayer for the deceased until they are buried, there is no problem in performing the prayer for them after they have been buried”.
arabicText: 475 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا فَاتَتْكَ اَلصَّلاَةُ عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ حَتَّى يُدْفَنَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تُصَلِّيَ عَلَيْهِ وَ قَدْ دُفِنَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.475 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you miss the funeral prayer for the deceased until they are buried, there is no problem in performing the prayer for them after they have been buried”.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.476 - "The Messenger of Allah (sw), if he missed the funeral prayer for a deceased person, would offer the prayer at their grave”.
arabicText: 476 - وَ كَانَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِذَا فَاتَتْهُ اَلصَّلاَةُ عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ صَلَّى عَلَى قَبْرِهِ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.477 - Al-Yasa' ibn Abdullah al-Qummi asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man praying over a funeral alone.
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, he may do so."
I then asked: "What if there are two people praying?"
The Imam said: "Yes, but one should stand behind the other, not next to him."
arabicText: 477 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْيَسَعُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْقُمِّيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي عَلَى اَلْجِنَازَةِ وَحْدَهُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ» قُلْتُ فَاثْنَانِ يُصَلِّيَانِ عَلَيْهَا قَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ لَكِنْ يَقُومُ اَلْآخَرُ خَلْفَ اَلْآخَرِ وَ لاَ يَقُومُ بِجَنْبِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.477 - Al-Yasa' ibn Abdullah al-Qummi asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man praying over a funeral alone.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Yes, he may do so."
I then asked: "What if there are two people praying?"
The Imam said: "Yes, but one should stand behind the other, not next to him."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.478 - Jabir said : Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"If no men are present for the deceased, a woman should step forward and stand in the middle, with the other women positioned on her right and left, and She should lead by reciting the takbirs until the prayer is completed."
arabicText: 478 - وَقَالَ جَابِرٌ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا لَمْ يَحْضُرِ اَلرِّجَالُ اَلْمَيِّتَ تَقَدَّمَتِ اَلْمَرْأَةُ وَسَطَهُنَّ وَ قَامَ اَلنِّسْوَةُ عَنْ يَمِينِهَا وَ شِمَالِهَا وَ هِيَ وَسَطُهُنَّ تُكَبِّرُ حَتَّى تَفْرُغَ مِنَ اَلصَّلاَةِ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.479 - Al-Hasan ibn Ziyad al-Sayqal reported that Imam Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about how women should perform the funeral prayer if no men are present.
Imam (as) replied: "They should all stand together in a single row, and no woman should step forward as a leader."
He was then asked if, during the obligatory (written) prayers, one woman may lead another.
The Imam said: "Yes."
arabicText: 479 - وَقَالَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ اَلصَّيْقَلُ: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ كَيْفَ تُصَلِّي اَلنِّسَاءُ عَلَى اَلْجَنَائِزِ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ مَعَهُنَّ رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ «يَقُمْنَ جَمِيعاً فِي صَفٍّ وَاحِدٍ وَ لاَ تَتَقَدَّمُهُنَّ اِمْرَأَةٌ» قِيلَ فَفِي صَلاَةٍ مَكْتُوبَةٍ أَ يَؤُمُّ بَعْضُهُنَّ بَعْضاً قَالَ «نَعَمْ.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.480 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Offer the funeral prayer for the stoned (person) from my Ummah and for the one who takes their own life from my Ummah, and do not leave anyone from my Ummah without the funeral prayer."
arabicText: 480 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «صَلُّوا عَلَى اَلْمَرْجُومِ مِنْ أُمَّتِي وَ عَلَى اَلْقَاتِلِ نَفْسَهُ مِنْ أُمَّتِي وَ لاَ تَدَعُوا أَحَداً مِنْ أُمَّتِي بِلاَ صَلاَةٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.480 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Offer the funeral prayer for the stoned (person) from my Ummah and for the one who takes their own life from my Ummah, and do not leave anyone from my Ummah without the funeral prayer."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.481 - Hisham ibn Salim asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about whether the funeral prayer should be offered for one who drinks alcohol, commits adultery (zina), or steals if they pass away.
Imam (as) replied: "Yes."
arabicText: 481 - وَ سَأَلَ هِشَامُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنْ شَارِبِ اَلْخَمْرِ وَ اَلزَّانِي وَ اَلسَّارِقِ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِمْ إِذَا مَاتُوا فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.481 - Hisham ibn Salim asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about whether the funeral prayer should be offered for one who drinks alcohol, commits adultery (zina), or steals if they pass away.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.482 - Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati said:
"I asked Imam Abu Abdullah (as) about a group of people who were traveling along the seashore and came across a dead man who was naked and had been cast ashore by the sea. They themselves were also without sufficient clothing, having only a single garment. How should they perform the funeral prayer for him since he was naked and they did not have an extra cloth to shroud him?"
Imam (as) replied: "A grave should be dug, and he should be placed in his burial niche, with bricks placed over his private parts to cover them. Then, the funeral prayer should be offered over him, and he should be buried."
arabicText: 482 - وَقَالَ عَمَّارُ بْنُ مُوسَى اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي قَوْمٍ كَانُوا فِي سَفَرٍ لَهُمْ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى سَاحِلِ اَلْبَحْرِ فَإِذَا هُمْ بِرَجُلٍ مَيِّتٍ عُرْيَانٍ قَدْ لَفَظَهُ اَلْبَحْرُ وَ هُمْ عُرَاةٌ لَيْسَ مَعَهُمْ إِلاَّ إِزَارٌ فَكَيْفَ يُصَلُّونَ عَلَيْهِ وَ هُوَ عُرْيَانٌ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُمْ فَضْلُ ثَوْبٍ يُكَفِّنُونَهُ بِهِ قَالَ «يُحْفَرُ لَهُ وَ يُوضَعُ فِي لَحْدِهِ وَ يُوضَعُ اَللَّبِنُ عَلَى عَوْرَتِهِ» لِتُسْتَرَ عَوْرَتُهُ بِاللَّبِنِ وَ بِالْحَجَرِ وَ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ يُدْفَنُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.482 - Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati said:
"I asked Imam Abu Abdullah (as) about a group of people who were traveling along the seashore and came across a dead man who was naked and had been cast ashore by the sea. They themselves were also without sufficient clothing, having only a single garment. How should they perform the funeral prayer for him since he was naked and they did not have an extra cloth to shroud him?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "A grave should be dug, and he should be placed in his burial niche, with bricks placed over his private parts to cover them. Then, the funeral prayer should be offered over him, and he should be buried."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.483 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), and him from his father, Imam al-Baqir: that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), once found scattered parts of a deceased person. He gathered them together, performed the funeral prayer over them, and then they were buried.
arabicText: 483 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَنَّ عَلِيّاً صَلَوَاتُ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ وَجَدَ قِطَعاً مِنْ مَيِّتٍ فَجُمِعَتْ ثُمَّ صَلَّى عَلَيْهَا ثُمَّ دُفِنَتْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.483 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), and him from his father, Imam al-Baqir:
thaqalaynMatn: that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), once found scattered parts of a deceased person. He gathered them together, performed the funeral prayer over them, and then they were buried.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.484 - Al-Fadl ibn 'Uthman al-A'war narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) and him from his father, Imam al-Baqir, regarding a man who is killed and his head is found in one tribe, his torso and hands in another tribe, and the rest of his body in a different tribe.
The Imam said: "The responsibility for his blood money (diyah) is upon the tribe where his torso and hands are found, and the funeral prayer should be performed over those parts”.
arabicText: 484 - وَ رَوَى اَلْفَضْلُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ اَلْأَعْوَرُ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يُقْتَلُ فَيُوجَدُ رَأْسُهُ فِي قَبِيلَةٍ وَ وَسَطُهُ وَ صَدْرُهُ وَ يَدَاهُ فِي قَبِيلَةٍ وَ اَلْبَاقِي مِنْهُ فِي قَبِيلَةٍ قَالَ «دِيَتُهُ عَلَى مَنْ وُجِدَ فِي قَبِيلَتِهِ صَدْرُهُ وَ يَدَاهُ وَ اَلصَّلاَةُ عَلَيْهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.484 - Al-Fadl ibn 'Uthman al-A'war narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) and him from his father, Imam al-Baqir, regarding a man who is killed and his head is found in one tribe, his torso and hands in another tribe, and the rest of his body in a different tribe.
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "The responsibility for his blood money (diyah) is upon the tribe where his torso and hands are found, and the funeral prayer should be performed over those parts”.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.485 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
“If a man is found killed and one of his limbs is found intact, a funeral prayer should be offered over it, and it should be buried. If no complete limb is found, no funeral prayer is offered, but it should still be buried”.
arabicText: 485 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِذَا وُجِدَ اَلرَّجُلُ قَتِيلاً فَإِنْ وُجِدَ لَهُ عُضْوٌ مِنْ أَعْضَائِهِ تَامّاً صُلِّيَ عَلَى ذَلِكَ وَ دُفِنَ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يُوجَدْ لَهُ عُضْوٌ تَامٌّ لَمْ يُصَلَّ عَلَيْهِ وَ دُفِنَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.485 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: “If a man is found killed and one of his limbs is found intact, a funeral prayer should be offered over it, and it should be buried. If no complete limb is found, no funeral prayer is offered, but it should still be buried”.

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.486 – Zurarah and Ubaidullah ibn Ali Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He was asked about when the funeral prayer should be offered for a child.
Imam (as) replied: "When the child understands the concept of prayer."
I asked: "At what age does prayer become obligatory for the child?"
Imam (as) replied: "When the child reaches six years old, and fasting becomes obligatory when they are capable of it."
arabicText: 486 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ وَ عُبَيْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ عَلَى اَلصَّبِيِّ مَتَى يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ فَقَالَ «إِذَا عَقَلَ اَلصَّلاَةَ» فَقُلْتُ مَتَى تَجِبُ اَلصَّلاَةُ عَلَيْهِ قَالَ «إِذَا كَانَ اِبْنَ سِتِّ سِنِينَ وَ اَلصِّيَامُ إِذَا أَطَاقَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.486 – Zurarah and Ubaidullah ibn Ali Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He was asked about when the funeral prayer should be offered for a child.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the child understands the concept of prayer."
I asked: "At what age does prayer become obligatory for the child?"
Imam (as) replied: "When the child reaches six years old, and fasting becomes obligatory when they are capable of it."

chapter: The Funeral Prayer (salat Al-janazah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.487 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) offered the funeral prayer for a young son of his who was three years old.
He then said: "If it were not for the fact that people might say that the Banu Hashim do not offer funeral prayers for their young children, I would not have prayed over him”.
arabicText: 487 - وَ صَلَّى أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَى اِبْنٍ لَهُ صَبِيٍّ صَغِيرٍ لَهُ ثَلاَثُ سِنِينَ ثُمَّ قَالَ - «لَوْ لاَ أَنَّ اَلنَّاسَ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّ بَنِي هَاشِمٍ لاَ يُصَلُّونَ عَلَى اَلصِّغَارِ مِنْ أَوْلاَدِهِمْ مَا صَلَّيْتُ عَلَيْهِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.487 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) offered the funeral prayer for a young son of his who was three years old.
He then said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If it were not for the fact that people might say that the Banu Hashim do not offer funeral prayers for their young children, I would not have prayed over him”.
