The Imam wrote in response: "That is permissible."
arabicText: 809 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ اَلصَّرْمِيِّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلثَّالِثَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ فِي اَلْخَزِّ يُغَشُّ بِوَبَرِ اَلْأَرَانِبِ فَكَتَبَ «يَجُوزُ ذَلِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.809 - It was narrated from Dawud al-Sarmi that a man asked Abu al-Hasan al-Thalith (Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as)), about praying in silk (khazz) that is mixed with rabbit fur.
The Imam wrote in response:
thaqalaynMatn: "That is permissible."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.810 - Ibrahim ibn Mahziyar wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as), asking about praying in garments dyed with crimson (qirmaz), saying, "Our companions avoid praying in it."
The Imam wrote back: "There is no problem with it at all, and all praise is due to Allah (swt)."
arabicText: 810 - وَ كَتَبَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ مَهْزِيَارَ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: يَسْأَلُهُ عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ فِي اَلْقِرْمِزِ فَإِنَّ أَصْحَابَنَا يَتَوَقَّوْنَ عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ فِيهِ فَكَتَبَ «لاَ بَأْسَ مُطْلَقٌ وَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.810 - Ibrahim ibn Mahziyar wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as), asking about praying in garments dyed with crimson (qirmaz), saying, "Our companions avoid praying in it."
The Imam wrote back:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no problem with it at all, and all praise is due to Allah (swt)."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.811 - He (Ibrahim ibn Mahziyar) wrote to Imam Abu Muhammad al-Hasan (as) asking about a man who replaces cotton in his cloak with qazz (a type of silk):
"Can he pray in it?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, there is no problem with it."
arabicText: 811 - وَ كَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ: فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَجْعَلُ فِي جُبَّتِهِ بَدَلَ اَلْقُطْنِ قَزّاً هَلْ يُصَلِّي فِيهِ فَكَتَبَ «نَعَمْ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.812 - Yusuf ibn Muhammad ibn Ibrahim narrated from the Imam (as) that He said:
"There is no issue if a garment's warp, buttons, or trim is made of silk; what is disliked for men is pure silk (mubham)”.
arabicText: 812 - وَ رَوَى يُوسُفُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْهُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «لاَ بَأْسَ بِالثَّوْبِ أَنْ يَكُونَ سَدَاهُ وَ زِرُّهُ وَ عَلَمُهُ حَرِيراً وَ إِنَّمَا يُكْرَهُ اَلْحَرِيرُ اَلْمُبْهَمُ لِلرِّجَالِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.812 - Yusuf ibn Muhammad ibn Ibrahim narrated from the Imam (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no issue if a garment's warp, buttons, or trim is made of silk; what is disliked for men is pure silk (mubham)”.

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.813 - It was narrated from Mus'ab ibn Abdul Malik al-Basri that He said:
"There is no issue in taking (a piece) from the silk covering of the Ka’ba and using it as a cover for a Quran or making it into a prayer mat to pray upon."
arabicText: 813 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ مِسْمَعُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْمَلِكِ اَلْبَصْرِيُّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْ دِيبَاجِ اَلْكَعْبَةِ فَيَجْعَلَهُ غِلاَفَ مُصْحَفٍ أَوْ يَجْعَلَهُ مُصَلًّى يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.813 - It was narrated from Mus'ab ibn Abdul Malik al-Basri that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no issue in taking (a piece) from the silk covering of the Ka’ba and using it as a cover for a Quran or making it into a prayer mat to pray upon."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.814 - Muhammad ibn Ismail ibn Bazi' asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), about praying in a garment with patterns (decorations), and the Imam disliked it if it contained images (representations).
arabicText: 814 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْمُعْلَمِ فَكَرِهَ مَا فِيهِ مِنَ اَلتَّمَاثِيلِ.

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.815 - Sama’a ibn Mehran asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about wearing a sword during prayer that has glue or leather (adhesive substances, such as glue made from animal parts) on it.
Imam (as) replied: "There is no problem as long as you do not know that it is from a dead (non-slaughtered) animal”.
arabicText: 815 - وَ سَأَلَ سَمَاعَةُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنْ تَقْلِيدِ اَلسَّيْفِ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ فِيهِ اَلْغِرَاءُ وَ اَلْكَيْمُخْتُ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ مَا لَمْ تَعْلَمْ أَنَّهُ مَيْتَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.815 - Sama’a ibn Mehran asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about wearing a sword during prayer that has glue or leather (adhesive substances, such as glue made from animal parts) on it.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "There is no problem as long as you do not know that it is from a dead (non-slaughtered) animal”.

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.816 - Ali ibn al-Rayan ibn al-Salt asked Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Thalith (as) about a man who cuts his hair or trims his nails and then proceeds to prayer without shaking the remnants off his clothes.
The Imam said: "There is no issue (no problem)."
arabicText: 816 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلرَّيَّانِ بْنِ اَلصَّلْتِ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلثَّالِثَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَأْخُذُ مِنْ شَعْرِهِ وَ أَظْفَارِهِ ثُمَّ يَقُومُ إِلَى اَلصَّلاَةِ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ يَنْفُضَهُ مِنْ ثَوْبِهِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.816 - Ali ibn al-Rayan ibn al-Salt asked Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Thalith (as) about a man who cuts his hair or trims his nails and then proceeds to prayer without shaking the remnants off his clothes.
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "There is no issue (no problem)."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.817 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man praying while wearing a burṭulah (a type of hat or head covering).
The Imam said: "It does not harm him (there is no issue)."
arabicText: 817 - وَ سَأَلَ يُونُسُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْبُرْطُلَةُ فَقَالَ «لاَ يَضُرُّهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.817 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man praying while wearing a burṭulah (a type of hat or head covering).
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "It does not harm him (there is no issue)."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.818 - Ammar al-Sabati narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said: "Whoever goes out on a journey without wrapping the turban under his chin and suffers from an ailment for which there is no remedy, let him blame none but himself”.
arabicText: 818 - وَ رَوَى عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ - «مَنْ خَرَجَ فِي سَفَرٍ فَلَمْ يُدِرِ اَلْعِمَامَةَ تَحْتَ حَنَكِهِ فَأَصَابَهُ أَلَمٌ لاَ دَوَاءَ لَهُ فَلاَ يَلُومَنَّ إِلاَّ نَفْسَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.818 - Ammar al-Sabati narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever goes out on a journey without wrapping the turban under his chin and suffers from an ailment for which there is no remedy, let him blame none but himself”.

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.819 - The truthful one, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"I guarantee that whoever leaves his house with his turban wrapped under his chin will return to it safely."
arabicText: 819 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «ضَمِنْتُ لِمَنْ خَرَجَ مِنْ بَيْتِهِ مُعْتَمّاً تَحْتَ حَنَكِهِ أَنْ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْهِمْ سَالِماً».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.819 - The truthful one, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I guarantee that whoever leaves his house with his turban wrapped under his chin will return to it safely."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.820 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"I am amazed by one who goes about seeking to fulfil a need while in a state of ritual purity (wudu) — how is it that his need is not met?
And I am amazed by one who seeks to fulfil a need while wearing his turban wrapped under his chin — how is it that his need is not met?"
arabicText: 820 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنِّي لَأَعْجَبُ مِمَّنْ يَأْخُذُ فِي حَاجَةٍ وَ هُوَ عَلَى وُضُوءٍ كَيْفَ لاَ تُقْضَى حَاجَتُهُ وَ إِنِّي لَأَعْجَبُ مِمَّنْ يَأْخُذُ فِي حَاجَةٍ وَ هُوَ مُعْتَمٌّ تَحْتَ حَنَكِهِ كَيْفَ لاَ تُقْضَى حَاجَتُهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.820 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I am amazed by one who goes about seeking to fulfil a need while in a state of ritual purity (wudu) — how is it that his need is not met?
And I am amazed by one who seeks to fulfil a need while wearing his turban wrapped under his chin — how is it that his need is not met?"

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.821 - The Prophet, said: "The distinction between the Muslims and the polytheists is the wearing of turbans."
arabicText: 821 - وَقَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اَلْفَرْقُ بَيْنَ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ وَ اَلْمُشْرِكِينَ اَلتَّلَحِّي بِالْعَمَائِمِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.821 - The Prophet, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The distinction between the Muslims and the polytheists is the wearing of turbans."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.822 - It has also been reported from the Messenger, by those outside the Shi'a tradition that he commanded the wearing of turbans (tallaḥḥi) and forbade wrapping without a tail (iqti'āṭ).
arabicText: 822 - وَ قَدْ نَقَلَ عَنْهُ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أَهْلُ اَلْخِلاَفِ أَيْضاً: أَنَّهُ أَمَرَ بِالتَّلَحِّي وَ نَهَى عَنِ اَلاِقْتِعَاطِ.

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.823 - Al-Halabi and Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) whether a man may recite during prayer with his garment covering his mouth.
The Imam said: "There is no issue with that."
In another narration by Al-Halabi, it is added: "As long as he can hear his murmuring (sound of his recitation)”.
arabicText: 823 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ وَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: هَلْ يَقْرَأُ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي صَلاَتِهِ وَ ثَوْبُهُ عَلَى فِيهِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ. وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ: «إِذَا سَمِعَ اَلْهَمْهَمَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.823 - Al-Halabi and Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) whether a man may recite during prayer with his garment covering his mouth.
thaqalaynMatn:
The Imam said: "There is no issue with that."
In another narration by Al-Halabi, it is added: "As long as he can hear his murmuring (sound of his recitation)”.

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.824 - Rifa'ah ibn Musa asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a person who is dyed (with henna or similar) and whether they can pray while in this state if they are able to perform prostration and recitation.
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, as long as their cloth (used during the process) is pure and they are in a state of wudu (ritual purity). There is also no issue if a woman prays while She is dyed and her hands are bound (covered)."
arabicText: 824 - وَ سَأَلَ رِفَاعَةُ بْنُ مُوسَى أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْمُخْتَضِبِ إِذَا تَمَكَّنَ مِنَ اَلسُّجُودِ وَ اَلْقِرَاءَةِ أَ يُصَلِّي فِي خِضَابِهِ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ إِذَا كَانَتْ خِرْقَتُهُ طَاهِرَةً وَ كَانَ مُتَوَضِّئاً وَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تُصَلِّيَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ وَ هِيَ مُخْتَضِبَةٌ وَ يَدَاهَا مَرْبُوطَتَانِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.824 - Rifa'ah ibn Musa asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a person who is dyed (with henna or similar) and whether they can pray while in this state if they are able to perform prostration and recitation.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "Yes, as long as their cloth (used during the process) is pure and they are in a state of wudu (ritual purity). There is also no issue if a woman prays while She is dyed and her hands are bound (covered)."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.825 - Ali ibn Ja'far and Ali ibn Yaqtin asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about whether a man and a woman may pray while dyed with henna or wasmah (a type of dye).
Imam (as) said: "If they expose the mouth and nostrils, there is no problem."
arabicText: 825 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ يَقْطِينٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: أَنَّهُمَا سَأَلاَهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ وَ اَلْمَرْأَةِ يَخْتَضِبَانِ أَ يُصَلِّيَانِ وَ هُمَا مُخْتَضِبَانِ بِالْحِنَّاءِ وَ اَلْوَسِمَةِ فَقَالَ «إِذَا أَبْرَزُوا اَلْفَمَ وَ اَلْمَنْخِرَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.825 - Ali ibn Ja'far and Ali ibn Yaqtin asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about whether a man and a woman may pray while dyed with henna or wasmah (a type of dye).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If they expose the mouth and nostrils, there is no problem."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.826 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about a man praying without taking his hands out of his garment.
The Imam said: "If he takes his hands out, it is good, but if he does not, there is no issue (no problem)."
arabicText: 826 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَ لاَ يُخْرِجُ يَدَيْهِ مِنْ ثَوْبِهِ فَقَالَ «إِنْ أَخْرَجَ يَدَيْهِ فَهُوَ حَسَنٌ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يُخْرِجْ يَدَيْهِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.826 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about a man praying without taking his hands out of his garment.
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "If he takes his hands out, it is good, but if he does not, there is no issue (no problem)."

chapter: What Garments Are Permissible for Prayer and What Garments Are Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.827 - Ziyad ibn Suqah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said: "There is no issue if one of you prays in a single garment with its buttons undone. Indeed, the religion of Muhammad (sw) is upright (easy and straightforward)."
arabicText: 827 - وَ رَوَى زِيَادُ بْنُ سُوقَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُصَلِّيَ أَحَدُكُمْ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْوَاحِدِ وَ أَزْرَارُهُ مَحْلُولَةٌ إِنَّ دِينَ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ حَنِيفٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.827 - Ziyad ibn Suqah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that
thaqalaynMatn: He said: "There is no issue if one of you prays in a single garment with its buttons undone. Indeed, the religion of Muhammad (sw) is upright (easy and straightforward)."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.828 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Prostration (Sujood) on the earth is obligatory (fardh), while prostrating on other than that is a recommended practice (sunnah)."
arabicText: 828 - قال الصادق عليه السلام: " السجود على الأرض فريضة وعلى غير ذلك سنة.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.828 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Prostration (Sujood) on the earth is obligatory (fardh), while prostrating on other than that is a recommended practice (sunnah)."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.829 - Imam (as) said:
"Prostrating on the clay from the grave of Imam Hussain ibn Ali (as) illuminates to the seventh layer of the earth."
arabicText: 829 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلسُّجُودُ عَلَى طِينِ قَبْرِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُنَوِّرُ إِلَى اَلْأَرْضِ اَلسَّابِعَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.829 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Prostrating on the clay from the grave of Imam Hussain ibn Ali (as) illuminates to the seventh layer of the earth."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.830 - Hamad ibn Uthman narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"Prostration is to be done on what the earth produces, except for that which is eaten or worn."
arabicText: 830 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «اَلسُّجُودُ عَلَى مَا أَنْبَتَتِ اَلْأَرْضُ إِلاَّ مَا أُكِلَ أَوْ لُبِسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.830 - Hamad ibn Uthman narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Prostration is to be done on what the earth produces, except for that which is eaten or worn."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.831 - It was narrated from the Yāsir al-Khadim that He said:
"Abu al-Hasan (as) passed by me while I was praying on a piece of ṭabarī (a mat) upon which I had placed something.
Imam (as) said to me: 'Why do you not prostrate on it? Is it not from what the earth produces?'"
arabicText: 831 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ يَاسِرٍ اَلْخَادِمِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: مَرَّ بِي أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَنَا أُصَلِّي عَلَى اَلطَّبَرِيِّ وَ قَدْ أَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْهِ شَيْئاً فَقَالَ لِي «مَا لَكَ لاَ تَسْجُدُ عَلَيْهِ أَ لَيْسَ هُوَ مِنْ نَبَاتِ اَلْأَرْضِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.831 - It was narrated from the Yāsir al-Khadim that He said:
"Abu al-Hasan (as) passed by me while I was praying on a piece of ṭabarī (a mat) upon which I had placed something.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said to me: 'Why do you not prostrate on it? Is it not from what the earth produces?'"

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.832 - Al-Mu'alla ibn Khunays asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about praying on qufr (bare ground or desert soil) and qīr (a type of tar or pitch).
Imam (as) said: "There is no issue with it”.
arabicText: 832 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْمُعَلَّى بْنُ خُنَيْسٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ عَلَى اَلْقُفْرِ وَ اَلْقِيرِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.832 - Al-Mu'alla ibn Khunays asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about praying on qufr (bare ground or desert soil) and qīr (a type of tar or pitch).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no issue with it”.

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.833 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub asked Imam Abu al-Hasan (as) about gypsum (plaster) that was fired using dung and the bones of the dead, and whether it would be permissible to prostrate on it if a mosque was plastered with it.
The Imam wrote back in his own handwriting: "Fire and water have purified it”.
arabicText: 833 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْجِصِّ يُوقَدُ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَذِرَةِ وَ عِظَامِ اَلْمَوْتَى ثُمَّ يُجَصَّصُ بِهِ اَلْمَسْجِدُ أَ يُسْجَدُ عَلَيْهِ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِلَيْهِ بِخَطِّهِ «أَنَّ اَلنَّارَ وَ اَلْمَاءَ قَدْ طَهَّرَاهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.833 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub asked Imam Abu al-Hasan (as) about gypsum (plaster) that was fired using dung and the bones of the dead, and whether it would be permissible to prostrate on it if a mosque was plastered with it.
The Imam wrote back in his own handwriting:
thaqalaynMatn: "Fire and water have purified it”.

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.834 - Dawud ibn Abi Zayd asked Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Thalith (as) about prostrating on papers and documents with writing on them.
The Imam wrote back: "It is permissible."
arabicText: 834 - وَ سَأَلَ دَاوُدُ بْنُ أَبِي زَيْدٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلثَّالِثَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْقَرَاطِيسِ وَ اَلْكَوَاغِذِ اَلْمَكْتُوبَةِ عَلَيْهَا هَلْ يَجُوزُ عَلَيْهَا اَلسُّجُودُ فَكَتَبَ «يَجُوزُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.834 - Dawud ibn Abi Zayd asked Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Thalith (as) about prostrating on papers and documents with writing on them.
The Imam wrote back:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is permissible."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.835 - Ali ibn Yaqtin asked Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as) about a man prostrating on a misḥ (a type of mat or rug) and on a carpet.
The Imam said: "There is no issue if it is in a situation of taqiyya (precautionary dissimulation to protect oneself)."
arabicText: 835 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ يَقْطِينٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَسْجُدُ عَلَى اَلْمِسْحِ وَ اَلْبِسَاطِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ إِذَا كَانَ فِي حَالِ اَلتَّقِيَّةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.835 - Ali ibn Yaqtin asked Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as) about a man prostrating on a misḥ (a type of mat or rug) and on a carpet.
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "There is no issue if it is in a situation of taqiyya (precautionary dissimulation to protect oneself)."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.836 - Muawiya ibn Ammar asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about praying on qār (bitumen or tar).
The Imam said: "There is no issue with it”.
arabicText: 836 - وَ سَأَلَ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ عَلَى اَلْقَارِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.836 - Muawiya ibn Ammar asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about praying on qār (bitumen or tar).
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "There is no issue with it”.

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.837 - Zurarah narrated from one of the Imams (as) that He said:
"I asked him about a man prostrating while wearing a cap or a turban.
Imam (as) said: 'If any part of his forehead touches the ground, between his eyebrows and his hairline, then it suffices.'"
arabicText:
¸
837 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَسْجُدُ وَ عَلَيْهِ قَلَنْسُوَةٌ أَوْ عِمَامَةٌ فَقَالَ «إِذَا مَسَّ شَيْءٌ مِنْ جَبْهَتِهِ اَلْأَرْضَ فِيمَا بَيْنَ حَاجِبَيْهِ وَ قُصَاصِ شَعْرِهِ فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَ عَنْهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.837 - Zurarah narrated from one of the Imams (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked him about a man prostrating while wearing a cap or a turban.
Imam (as) said: 'If any part of his forehead touches the ground, between his eyebrows and his hairline, then it suffices.'"

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.838 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub said:
"I saw Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) leveling the pebbles at the place of his prostration between the two prostrations."
arabicText: 838 - وَقَالَ يُونُسُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ: رَأَيْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُسَوِّي اَلْحَصَى فِي مَوْضِعِ سُجُودِهِ بَيْنَ اَلسَّجْدَتَيْنِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.838 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I saw Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) leveling the pebbles at the place of his prostration between the two prostrations."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.839 - It was narrated from Ali ibn Bajil that He said:
"I saw Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), every time he prostrated and then raised his head, he would take the pebbles from his forehead and place them back on the ground."
arabicText: 839 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ بَجِيلٍ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ جَعْفَرَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ كُلَّمَا سَجَدَ فَرَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ أَخَذَ اَلْحَصَى مِنْ جَبْهَتِهِ فَوَضَعَهُ عَلَى اَلْأَرْضِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.839 - It was narrated from Ali ibn Bajil that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I saw Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), every time he prostrated and then raised his head, he would take the pebbles from his forehead and place them back on the ground."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.840 - Ammar al-Sabati narrate from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"The area between the hairline and the tip of the nose is considered a place of prostration (masjid), so whatever part of it touches the ground suffices."
arabicText: 840 - وَ رَوَى عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «مَا بَيْنَ قُصَاصِ اَلشَّعْرِ إِلَى طَرَفِ اَلْأَنْفِ مَسْجِدٌ فَمَا أَصَابَ اَلْأَرْضَ مِنْهُ فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.840 - Ammar al-Sabati narrate from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The area between the hairline and the tip of the nose is considered a place of prostration (masjid), so whatever part of it touches the ground suffices."

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.841 - A man asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) bout a place with dust where he wanted to blow it away before prostrating.
The Imam said: "There is no issue”.
arabicText: 841 - وَ سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ اَلصَّادِقَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْمَكَانِ يَكُونُ فِيهِ اَلْغُبَارُ فَأَنْفُخُهُ إِذَا أَرَدْتُ اَلسُّجُودَ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.841 - A man asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) bout a place with dust where he wanted to blow it away before prostrating.
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "There is no issue”.

chapter: What Can and Cannot Be Used for Prostration
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.842 - It was narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"It is disliked (makruh) because it may cause harm to the person next to him."
arabicText: 842 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِنَّمَا يُكْرَهُ ذَلِكَ خَشْيَةَ أَنْ يُؤْذَى مَنْ إِلَى جَانِبِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.842 - It was narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is disliked (makruh) because it may cause harm to the person next to him."

chapter: The Reason for the Prohibition of Prostration on Food, Clothing, and Other Materials Except for Earth and What it Grows
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.843 - Hisham ibn al-Hakam said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"Tell me about what is permissible to prostrate on and what is not."
Imam (as) replied: "Prostration is only permissible on the earth or what grows from the earth, except for what is eaten or worn."
Hisham then asked: "May I be your ransom, what is the reason for that?"
The Imam said: "Prostration is an act of humility before Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, and it should not be on what is eaten or worn because the people of the world are slaves to what they eat and wear.
The one who prostrates in worship of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, should not place his forehead on what is worshipped by the people of the world who are deceived by its allure. Prostration on the earth is superior because it is more effective in demonstrating humility and submission to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText: 843 - قَالَ هِشَامُ بْنُ اَلْحَكَمِ ، لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: أَخْبِرْنِي عَمَّا يَجُوزُ اَلسُّجُودُ عَلَيْهِ وَ عَمَّا لاَ يَجُوزُ قَالَ «اَلسُّجُودُ لاَ يَجُوزُ إِلاَّ عَلَى اَلْأَرْضِ أَوْ عَلَى مَا أَنْبَتَتِ اَلْأَرْضُ إِلاَّ مَا أُكِلَ أَوْ لُبِسَ» فَقَالَ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ مَا اَلْعِلَّةُ فِي ذَلِكَ قَالَ «لِأَنَّ اَلسُّجُودَ خُضُوعٌ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَلاَ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَكُونَ عَلَى مَا يُؤْكَلُ أَوْ يُلْبَسُ لِأَنَّ أَبْنَاءَ اَلدُّنْيَا عَبِيدُ مَا يَأْكُلُونَ وَ يَلْبَسُونَ وَ اَلسَّاجِدُ فِي سُجُودِهِ فِي عِبَادَةِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَلاَ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَضَعَ جَبْهَتَهُ فِي سُجُودِهِ عَلَى مَعْبُودِ أَبْنَاءِ اَلدُّنْيَا اَلَّذِينَ اِغْتَرُّوا بِغُرُورِهَا وَ اَلسُّجُودُ عَلَى اَلْأَرْضِ أَفْضَلُ لِأَنَّهُ أَبْلَغُ فِي اَلتَّوَاضُعِ وَ اَلْخُضُوعِ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.843 - Hisham ibn al-Hakam said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"Tell me about what is permissible to prostrate on and what is not."
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Prostration is only permissible on the earth or what grows from the earth, except for what is eaten or worn."
Hisham then asked: "May I be your ransom, what is the reason for that?"
The Imam said: "Prostration is an act of humility before Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, and it should not be on what is eaten or worn because the people of the world are slaves to what they eat and wear.
The one who prostrates in worship of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, should not place his forehead on what is worshipped by the people of the world who are deceived by its allure. Prostration on the earth is superior because it is more effective in demonstrating humility and submission to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.844 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said :
"Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, made the Ka’ba the Qiblah (direction of prayer) for the people of the mosque (Masjid al-Haram), and He made the mosque the Qiblah for the people of the sanctuary (Haram), and He made the sanctuary the Qiblah for the people of the world."
arabicText: 844 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وتَعَالَى جَعَلَ اَلْكَعْبَةَ قِبْلَةً لِأَهْلِ اَلْمَسْجِدِ وَ جَعَلَ اَلْمَسْجِدَ قِبْلَةً لِأَهْلِ اَلْحَرَمِ وَ جَعَلَ اَلْحَرَمَ قِبْلَةً لِأَهْلِ اَلدُّنْيَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.844 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said :
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, made the Ka’ba the Qiblah (direction of prayer) for the people of the mosque (Masjid al-Haram), and He made the mosque the Qiblah for the people of the sanctuary (Haram), and He made the sanctuary the Qiblah for the people of the world."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.845 - Al-Mufaddal ibn Umar asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the deviation of some of our companions to the left from the Qiblah and the reason for it.
Imam (as) replied: "When the Black Stone (Hajar al-Aswad) was brought down from Paradise and placed in its position, the boundaries of the Haram (sanctuary) were determined by the reach of the light emanating from the Stone. It is four miles to the right of the Ka’ba and eight miles to the left, making a total of twelve miles.
Thus, if a person deviates to the right, they leave the boundary of the Qiblah due to the lesser extent of the Haram's boundary, but if they deviate to the left, they do not leave the boundary of the Qiblah."
arabicText: 845 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْمُفَضَّلُ بْنُ عُمَرَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلتَّحْرِيفِ لِأَصْحَابِنَا ذَاتَ اَلْيَسَارِ عَنِ اَلْقِبْلَةِ وَ عَنِ اَلسَّبَبِ فِيهِ فَقَالَ «إِنَّ اَلْحَجَرَ اَلْأَسْوَدَ لَمَّا أُنْزِلَ مِنَ اَلْجَنَّةِ وَ وُضِعَ فِي مَوْضِعِهِ جُعِلَ أَنْصَابُ اَلْحَرَمِ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَحِقَهُ اَلنُّورُ نُورُ اَلْحَجَرِ فَهُوَ عَنْ يَمِينِ اَلْكَعْبَةِ أَرْبَعَةُ أَمْيَالٍ وَ عَنْ يَسَارِهَا ثَمَانِيَةُ أَمْيَالٍ كُلُّهُ اِثْنَا عَشَرَ مِيلاً فَإِذَا اِنْحَرَفَ اَلْإِنْسَانُ ذَاتَ اَلْيَمِينِ خَرَجَ عَنْ حَدِّ اَلْقِبْلَةِ لِقِلَّةِ أَنْصَابِ اَلْحَرَمِ وَ إِذَا اِنْحَرَفَ اَلْإِنْسَانُ ذَاتَ اَلْيَسَارِ لَمْ يَكُنْ خَارِجاً عَنْ حَدِّ اَلْقِبْلَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.845 - Al-Mufaddal ibn Umar asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the deviation of some of our companions to the left from the Qiblah and the reason for it.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the Black Stone (Hajar al-Aswad) was brought down from Paradise and placed in its position, the boundaries of the Haram (sanctuary) were determined by the reach of the light emanating from the Stone. It is four miles to the right of the Ka’ba and eight miles to the left, making a total of twelve miles.
Thus, if a person deviates to the right, they leave the boundary of the Qiblah due to the lesser extent of the Haram's boundary, but if they deviate to the left, they do not leave the boundary of the Qiblah."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.847 – Zurarah and Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"For one who is confused (about the direction of the Qiblah), it suffices for him to pray in whichever direction he faces if he does not know where the Qiblah is."
arabicText: 847 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «يُجْزِي اَلْمُتَحَيِّرَ أَبَداً أَيْنَمَا تَوَجَّهَ إِذَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ أَيْنَ وَجْهُ اَلْقِبْلَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.847 – Zurarah and Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For one who is confused (about the direction of the Qiblah), it suffices for him to pray in whichever direction he faces if he does not know where the Qiblah is."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.848 - Muawiya ibn Ammar asked Him about a man who stands for prayer and, after finishing, realizes that he had deviated to the right or the left of the Qiblah.
Imam (as) replied: "His prayer is valid, for the area between the east and the west is (considered) the Qiblah."
arabicText: 848 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَقُومُ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ ثُمَّ يَنْظُرُ بَعْدَ مَا فَرَغَ فَيَرَى أَنَّهُ قَدِ اِنْحَرَفَ عَنِ اَلْقِبْلَةِ يَمِيناً أَوْ شِمَالاً فَقَالَ لَهُ «قَدْ مَضَتْ صَلاَتُهُ وَ مَا بَيْنَ اَلْمَشْرِقِ وَ اَلْمَغْرِبِ قِبْلَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.848 - Muawiya ibn Ammar asked Him about a man who stands for prayer and, after finishing, realizes that he had deviated to the right or the left of the Qiblah.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "His prayer is valid, for the area between the east and the west is (considered) the Qiblah."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.849 - Muhammad ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as) that He said:
"If a seepage (liquid or discharge) appears behind a latrine (toilet) and it is in the direction of the Qiblah, one should cover it with something."
arabicText: 849 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِذَا ظَهَرَ اَلنَّزُّ مِنْ خَلْفِ اَلْكَنِيفِ وَ هُوَ فِي اَلْقِبْلَةِ يَسْتُرُهُ بِشَيْءٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.849 - Muhammad ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a seepage (liquid or discharge) appears behind a latrine (toilet) and it is in the direction of the Qiblah, one should cover it with something."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.850 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) forbade spitting in the direction of the Qiblah.
arabicText: 850 - وَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ، عَنِ اَلْبُزَاقِ فِي اَلْقِبْلَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.850 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (sw) forbade spitting in the direction of the Qiblah.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.851 - The Prophet (sw) saw phlegm (or a spittle) in the mosque. He walked over to it with a palm branch from the branches of Ibn Tab and scraped it off, then returned backward and continued his prayer.
And Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "This opens many doors regarding (permissible) actions during prayer."
arabicText: 851 - وَ رَأَى ص نُخَامَةً فِي اَلْمَسْجِدِ فَمَشَى إِلَيْهَا بِعُرْجُونٍ مِنْ عَرَاجِينِ اِبْنِ طَابٍ فَحَكَّهَا ثُمَّ رَجَعَ اَلْقَهْقَرَى فَبَنَى عَلَى صَلاَتِهِ وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «وَ هَذَا يَفْتَحُ مِنَ اَلصَّلاَةِ أَبْوَاباً كَثِيرَةً.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.852 - The Prophet, forbade engaging in sexual intercourse while facing or with one's back to the Qiblah.
He also forbade facing the Qiblah when urinating or defecating.
arabicText: 852 - وَ نَهَى صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنِ اَلْجِمَاعِ مُسْتَقْبِلَ اَلْقِبْلَةِ وَ مُسْتَدْبِرَهَا وَ نَهَى عَنِ اِسْتِقْبَالِ اَلْقِبْلَةِ بِبَوْلٍ أَوْ غَائِطٍ.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.853 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"None of you should spit in front of themselves or to their right while praying. Instead, they should spit to their left or beneath their left foot."
arabicText: 853 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ يَبْزُقَنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ قِبَلَ وَجْهِهِ وَ لاَ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ وَ لْيَبْزُقْ عَنْ يَسَارِهِ وَ تَحْتِ قَدَمِهِ اَلْيُسْرَى.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.853 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "None of you should spit in front of themselves or to their right while praying. Instead, they should spit to their left or beneath their left foot."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.854 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever holds back their saliva out of reverence for Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, during prayer, Allah (swt) will grant them health until their death."
arabicText: 854 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ حَبَسَ رِيقَهُ إِجْلاَلاً لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي صَلاَتِهِ أَوْرَثَهُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى صِحَّةً حَتَّى اَلْمَمَاتِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.854 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever holds back their saliva out of reverence for Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, during prayer, Allah (swt) will grant them health until their death."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.855 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"There is no prayer except toward the Qiblah."
Zurarah asked: "And where is the boundary of the Qiblah?"
Imam (as) replied: "The entire area between the east and the west is the Qiblah."
Zurarah then asked: "What if someone prays facing a direction other than the Qiblah, or on a cloudy day when they miss the correct time?"
Imam (as) said: "They must repeat the prayer”.
arabicText: 855 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ صَلاَةَ إِلاَّ إِلَى اَلْقِبْلَةِ» قَالَ قُلْتُ وَ أَيْنَ حَدُّ اَلْقِبْلَةِ قَالَ «مَا بَيْنَ اَلْمَشْرِقِ وَ اَلْمَغْرِبِ قِبْلَةٌ كُلُّهُ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَمَنْ صَلَّى لِغَيْرِ اَلْقِبْلَةِ أَوْ فِي يَوْمِ غَيْمٍ فِي غَيْرِ اَلْوَقْتِ قَالَ «يُعِيدُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.855 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no prayer except toward the Qiblah."
Zurarah asked: "And where is the boundary of the Qiblah?"
Imam (as) replied: "The entire area between the east and the west is the Qiblah."
Zurarah then asked: "What if someone prays facing a direction other than the Qiblah, or on a cloudy day when they miss the correct time?"
Imam (as) said: "They must repeat the prayer”.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.856 - In another narration, the Imam said :
"Then turn your face toward the Qiblah and do not turn your face away from the Qiblah, lest your prayer become invalid. Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, says to His Prophet in the obligatory prayer:
'Turn your face toward the Sacred Mosque (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:144); and wherever you are, turn your faces toward it.' Stand upright."
The Prophet (sw) said: "Whoever does not straighten their spine (while standing) has no prayer."
And lower your gaze in humility before Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic; do not raise it to the sky. Let your gaze be directed in front of you toward your place of prostration”.
arabicText: 856 - وَقَالَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ ذَكَرَهُ لَهُ: «ثُمَّ اِسْتَقْبِلِ اَلْقِبْلَةَ بِوَجْهِكَ وَ لاَ تَقَلَّبْ بِوَجْهِكَ عَنِ اَلْقِبْلَةِ فَتَفْسُدَ صَلاَتُكَ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ لِنَبِيِّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فِي اَلْفَرِيضَةِ «فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلْحَرٰامِ وَ حَيْثُ مٰا كُنْتُمْ فَوَلُّوا وُجُوهَكُمْ شَطْرَهُ» فَقُمْ مُنْتَصِباً» فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ «مَنْ لَمْ يُقِمْ صُلْبَهُ فَلاَ صَلاَةَ لَهُ وَ اِخْشَعْ بِبَصَرِكَ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لاَ تَرْفَعْهُ إِلَى اَلسَّمَاءِ وَ لْيَكُنْ حِذَاءَ وَجْهِكَ فِي مَوْضِعِ سُجُودِكَ.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.857 - Imam (as) said to Zurarah:
"The prayer is not to be repeated except for five things: purification (taharah), time (observing the prayer time), facing the Qiblah, bowing (ruku'), and prostration (Sujood)”.
arabicText: 857 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِزُرَارَةَ: «لاَ تُعَادُ اَلصَّلاَةُ إِلاَّ مِنْ خَمْسَةٍ اَلطَّهُورِ وَ اَلْوَقْتِ وَ اَلْقِبْلَةِ وَ اَلرُّكُوعِ وَ اَلسُّجُودِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.857 - Imam (as) said to Zurarah:
thaqalaynMatn: "The prayer is not to be repeated except for five things: purification (taharah), time (observing the prayer time), facing the Qiblah, bowing (ruku'), and prostration (Sujood)”.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.858 - It is narrated that "If the wind blows strongly upon someone on a ship, and they are unable to turn toward the Qiblah, they should pray facing the front of the ship”.
arabicText: 858 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ إِذَا عَصَفَتِ اَلرِّيحُ بِمَنْ فِي اَلسَّفِينَةِ وَ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى أَنْ يَدُورَ إِلَى اَلْقِبْلَةِ صَلَّى إِلَى صَدْرِ اَلسَّفِينَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.858 - It is narrated that
thaqalaynMatn: "If the wind blows strongly upon someone on a ship, and they are unable to turn toward the Qiblah, they should pray facing the front of the ship”.

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.859 - The Prophet, said:
"Every preacher is a Qiblah, and every one being preached to is a Qiblah for the preacher."
arabicText: 859 - وَقَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «كُلُّ وَاعِظٍ قِبْلَةٌ وَ كُلُّ مَوْعُوظٍ قِبْلَةٌ لِلْوَاعِظِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.859 - The Prophet, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Every preacher is a Qiblah, and every one being preached to is a Qiblah for the preacher."

chapter: The Chapter of the Qibla
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.860 - A man said to Imam Al-Sadiq (as):
"I am sometimes traveling and cannot determine the Qiblah at night."
The Imam asked: "Do you know the star that is called 'al-Jady' (the North Star)?"
The man replied: "Yes."
The Imam said: "Place it to your right, and if you are on the pilgrimage route, place it between your shoulders”.
arabicText: 860 - وَقَالَ رَجُلٌ لِلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: إِنِّي أَكُونُ فِي اَلسَّفَرِ وَ لاَ أَهْتَدِي إِلَى اَلْقِبْلَةِ بِاللَّيْلِ فَقَالَ «أَ تَعْرِفُ اَلْكَوْكَبَ اَلَّذِي يُقَالُ لَهُ اَلْجَدْيَ» قُلْتُ نَعَمْ قَالَ «فَاجْعَلْهُ عَلَى يَمِينِكَ وَ إِذَا كُنْتَ عَلَى طَرِيقِ اَلْحَجِّ فَاجْعَلْهُ بَيْنَ كَتِفَيْكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.860 - A man said to Imam Al-Sadiq (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I am sometimes traveling and cannot determine the Qiblah at night."
The Imam asked: "Do you know the star that is called 'al-Jady' (the North Star)?"
The man replied: "Yes."
The Imam said: "Place it to your right, and if you are on the pilgrimage route, place it between your shoulders”.

chapter: The Age at Which Children Are Required to Pray
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.861 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"We command our children to pray when they are five years old, so you should instruct your children to pray when they are seven years old.
We also command our children to fast when they are seven years old, as much as they can bear of fasting for the day — whether it is until midday, more, or less. If thirst or hunger overwhelms them, they may break their fast so that they can gradually get accustomed to fasting and be able to bear it. So, instruct your children to fast when they are nine years old, as much as they are capable of fasting for the day. If thirst overwhelms them, they may break their fast."
arabicText: 861 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: « إِنَّا نَأْمُرُ صِبْيَانَنَا بِالصَّلاَةِ وَ هُمْ أَبْنَاءُ خَمْسِ سِنِينَ فَمُرُوا صِبْيَانَكُمْ بِالصَّلاَةِ إِذَا كَانُوا أَبْنَاءَ سَبْعِ سِنِينَ وَ نَحْنُ نَأْمُرُ صِبْيَانَنَا بِالصِّيَامِ إِذَا كَانُوا أَبْنَاءَ سَبْعِ سِنِينَ مَا أَطَاقُوا مِنْ صِيَامِ اَلْيَوْمِ إِنْ كَانَ إِلَى نِصْفِ اَلنَّهَارِ أَوْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ ذَلِكَ أَوْ أَقَلَّ فَإِذَا غَلَبَهُمُ اَلْعَطَشُ أَوِ اَلْجُوعُ أَفْطَرُوا حَتَّى يَتَعَوَّدُوا اَلصَّوْمَ وَ يُطِيقُوهُ فَمُرُوا صِبْيَانَكُمْ بِالصِّيَامِ إِذَا كَانُوا أَبْنَاءَ تِسْعِ سِنِينَ مَا أَطَاقُوهُ مِنْ صِيَامِ اَلْيَوْمِ فَإِذَا غَلَبَهُمُ اَلْعَطَشُ أَفْطَرُوا.

chapter: The Age at Which Children Are Required to Pray
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.862 - It is narrated from al-Hasan ibn Qarin that He said:
"I asked Imam al-Ridha (as), or he was asked while I was listening, about a man who circumcises his son, and the boy does not pray for a day or two."
Imam (as) asked: "How old is the boy?"
The response was, "Eight years old."
Imam (as) said: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! He leaves prayer?"
The narrator replied: "He is in pain."
Imam (as) said: "He should pray to the extent that he is able."
arabicText: 862 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ قَارِنٍ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَوْ سُئِلَ وَ أَنَا أَسْمَعُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَخْتِنُ وَلَدَهُ وَ هُوَ لاَ يُصَلِّي اَلْيَوْمَ وَ اَلْيَوْمَيْنِ فَقَالَ «وَ كَمْ أَتَى عَلَى اَلْغُلاَمِ» فَقَالَ ثَمَانِيَ سِنِينَ فَقَالَ «سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ يَتْرُكُ اَلصَّلاَةَ» قَالَ قُلْتُ يُصِيبُهُ اَلْوَجَعُ قَالَ «يُصَلِّي عَلَى نَحْوِ مَا يَقْدِرُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.862 - It is narrated from al-Hasan ibn Qarin that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Imam al-Ridha (as), or he was asked while I was listening, about a man who circumcises his son, and the boy does not pray for a day or two."
Imam (as) asked: "How old is the boy?"
The response was, "Eight years old."
Imam (as) said: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! He leaves prayer?"
The narrator replied: "He is in pain."
Imam (as) said: "He should pray to the extent that he is able."

chapter: The Age at Which Children Are Required to Pray
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.863 - Abdullah ibn Fadalah narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) and Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"When a boy reaches the age of three, he should be instructed to say 'la illaha illa Allah (swt)' seven times.
Then he is left until he completes three years, seven months, and twenty days, at which point he is instructed to say 'Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (sw)' seven times.
He is then left until he reaches four years of age, after which he is instructed to say seven times, 'May Allah (swt) bless Muhammad and his family.'
He is then left until he turns five years old and is asked: 'Which hand is your right and which is your left?' When he recognizes this, his face is turned toward the Qiblah, and he is told to prostrate.
He is then left until he turns seven years old, at which point he is told to wash his face and hands. When he washes them, he is told to pray.
He is then left until he reaches the age of nine. At nine, he is taught the proper way of performing ablution (wudu) and is disciplined for neglecting it. He is also instructed to perform prayer and disciplined for neglecting it.
When he has learned wudu and prayer, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, forgives him and his parents, if Allah (swt) wills."
arabicText: 863 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ فَضَالَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ وَ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ: «إِذَا بَلَغَ اَلْغُلاَمُ ثَلاَثَ سِنِينَ يُقَالُ لَهُ قُلْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ ثُمَّ يُتْرَكُ حَتَّى يَتِمَّ لَهُ ثَلاَثُ سِنِينَ وَ سَبْعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ وَ عِشْرُونَ يَوْماً فَيُقَالَ لَهُ قُلْ مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ وَ يُتْرَكُ حَتَّى يَتِمَّ لَهُ أَرْبَعُ سِنِينَ ثُمَّ يُقَالَ لَهُ قُلْ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ: صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِهِ - ثُمَّ يُتْرَكُ حَتَّى يَتِمَّ لَهُ خَمْسُ سِنِينَ ثُمَّ يُقَالَ لَهُ أَيُّهُمَا يَمِينُكَ وَ أَيُّهُمَا شِمَالُكَ فَإِذَا عَرَفَ ذَلِكَ حُوِّلَ وَجْهُهُ إِلَى اَلْقِبْلَةِ وَ يُقَالُ لَهُ اُسْجُدْ ثُمَّ يُتْرَكُ حَتَّى يَتِمَّ لَهُ سَبْعُ سِنِينَ فَإِذَا تَمَّ لَهُ سَبْعُ سِنِينَ قِيلَ لَهُ اِغْسِلْ وَجْهَكَ وَ كَفَّيْكَ فَإِذَا غَسَلَهُمَا قِيلَ لَهُ صَلِّ ثُمَّ يُتْرَكُ حَتَّى يَتِمَّ لَهُ تِسْعُ سِنِينَ فَإِذَا تَمَّتْ لَهُ عُلِّمَ اَلْوُضُوءَ وَ ضُرِبَ عَلَيْهِ وَ أُمِرَ بِالصَّلاَةِ وَ ضُرِبَ عَلَيْهَا فَإِذَا تَعَلَّمَ اَلْوُضُوءَ وَ اَلصَّلاَةَ غَفَرَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَهُ وَ لِوَالِدَيْهِ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.863 - Abdullah ibn Fadalah narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) and Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When a boy reaches the age of three, he should be instructed to say 'la illaha illa Allah (swt)' seven times.
Then he is left until he completes three years, seven months, and twenty days, at which point he is instructed to say 'Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (sw)' seven times.
He is then left until he reaches four years of age, after which he is instructed to say seven times, 'May Allah (swt) bless Muhammad and his family.'
He is then left until he turns five years old and is asked: 'Which hand is your right and which is your left?' When he recognizes this, his face is turned toward the Qiblah, and he is told to prostrate.
He is then left until he turns seven years old, at which point he is told to wash his face and hands. When he washes them, he is told to pray.
He is then left until he reaches the age of nine. At nine, he is taught the proper way of performing ablution (wudu) and is disciplined for neglecting it. He is also instructed to perform prayer and disciplined for neglecting it.
When he has learned wudu and prayer, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, forgives him and his parents, if Allah (swt) wills."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.864 - Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari narrate from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) :
"When the Messenger of Allah (sw) was taken on the night journey (Isra'), the time for prayer arrived, and Archangel Jibril (as) called the adhan (call to prayer).
When He said 'Allahu Akbar, Allahu Akbar' (Allah (swt) is the Greatest, Allah (swt) is the Greatest), the angels said 'Allahu Akbar, Allahu Akbar.'
When He said 'Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah (swt)' (I bear witness that there is no god but Allah (swt)), the angels said: 'He has renounced rivals (associating others with Allah (swt)).'
When He said 'Ashhadu anna Muhammadan Rasulullah' (I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (sw)), the angels said: 'A Prophet has been sent.'
When He said 'Hayya 'ala as-Salah' (Come to prayer), the angels said: 'He calls to the worship of his Lord (azj).'
When He said 'Hayya 'ala al-Falah' (Come to success), the angels said: 'Success is for the one who follows him.'".
arabicText: 864 - رَوَى حَفْصُ بْنُ اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لَمَّا أُسْرِيَ بِرَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ حَضَرَتِ اَلصَّلاَةُ فَأَذَّنَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَلَمَّا قَالَ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ فَلَمَّا قَالَ أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ خَلَعَ اَلْأَنْدَادَ فَلَمَّا قَالَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ نَبِيٌّ بُعِثَ فَلَمَّا قَالَ حَيَّ عَلَى اَلصَّلاَةِ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ حَثَّ عَلَى عِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِ فَلَمَّا قَالَ حَيَّ عَلَى اَلْفَلاَحِ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ أَفْلَحَ مَنِ اِتَّبَعَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.864 - Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari narrate from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) :
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the Messenger of Allah (sw) was taken on the night journey (Isra'), the time for prayer arrived, and Archangel Jibril (as) called the adhan (call to prayer).
When He said 'Allahu Akbar, Allahu Akbar' (Allah (swt) is the Greatest, Allah (swt) is the Greatest), the angels said 'Allahu Akbar, Allahu Akbar.'
When He said 'Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah (swt)' (I bear witness that there is no god but Allah (swt)), the angels said: 'He has renounced rivals (associating others with Allah (swt)).'
When He said 'Ashhadu anna Muhammadan Rasulullah' (I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (sw)), the angels said: 'A Prophet has been sent.'
When He said 'Hayya 'ala as-Salah' (Come to prayer), the angels said: 'He calls to the worship of his Lord (azj).'
When He said 'Hayya 'ala al-Falah' (Come to success), the angels said: 'Success is for the one who follows him.'".

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.865 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said: "Archangel Jibril (as) descended with the adhan (call to prayer) upon Messenger of Allah (sw) while his head was resting in the lap of Imam Ali (as). Archangel Jibril (as) pronounced the adhan and the iqamah (second call to prayer).
When the Messenger of Allah (sw) awoke, He said: 'O’ Ali, did you hear?'
Imam (as) replied: 'Yes, O’ Messenger of Allah (sw).'
He (sw) said: 'Did you memorize it?'
Imam (as) replied: 'Yes.'
The Prophet (sw) then said: 'Call Bilal and teach him,'
So Imam Ali (as) called Bilal and taught him."
arabicText: 865 - وَ رَوَى مَنْصُورُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «هَبَطَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِالْأَذَانِ عَلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ كَانَ رَأْسُهُ فِي حَجْرِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَأَذَّنَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَقَامَ فَلَمَّا اِنْتَبَهَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ «يَا عَلِيُّ سَمِعْتَ» قَالَ «نَعَمْ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ » قَالَ «حَفِظْتَ» قَالَ «نَعَمْ» قَالَ «اُدْعُ بِلاَلاً فَعَلِّمْهُ فَدَعَا بِلاَلاً فَعَلَّمَهُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.865 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Archangel Jibril (as) descended with the adhan (call to prayer) upon Messenger of Allah (sw) while his head was resting in the lap of Imam Ali (as). Archangel Jibril (as) pronounced the adhan and the iqamah (second call to prayer).
When the Messenger of Allah (sw) awoke, He said: 'O’ Ali, did you hear?'
Imam (as) replied: 'Yes, O’ Messenger of Allah (sw).'
He (sw) said: 'Did you memorize it?'
Imam (as) replied: 'Yes.'
The Prophet (sw) then said: 'Call Bilal and teach him,'
So Imam Ali (as) called Bilal and taught him."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.866 - Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"You may give the adhan (call to prayer) without being in a state of wudu (ritual purity), wearing a single garment, whether standing or sitting, and in any direction you face.
However, when you perform the iqamah (second call to prayer), you must be in a state of wudu, prepared for the prayer."
arabicText: 866 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «تُؤَذِّنُ وَ أَنْتَ عَلَى غَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ فِي ثَوْبٍ وَاحِدٍ قَائِماً أَوْ قَاعِداً وَ أَيْنَمَا تَوَجَّهْتَ وَ لَكِنْ إِذَا أَقَمْتَ فَعَلَى وُضُوءٍ مُتَهَيِّئاً لِلصَّلاَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.866 - Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"You may give the adhan (call to prayer) without being in a state of wudu (ritual purity), wearing a single garment, whether standing or sitting, and in any direction you face.
However, when you perform the iqamah (second call to prayer), you must be in a state of wudu, prepared for the prayer."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.867 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr al-Bazanti narrated from Imam al-Ridha (as) that He said:
"A man may give the adhan (call to prayer) while sitting or while riding."
arabicText: 867 - وَ رَوَى أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «يُؤَذِّنُ اَلرَّجُلُ وَ هُوَ جَالِسٌ وَ يُؤَذِّنُ وَ هُوَ رَاكِبٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.867 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr al-Bazanti narrated from Imam al-Ridha (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A man may give the adhan (call to prayer) while sitting or while riding."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.868 - Abu Basir narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"There is no issue if you give the adhan (call to prayer) while riding, walking, or without wudu (ritual purity). However, do not perform the iqamah (second call to prayer) while riding or sitting, unless there is an excuse, or if you are on slippery ground”.
arabicText: 868 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تُؤَذِّنَ رَاكِباً أَوْ مَاشِياً أَوْ عَلَى غَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ وَ لاَ تُقِمْ وَ أَنْتَ رَاكِبٌ وَ لاَ جَالِسٌ إِلاَّ مِنْ عُذْرٍ أَوْ تَكُونَ فِي أَرْضٍ مَلَصَّةٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.868 - Abu Basir narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no issue if you give the adhan (call to prayer) while riding, walking, or without wudu (ritual purity). However, do not perform the iqamah (second call to prayer) while riding or sitting, unless there is an excuse, or if you are on slippery ground”.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.869 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"The mu'adhdhin (caller to prayer) has a reward between the adhan and the iqamah equal to that of a martyr who is drenched in his blood in the way of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
Imam Ali (as) said: "People will compete over the adhan."
The Prophet replied: "No, there will come a time when people will leave the adhan to their weak ones. These (mu'adhdhins) are people whose flesh Allah (swt) has forbidden for the Fire”.
arabicText: 869 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «لِلْمُؤَذِّنِ فِيمَا بَيْنَ اَلْأَذَانِ وَ اَلْإِقَامَةِ مِثْلُ أَجْرِ اَلشَّهِيدِ اَلْمُتَشَحِّطِ بِدَمِهِ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ» فَقَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «إِنَّهُمْ يَجْتَلِدُونَ عَلَى اَلْأَذَانِ» فَقَالَ «كَلاَّ إِنَّهُ يَأْتِي عَلَى اَلنَّاسِ زَمَانٌ يَطْرَحُونَ اَلْأَذَانَ عَلَى ضُعَفَائِهِمْ فَتِلْكَ لُحُومٌ حَرَّمَهَا اَللَّهُ عَلَى اَلنَّارِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.869 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The mu'adhdhin (caller to prayer) has a reward between the adhan and the iqamah equal to that of a martyr who is drenched in his blood in the way of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
Imam Ali (as) said: "People will compete over the adhan."
The Prophet replied: "No, there will come a time when people will leave the adhan to their weak ones. These (mu'adhdhins) are people whose flesh Allah (swt) has forbidden for the Fire”.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.870 - Imam Ali (as) said:
"The last thing my beloved (the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said to me before parting was:
'O’ Ali, when you lead the prayer, lead it considering the weakest among those behind you. And do not appoint a mu'adhdhin who takes payment for his adhan.'"
arabicText: 870 - وَقَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «آخِرُ مَا فَارَقْتُ عَلَيْهِ حَبِيبَ قَلْبِي صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ «يَا عَلِيُّ إِذَا صَلَّيْتَ فَصَلِّ صَلاَةَ أَضْعَفِ مَنْ خَلْفَكَ وَ لاَ تَتَّخِذَنَّ مُؤَذِّناً يَأْخُذُ عَلَى أَذَانِهِ أَجْراً».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.870 - Imam Ali (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The last thing my beloved (the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said to me before parting was:
'O’ Ali, when you lead the prayer, lead it considering the weakest among those behind you. And do not appoint a mu'adhdhin who takes payment for his adhan.'"

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.871 - Khalid ibn Najih narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said: "The takbir (saying 'Allahu Akbar') in the adhan must be pronounced firmly, with clear articulation of the 'ha' and 'alif'“.
arabicText: 871 - وَ رَوَى خَالِدُ بْنُ نَجِيحٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «اَلتَّكْبِيرُ جَزْمٌ فِي اَلْأَذَانِ مَعَ اَلْإِفْصَاحِ بِالْهَاءِ وَ اَلْأَلِفِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.871 - Khalid ibn Najih narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The takbir (saying 'Allahu Akbar') in the adhan must be pronounced firmly, with clear articulation of the 'ha' and 'alif'“.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.872 - Abu Basir narrated from one of the Imams (as) that He said:
"Bilal was a righteous servant who said:
'I will not call the adhan for anyone after the Messenger of Allah (sw).'
Therefore, on that day, 'Hayya 'ala khayr al-'Amal' (Hasten to the best of deeds) was left out."
arabicText: 872 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِنَّ بِلاَلاً كَانَ عَبْداً صَالِحاً فَقَالَ لاَ أُؤَذِّنُ لِأَحَدٍ بَعْدَ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَتُرِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ حَيَّ عَلَى خَيْرِ اَلْعَمَلِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.872 - Abu Basir narrated from one of the Imams (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Bilal was a righteous servant who said:
'I will not call the adhan for anyone after the Messenger of Allah (sw).'
Therefore, on that day, 'Hayya 'ala khayr al-'Amal' (Hasten to the best of deeds) was left out."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.873 - Al-Hasan ibn al-Sari reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"It is part of the Sunnah (tradition) for a person giving the adhan (call to prayer) to place his fingers in his ears."
arabicText: 873 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ اَلسَّرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «مِنَ اَلسُّنَّةِ إِذَا أَذَّنَ اَلرَّجُلُ أَنْ يَضَعَ إِصْبَعَيْهِ فِي أُذُنَيْهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.873 - Al-Hasan ibn al-Sari reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is part of the Sunnah (tradition) for a person giving the adhan (call to prayer) to place his fingers in his ears."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.874 - Khalid ibn Najih narrated from Imam (as) that He said:
"The adhan and the iqamah must be recited with firmness."
In another narration, it states, "They must be delivered with a pause."
arabicText: 874 - وَ رَوَى خَالِدُ بْنُ نَجِيحٍ عَنْهُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «اَلْأَذَانُ وَ اَلْإِقَامَةُ مَجْزُومَانِ» وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ «مَوْقُوفَانِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.874 - Khalid ibn Najih narrated from Imam (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The adhan and the iqamah must be recited with firmness."
In another narration, it states, "They must be delivered with a pause."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.875 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"The adhan is not sufficient for you unless you hear it yourself or understand it. Clearly articulate the 'alif' and 'ha'."
Send blessings upon the Prophet and his family (as) whenever you mention him or hear someone mention him, whether during the adhan or outside of it. The louder your voice, without straining yourself, the more people will hear, and your reward will be greater."
arabicText:
875 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ يُجْزِيكَ مِنَ اَلْأَذَانِ إِلاَّ مَا أَسْمَعْتَ نَفْسَكَ أَوْ فَهِمْتَهُ  وَ أَفْصِحْ بِالْأَلِفِ وَ اَلْهَاءِ
وَ صَلِّ عَلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ وَ آلِهِ صَلَوَاتُ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِمْ كُلَّمَا ذَكَرْتَهُ أَوْ ذَكَرَهُ ذَاكِرٌ عِنْدَكَ فِي أَذَانٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ وَ كُلَّمَا اِشْتَدَّ صَوْتُكَ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ تُجْهِدَ نَفْسَكَ كَانَ مَنْ يَسْمَعُ أَكْثَرَ وَ كَانَ أَجْرُكَ فِي ذَلِكَ أَعْظَمَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.875 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The adhan is not sufficient for you unless you hear it yourself or understand it. Clearly articulate the 'alif' and 'ha'."
Send blessings upon the Prophet and his family (as) whenever you mention him or hear someone mention him, whether during the adhan or outside of it. The louder your voice, without straining yourself, the more people will hear, and your reward will be greater."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.876 - Muawiya ibn Wahb asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the adhan (call to prayer).
The Imam said: "Raise your voice and speak loudly when giving the adhan. When performing the iqamah (second call to prayer), use a slightly lower voice.
Do not delay your adhan and iqamah except until the time for prayer has arrived, and recite the iqamah quickly (with fluidity)."
arabicText: 876 - وَ سَأَلَ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ وَهْبٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْأَذَانِ فَقَالَ «اِجْهَرْ وَ اِرْفَعْ بِهِ صَوْتَكَ فَإِذَا أَقَمْتَ فَدُونَ ذَلِكَ وَ لاَ تَنْتَظِرْ بِأَذَانِكَ وَ إِقَامَتِكَ إِلاَّ دُخُولَ وَقْتِ اَلصَّلاَةِ وَ اُحْدُرْ إِقَامَتَكَ حَدْراً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.876 - Muawiya ibn Wahb asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the adhan (call to prayer).
thaqalaynMatn:
The Imam said: "Raise your voice and speak loudly when giving the adhan. When performing the iqamah (second call to prayer), use a slightly lower voice.
Do not delay your adhan and iqamah except until the time for prayer has arrived, and recite the iqamah quickly (with fluidity)."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.877 - It is narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) by 'Ammar al-Sabati that He said: "When you stand for a mandatory prayer, give the adhan and the iqamah, and separate between the adhan and the iqamah with sitting, speaking, or tasbih (glorification of Allah (swt))."
He (Ammar) asked: "What is the minimum that suffices between the adhan and the iqamah in terms of speech?"
Imam (as) replied: "Saying 'Alhamdulillah' (All praise belongs to Allah (swt))."
arabicText: 877 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِذَا قُمْتَ إِلَى اَلصَّلاَةِ اَلْفَرِيضَةِ فَأَذِّنْ وَ أَقِمْ وَ اِفْصِلْ بَيْنَ اَلْأَذَانِ وَ اَلْإِقَامَةِ بِقُعُودٍ أَوْ بِكَلاَمٍ أَوْ تَسْبِيحٍ» وَقَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ كَمِ اَلَّذِي يُجْزِي بَيْنَ اَلْأَذَانِ وَ اَلْإِقَامَةِ مِنَ اَلْقَوْلِ قَالَ «اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.877 - It is narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) by 'Ammar al-Sabati that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When you stand for a mandatory prayer, give the adhan and the iqamah, and separate between the adhan and the iqamah with sitting, speaking, or tasbih (glorification of Allah (swt))."
He (Ammar) asked: "What is the minimum that suffices between the adhan and the iqamah in terms of speech?"
Imam (as) replied: "Saying 'Alhamdulillah' (All praise belongs to Allah (swt))."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.878 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about a man who gives the adhan (call to prayer) while walking, while not in a state of ritual purity, or while riding an animal.
The Imam said: "Yes, it is permissible if the one giving the testimony of faith (in the adhan) faces the Qiblah; there is no issue."
arabicText: 878 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُؤَذِّنُ وَ هُوَ يَمْشِي وَ هُوَ عَلَى غَيْرِ طُهْرٍ أَوْ هُوَ عَلَى ظَهْرِ اَلدَّابَّةِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ إِذَا كَانَ اَلْمُتَشِّهِدُ مُسْتَقْبِلَ اَلْقِبْلَةِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.878 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about a man who gives the adhan (call to prayer) while walking, while not in a state of ritual purity, or while riding an animal.
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam said: "Yes, it is permissible if the one giving the testimony of faith (in the adhan) faces the Qiblah; there is no issue."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.879 - Zurarah narrated from Imam Abu Ja'far (as) that He said:
"When the iqamah (second call to prayer) is pronounced, speaking becomes prohibited for the Imam and the people of the mosque, except in the case of appointing an Imam."
arabicText: 879 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ زُرَارَةُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِذَا أُقِيمَتِ اَلصَّلاَةُ حَرُمَ اَلْكَلاَمُ عَلَى اَلْإِمَامِ وَ عَلَى أَهْلِ اَلْمَسْجِدِ إِلاَّ فِي تَقْدِيمِ إِمَامٍ »
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.879 - Zurarah narrated from Imam Abu Ja'far (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When the iqamah (second call to prayer) is pronounced, speaking becomes prohibited for the Imam and the people of the mosque, except in the case of appointing an Imam."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.880 - Imam Ali (as) said that the Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"The one who leads you in prayer should be the one who has the most knowledge of the Qur'an among you, and the one who calls the adhan (mu'adhdhin) should be the best among you."
In another narration, it is said: "the most articulate among you."
arabicText: 880 - وَقَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «يَؤُمُّكُمْ أَقْرَؤُكُمْ وَ يُؤَذِّنُ لَكُمْ خِيَارُكُمْ وَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ أَفْصَحُكُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.880 - Imam Ali (as) said that the Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The one who leads you in prayer should be the one who has the most knowledge of the Qur'an among you, and the one who calls the adhan (mu'adhdhin) should be the best among you."
In another narration, it is said: "the most articulate among you."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.881 - The Messenger, and his family, said:
"Whoever calls the adhan (call to prayer) in one of the cities of the Muslims for a year, Paradise becomes obligatory for him."
arabicText: 881 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «مَنْ أَذَّنَ فِي مِصْرٍ مِنْ أَمْصَارِ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ سَنَةً وَجَبَتْ لَهُ اَلْجَنَّةُ.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.882 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"For the mu'adhdhin (caller to prayer), Allah (swt) forgives him as far as his sight and voice reach into the sky. Every moist and dry thing that hears him bears witness to his truth. For every person who prays with him in his mosque, he receives a share, and for every person who prays due to hearing his call, he earns a good deed."
arabicText: 882 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْمُؤَذِّنُ يَغْفِرُ اَللَّهُ لَهُ مَدَّ بَصَرِهِ وَ مَدَّ صَوْتِهِ فِي اَلسَّمَاءِ وَ يُصَدِّقُهُ كُلُّ رَطْبٍ وَ يَابِسٍ يَسْمَعُهُ وَ لَهُ مِنْ كُلِّ مَنْ يُصَلِّي مَعَهُ فِي مَسْجِدِهِ سَهْمٌ وَ لَهُ مِنْ كُلِّ مَنْ يُصَلِّي بِصَوْتِهِ حَسَنَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.882 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For the mu'adhdhin (caller to prayer), Allah (swt) forgives him as far as his sight and voice reach into the sky. Every moist and dry thing that hears him bears witness to his truth. For every person who prays with him in his mosque, he receives a share, and for every person who prays due to hearing his call, he earns a good deed."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.883 - Imam (as) said:
"Whoever calls the adhan (call to prayer) for seven years with the intention of seeking Allah’s (swt) reward will come on the Day of Judgment without any sins."
arabicText: 883 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ أَذَّنَ سَبْعَ سِنِينَ مُحْتَسِباً جَاءَ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ لاَ ذَنْبَ لَهُ.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.884 - It is narrated: "When the angels hear the adhan (call to prayer) from the people of the earth, they say,
'These are the voices of the nation of Muhammad (sw) declaring the oneness of Allah (swt).'
They then seek forgiveness from Allah (swt) for the nation of Muhammad until the prayer is completed."
arabicText: 884 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةَ إِذَا سَمِعَتِ اَلْأَذَانَ مِنْ أَهْلِ اَلْأَرْضِ قَالَتْ هَذِهِ أَصْوَاتُ أُمَّةِ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِتَوْحِيدِ اَللَّهِ فَيَسْتَغْفِرُونَ اَللَّهَ لِأُمَّةِ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ حَتَّى يَفْرُغُوا مِنْ تِلْكَ اَلصَّلاَةِ.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.885 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"The minimum that suffices for the adhan is to begin the night with an adhan and iqamah and to begin the day with an adhan and iqamah. For the other prayers during the day, an iqamah without an adhan suffices."
arabicText: 885 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِنَّ أَدْنَى مَا يُجْزِي مِنَ اَلْأَذَانِ أَنْ يَفْتَتِحَ اَللَّيْلَ بِأَذَانٍ وَ إِقَامَةٍ وَ يَفْتَتِحَ اَلنَّهَارَ بِأَذَانٍ وَ إِقَامَةٍ وَ يُجْزِيكَ فِي سَائِرِ اَلصَّلاَةِ إِقَامَةٌ بِغَيْرِ أَذَانٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.885 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The minimum that suffices for the adhan is to begin the night with an adhan and iqamah and to begin the day with an adhan and iqamah. For the other prayers during the day, an iqamah without an adhan suffices."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.886 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that:
"The Messenger of Allah (sw) combined the Dhuhr (noon) and 'Asr (afternoon) prayers with one adhan and two iqamah, and he combined the Maghrib (sunset) and 'Isha (night) prayers in the same setting without any particular reason, using one adhan and two iqamah”.
arabicText: 886 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ جَمَعَ بَيْنَ اَلظُّهْرِ وَ اَلْعَصْرِ بِأَذَانٍ وَ إِقَامَتَيْنِ وَ جَمَعَ بَيْنَ اَلْمَغْرِبِ وَ اَلْعِشَاءِ فِي اَلْحَضَرِ مِنْ غَيْرِ عِلَّةٍ بِأَذَانٍ وَاحِدٍ وَ إِقَامَتَيْنِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.886 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Messenger of Allah (sw) combined the Dhuhr (noon) and 'Asr (afternoon) prayers with one adhan and two iqamah, and he combined the Maghrib (sunset) and 'Isha (night) prayers in the same setting without any particular reason, using one adhan and two iqamah”.

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.887 - It is narrated: "Whoever prays with both the adhan (call to prayer) and iqamah (second call to prayer), two rows of angels pray behind him. And whoever prays with just the iqamah without the adhan, one row of angels prays behind him, and the extent of the row is from the east to the west."
arabicText: 887 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ مَنْ صَلَّى بِأَذَانٍ وَ إِقَامَةٍ صَلَّى خَلْفَهُ صَفَّانِ مِنَ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةِ وَ مَنْ صَلَّى بِإِقَامَةٍ بِغَيْرِ أَذَانٍ صَلَّى خَلْفَهُ صَفٌّ وَاحِدٌ وَ حَدُّ اَلصَّفِّ مَا بَيْنَ اَلْمَشْرِقِ وَ اَلْمَغْرِبِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.887 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever prays with both the adhan (call to prayer) and iqamah (second call to prayer), two rows of angels pray behind him. And whoever prays with just the iqamah without the adhan, one row of angels prays behind him, and the extent of the row is from the east to the west."

chapter: The Call to Prayer and the Establishment of Prayer and the Reward of the Muezzins
