author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
There is no call to prayer (adhan) or iqama for a woman, nor is there a Jumu’ah prayer (Jumu'ah) or congregational prayer (Jama'ah) for her.
When a woman stands in prayer, She gathers her feet together and does not spread them apart, placing her hands on her chest at the location of her breasts.
When She bows, She places her hands on her knees, on her thighs, so as not to bend too much and cause her back to rise.
When She goes to prostrate, She sits first and then prostrates, pressing her face to the ground and placing her arms on the ground.
When She rises to stand, She lifts her head from the prostration and sits on her buttocks, not in the way a man would sit. Then, She rises to stand without raising her back and hips, moving smoothly.
When She sits for the tashahhud (testification), She raises her legs and brings her thighs together. A free woman (Hura) does not pray except with a veil (niqab), while a slave woman (ama) prays without a veil.
arabicText: ليس على المرأة أذان ولا إقامة ولا جمعة ولا جماعة. وإذا قامت المرأة في صلاتها جمعت بين قدميها ولم تفرج بينهما، ووضعت يديها على صدرها لمكان ثدييها، فإذا ركعت وضعت يديها فوق ركبتيها على فخذيها لئلا تطأطأ كثيرا فترتفع عجيزتها، وإذا أرادت السجود جلست ثم سجدت لاطئة بالأرض وتضع ذراعيها في الأرض فإذا أرادت النهوض إلى القيام رفعت رأسها من السجود وجلست على أليتيها ليس كما يقعى الرجل، ثم نهضت إلى القيام من غير أن ترفع عجيزتها تنسل انسلالا ، وإذا قعدت للتشهد رفعت رجليها، وضمت فخذيها، والحرة لا تصلي إلا بقناع، والأمة تصلي بغير قناع.

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1081 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"A woman prays in a dress (dir'aa) and a head covering (miqna'a) if it is thick, meaning it is concealing."
arabicText: 1081 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «اَلْمَرْأَةُ تُصَلِّي فِي اَلدِّرْعِ وَ اَلْمِقْنَعَةِ إِذَا كَانَ كَثِيفاً يَعْنِي سَتِيراً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1081 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman prays in a dress (dir'aa) and a head covering (miqna'a) if it is thick, meaning it is concealing."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1082 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who prays in one garment.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
He then asked: "What about a woman?"
Imam (as) said: "No, and it is not proper for a free woman (Hurr) to pray when she menstruates except with a khimar (headscarf), unless She does not find it."
arabicText: 1082 - وَ سَأَلَ يُونُسُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فِي ثَوْبٍ وَاحِدٍ قَالَ «نَعَمْ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَالْمَرْأَةُ قَالَ «لاَ وَ لاَ يَصْلُحُ لِلْحُرَّةِ إِذَا حَاضَتْ إِلاَّ اَلْخِمَارُ إِلاَّ أَنْ لاَ تَجِدَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1082 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who prays in one garment.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
He then asked: "What about a woman?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No, and it is not proper for a free woman (Hurr) to pray when she menstruates except with a khimar (headscarf), unless She does not find it."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1083 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a woman who has only one cover (milhafa). How should She pray?
Imam (as) said: "She should wrap herself in it and cover her head, and then pray. If her legs are exposed and She is unable to cover them in any other way, then there is no harm."
arabicText: 1083 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ ، أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ لَيْسَ لَهَا إِلاَّ مِلْحَفَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ كَيْفَ تُصَلِّي قَالَ «تَلْتَفُّ فِيهَا وَ تُغَطِّي رَأْسَهَا وَ تُصَلِّي فَإِنْ خَرَجَتْ رِجْلَيْهَا وَ لَيْسَ تَقْدِرُ عَلَى غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ.

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1084 - In a narration from Al-Mu'alla ibn Khunays, he asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a woman praying in a shirt (dir') and a cover (milhafa) without a waistcloth (izar) or headcover (miqna'a).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm if She wraps herself in it, and if it is not wide enough to cover her, She should make it long."
arabicText: 1084 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلْمُعَلَّى بْنِ خُنَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تُصَلِّي فِي دِرْعٍ وَ مِلْحَفَةٍ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا إِزَارٌ وَ لاَ مِقْنَعَةٌ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ إِذَا اِلْتَفَّتْ بِهَا وَ إِنْ لَمْ تَكُنْ تَكْفِيهَا عَرْضاً جَعَلَتْهَا طُولاً.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1084 - In a narration from Al-Mu'alla ibn Khunays, he asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a woman praying in a shirt (dir') and a cover (milhafa) without a waistcloth (izar) or headcover (miqna'a).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if She wraps herself in it, and if it is not wide enough to cover her, She should make it long."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1085 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"There is no obligation for a slave woman (amā) to wear a headcover (qina'ah) in prayer, nor for a woman who is 'mukātabah' (a slave who has entered into a contract to pay for her freedom) if her master has not required it as part of the terms of her contract, until She has fulfilled all the terms of her contract. The same rules that apply to a slave in all legal matters apply to her as well."
arabicText: 1085 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «لَيْسَ عَلَى اَلْأَمَةِ قِنَاعٌ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ وَ لاَ عَلَى اَلْمُدَبَّرَةِ قِنَاعٌ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ وَ لاَ عَلَى اَلْمُكَاتَبَةِ إِذَا اِشْتَرَطَ عَلَيْهَا مَوْلاَهَا قِنَاعٌ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ وَ هِيَ مَمْلُوكَةٌ حَتَّى تُؤَدِّيَ جَمِيعَ مُكَاتَبَتِهَا وَ يَجْرِي عَلَيْهَا مَا يَجْرِي عَلَى اَلْمَمْلُوكِ فِي اَلْحُدُودِ كُلِّهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1085 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no obligation for a slave woman (amā) to wear a headcover (qina'ah) in prayer, nor for a woman who is 'mukātabah' (a slave who has entered into a contract to pay for her freedom) if her master has not required it as part of the terms of her contract, until She has fulfilled all the terms of her contract. The same rules that apply to a slave in all legal matters apply to her as well."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1086 - I asked him about a slave woman (amā) who gave birth, and whether the headcover (khimar) would be required for her.
Imam (as) said: "If it were required for her, She would have to wear it when She menstruates, but there is no requirement for her to wear a headcover in prayer."
arabicText: 1086 - قَالَ وَ سَأَلْتُهُ: عَنِ اَلْأَمَةِ إِذَا وَلَدَتْ عَلَيْهَا اَلْخِمَارُ قَالَ «لَوْ كَانَ عَلَيْهَا لَكَانَ عَلَيْهَا إِذَا هِيَ حَاضَتْ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا اَلتَّقَنُّعُ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1086 - I asked him about a slave woman (amā) who gave birth, and whether the headcover (khimar) would be required for her.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If it were required for her, She would have to wear it when She menstruates, but there is no requirement for her to wear a headcover in prayer."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1087 - Iyas ibn al-Qasim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who prays in a woman's izar (waistcloth), in her garment, and uses her khimar (headcover) as a turban.
Imam (as) said: "If She is trustworthy (māʾmūnah), there is no harm."
arabicText: 1087 - وَ رَوَى عِيصُ بْنُ اَلْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فِي إِزَارِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ وَ فِي ثَوْبِهَا وَ يَعْتَمُّ بِخِمَارِهَا قَالَ «إِذَا كَانَتْ مَأْمُونَةً فَلاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1087 - Iyas ibn al-Qasim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who prays in a woman's izar (waistcloth), in her garment, and uses her khimar (headcover) as a turban.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If She is trustworthy (māʾmūnah), there is no harm."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1088 - It is narrated:
"The best places for women to pray are their homes. A woman's prayer in her house is better than her prayer in a public prayer area (ṣuffah), and her prayer in the public prayer area is better than her prayer in the courtyard of her house. Her prayer in the courtyard is better than her prayer on the roof of her house. And it is disliked for a woman to pray on a roof that is not enclosed (muḥajjar)."
arabicText: 1088 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّ خَيْرَ مَسَاجِدِ اَلنِّسَاءِ اَلْبُيُوتُ وَ صَلاَةَ اَلْمَرْأَةِ فِي بَيْتِهَا أَفْضَلُ مِنْ صَلاَتِهَا فِي صُفَّتِهَا وَ صَلاَتَهَا فِي صُفَّتِهَا أَفْضَلُ مِنْ صَلاَتِهَا فِي صَحْنِ دَارِهَا وَ صَلاَتَهَا فِي صَحْنِ دَارِهَا أَفْضَلُ مِنْ صَلاَتِهَا فِي سَطْحِ بَيْتِهَا وَ تُكْرَهُ لِلْمَرْأَةِ اَلصَّلاَةُ فِي سَطْحٍ غَيْرِ مُحَجَّرٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1088 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The best places for women to pray are their homes. A woman's prayer in her house is better than her prayer in a public prayer area (ṣuffah), and her prayer in the public prayer area is better than her prayer in the courtyard of her house. Her prayer in the courtyard is better than her prayer on the roof of her house. And it is disliked for a woman to pray on a roof that is not enclosed (muḥajjar)."

chapter: The Etiquette of Women in Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1089 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Do not place women in upper rooms (ghuraf), nor teach them writing, nor teach them Surah Yusuf. Teach them spinning (al-mighzal) and Surah al-Nur."
And when a woman makes the tasbih (glorification of God), She should knot her fingers, for they will be questioned on the Day of Judgment.
arabicText:
1089 - وَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ تُنْزِلُوا اَلنِّسَاءَ اَلْغُرَفَ وَ لاَ تُعَلِّمُوهُنَّ اَلْكِتَابَةَ وَ لاَ تُعَلِّمُوهُنَّ سُورَةَ يُوسُفَ وَ عَلِّمُوهُنَّ اَلْمِغْزَلَ وَ سُورَةَ اَلنُّورِ.
فإذا سبحت المرأة عقدت على الأنامل لأنهن مسؤولات يوم القيامة.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1089 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Do not place women in upper rooms (ghuraf), nor teach them writing, nor teach them Surah Yusuf. Teach them spinning (al-mighzal) and Surah al-Nur."
And when a woman makes the tasbih (glorification of God), She should knot her fingers, for they will be questioned on the Day of Judgment.

chapter: The Etiquette of Departing From Prayer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1090 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"When you finish your prayer, turn to your right as you leave."
arabicText: 1090 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «إِذَا اِنْصَرَفْتَ مِنَ اَلصَّلاَةِ فَانْصَرِفْ عَنْ يَمِينِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1090 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When you finish your prayer, turn to your right as you leave."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, says: "And establish the prayer and give the zakah and bow with those who bow." (Surah Al-Baqarah, 2:43).
Allah (swt) has commanded the congregation as He commanded the prayer. Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has made it obligatory upon the people to pray five times a day, from Jumu’ah to Jumu’ah, totaling thirty-five prayers. Among them, one prayer is obligatory in congregation, which is the Jumu’ah prayer. As for the other prayers, it is not obligatory to pray in congregation, but it is a recommended practice (Sunnah).
Whoever neglects it without a valid excuse has no prayer. Whoever neglects three consecutive Jumu’ah prayers without a valid excuse is considered a hypocrite. A man's prayer in congregation is worth twenty-five degrees more than his prayer alone in Paradise. The prayer in congregation is worth twenty-four prayers more than the individual prayer, making a total of twenty-five prayers.
arabicText:
قال الله تبارك وتعالى: " وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واركعوا مع الراكعين "
فأمر الله بالجماعة كما أمر بالصلاة، وفرض الله تبارك وتعالى على الناس من الجمعة إلى الجمعة خمسا وثلاثين صلاة، فيها صلاة واحدة فرضها الله في جماعة وهي الجمعة فأما سائر الصلوات فليس الاجتماع إليها بمفروض ولكنه سنة، من تركها رغبة عنها وعن جماعة المسلمين من غير علة فلا صلاة له ومن ترك ثلاث جمعات متواليات من غير علة فهو منافق وصلاة الرجل في جماعة تفضل على صلاة الرجل وحده بخمس وعشرين درجة في الجنة، والصلاة في الجماعة تفضل صلاة الفرد بأربع وعشرين صلاة فيكون خمسا وعشرين صلاة.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1091 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated that Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"There is no prayer for the one who does not attend the congregational prayer from among the neighbors of the mosque, except for someone who is ill or preoccupied."
arabicText: 1091 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ صَلاَةَ لِمَنْ لاَ يَشْهَدُ اَلصَّلاَةَ مِنْ جِيرَانِ اَلْمَسْجِدِ إِلاَّ مَرِيضٌ أَوْ مَشْغُولٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1091 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated that Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no prayer for the one who does not attend the congregational prayer from among the neighbors of the mosque, except for someone who is ill or preoccupied."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1092 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said to a group of people:
"You must attend the mosque, or I will burn down your houses."
arabicText: 1092 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لِقَوْمٍ: «لَتَحْضُرُنَّ اَلْمَسْجِدَ أَوْ لَأُحْرِقَنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ مَنَازِلَكُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1092 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said to a group of people:
thaqalaynMatn: "You must attend the mosque, or I will burn down your houses."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1093 – He (as) said:
"Whoever prays the five daily prayers in congregation, assume every good about him."
arabicText: 1093 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ صَلَّى اَلصَّلَوَاتِ اَلْخَمْسَ جَمَاعَةً فَظُنُّوا بِهِ كُلَّ خَيْرٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1093 – He (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever prays the five daily prayers in congregation, assume every good about him."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.1094 - Imam (as) said: "Two people constitute a congregation."
arabicText: 1094 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلاِثْنَانِ جَمَاعَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1094 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Two people constitute a congregation."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1095 - Al-Hasan al-Sayqal asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the minimum number for a congregation.
Imam (as) said: "A man and a woman."
arabicText: 1095 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْحَسَنُ اَلصَّيْقَلُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنْ أَقَلِّ مَا تَكُونُ اَلْجَمَاعَةُ قَالَ «رَجُلٌ وَ اِمْرَأَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1095 - Al-Hasan al-Sayqal asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the minimum number for a congregation.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "A man and a woman."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1096 - The Prophet said:
"A believer alone is a proof (Hujjah), and a believer alone is a congregation."
arabicText: 1096 - وَ قَدْ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «اَلْمُؤْمِنُ وَحْدَهُ حُجَّةٌ وَ اَلْمُؤْمِنُ وَحْدَهُ جَمَاعَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1096 - The Prophet said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A believer alone is a proof (Hujjah), and a believer alone is a congregation."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1097 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) prayed the Fajr (dawn) prayer one day, and after finishing, he turned his face towards his companions and asked about certain people by name, asking if they were present for the prayer.
They replied: "No, O’ Messenger of Allah (sw)."
He (sw) then said: "Are they absent?"
They said: "No, O’ Messenger of Allah (sw)."
He (sw) said: "Indeed, there is no prayer heavier on the hypocrites than this prayer (Fajr) and the 'Isha' (night) prayer. If they knew the reward that is in them, they would come to them, even if crawling."
arabicText: 1097 - وَ صَلَّى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَلْفَجْرَ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ فَلَمَّا اِنْصَرَفَ أَقْبَلَ بِوَجْهِهِ عَلَى أَصْحَابِهِ فَسَأَلَ عَنْ أُنَاسٍ يُسَمِّيهِمْ بِأَسْمَائِهِمْ هَلْ حَضَرُوا اَلصَّلاَةَ قَالُوا لاَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ «غُيَّبٌ هُمْ » فَقَالُوا لاَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ قَالَ «أَمَا إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ مِنْ صَلاَةٍ أَثْقَلَ عَلَى اَلْمُنَافِقِينَ مِنْ هَذِهِ اَلصَّلاَةِ وَ صَلاَةِ اَلْعِشَاءِ اَلْآخِرَةِ وَ لَوْ عَلِمُوا اَلْفَضْلَ اَلَّذِي فِيهِمَا لَأَتَوْهُمَا وَ لَوْ حَبْواً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1097 -
thaqalaynMatn:
The Messenger of Allah (sw) prayed the Fajr (dawn) prayer one day, and after finishing, he turned his face towards his companions and asked about certain people by name, asking if they were present for the prayer.
They replied: "No, O’ Messenger of Allah (sw)."
He (sw) then said: "Are they absent?"
They said: "No, O’ Messenger of Allah (sw)."
He (sw) said: "Indeed, there is no prayer heavier on the hypocrites than this prayer (Fajr) and the 'Isha' (night) prayer. If they knew the reward that is in them, they would come to them, even if crawling."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1098 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever prays the morning (Fajr) and the evening ('Isha') prayers in congregation is under the protection of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic. Whoever wrongs him, wrongs Allah (swt), and whoever belittles him, belittles Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText: 1098 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ صَلَّى اَلْغَدَاةَ وَ اَلْعِشَاءَ اَلْآخِرَةَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فَهُوَ فِي ذِمَّةِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ مَنْ ظَلَمَهُ فَإِنَّمَا يَظْلِمُ اَللَّهَ وَ مَنْ حَقَّرَهُ فَإِنَّمَا يُحَقِّرُ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1098 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever prays the morning (Fajr) and the evening ('Isha') prayers in congregation is under the protection of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic. Whoever wrongs him, wrongs Allah (swt), and whoever belittles him, belittles Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1099 - The Prophet (sw) said:
"If the sandals are wet, then pray in your dwellings."
arabicText: 1099 - لِقَوْلِ اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «إِذَا اِبْتَلَّتِ اَلنِّعَالُ فَالصَّلاَةُ فِي اَلرِّحَالِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1099 - The Prophet (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the sandals are wet, then pray in your dwellings."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1100 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"The Imam of the people is their representative, so choose the best among you to lead."
arabicText: 1100 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «إِمَامُ اَلْقَوْمِ وَافِدُهُمْ فَقَدِّمُوا أَفْضَلَكُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1100 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Imam of the people is their representative, so choose the best among you to lead."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1110 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Three people should not be prayed behind: the one who is unknown (al-majhūl), the extremist (al-ghālī) even if he claims to hold your beliefs, and the one who openly commits sinful acts (al-mujāhir bil-fisq) even if he appears moderate."
arabicText: 1110 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «ثَلاَثَةٌ لاَ يُصَلَّى خَلْفَهُمُ اَلْمَجْهُولُ وَ اَلْغَالِي وَ إِنْ كَانَ يَقُولُ بِقَوْلِكَ وَ اَلْمُجَاهِرُ بِالْفِسْقِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ مُقْتَصِداً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1110 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Three people should not be prayed behind: the one who is unknown (al-majhūl), the extremist (al-ghālī) even if he claims to hold your beliefs, and the one who openly commits sinful acts (al-mujāhir bil-fisq) even if he appears moderate."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1101 - Imam (as) said:
"If it pleases you to purify and perfect your prayers, then choose the best among you (to lead)."
arabicText: 1101 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنْ سَرَّكُمْ أَنْ تُزَكُّوا صَلاَتَكُمْ فَقَدِّمُوا خِيَارَكُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1101 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If it pleases you to purify and perfect your prayers, then choose the best among you (to lead)."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1102 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Whoever leads a people in prayer while there is someone among them who is more knowledgeable than him, their affairs will continue to decline until the Day of Judgment."
arabicText: 1102 - وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «مَنْ صَلَّى بِقَوْمٍ وَ فِيهِمْ مَنْ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ مِنْهُ لَمْ يَزَلْ أَمْرُهُمْ إِلَى سَفَالٍ إِلَى يَوْمِ اَلْقِيَامَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1102 -
thaqalaynMatn:
The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Whoever leads a people in prayer while there is someone among them who is more knowledgeable than him, their affairs will continue to decline until the Day of Judgment."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1103 - Al-Hussain ibn Kathir narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that a man asked him about reciting (Qur'an) behind the Imam (during prayer).
Imam (as) said: "No, the Imam is responsible for the recitation, but the Imam does not take responsibility for the prayers of those behind him; he is only responsible for the recitation."
arabicText: 1103 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ كَثِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: أَنَّهُ سَأَلَهُ رَجُلٌ عَنِ اَلْقِرَاءَةِ خَلْفَ اَلْإِمَامِ فَقَالَ «لاَ إِنَّ اَلْإِمَامَ ضَامِنٌ لِلْقِرَاءَةِ وَ لَيْسَ يَضْمَنُ اَلْإِمَامُ صَلاَةَ اَلَّذِينَ هُمْ مِنْ خَلْفِهِ إِنَّمَا يَضْمَنُ اَلْقِرَاءَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1103 - Al-Hussain ibn Kathir narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that a man asked him about reciting (Qur'an) behind the Imam (during prayer).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "No, the Imam is responsible for the recitation, but the Imam does not take responsibility for the prayers of those behind him; he is only responsible for the recitation."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1104 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"Five people should not lead others in prayer nor should they lead them in a congregational obligatory prayer: the person with leprosy (abrāṣ), the person with a skin disease (majdhūm), the child of adultery (walad al-zina), the Bedouin (a‘rābī) until he migrates, and the person who has been subjected to the legal punishment (al-maḥdūd)."
arabicText: 1104 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «خَمْسَةٌ لاَ يَؤُمُّونَ اَلنَّاسَ وَ لاَ يُصَلُّونَ بِهِمْ صَلاَةً فَرِيضَةً فِي جَمَاعَةٍ اَلْأَبْرَصُ وَ اَلْمَجْذُومُ وَ وَلَدُ اَلزِّنَا وَ اَلْأَعْرَابِيُّ حَتَّى يُهَاجِرَ وَ اَلْمَحْدُودُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1104 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Five people should not lead others in prayer nor should they lead them in a congregational obligatory prayer: the person with leprosy (abrāṣ), the person with a skin disease (majdhūm), the child of adultery (walad al-zina), the Bedouin (a‘rābī) until he migrates, and the person who has been subjected to the legal punishment (al-maḥdūd)."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1105 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"None of you should pray behind a person with a mutilated limb (al-ajdham), a person with leprosy (al-abrāṣ), a person with a mental disorder (al-majnūn), a person who has been subjected to a legal punishment (al-maḥdūd), the child of adultery (walad al-zina), or a Bedouin (al-a‘rābī) leading a migrant (al-muhājir)."
arabicText: 1105 - وَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ يُصَلِّيَنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ خَلْفَ اَلْأَجْذَمِ وَ اَلْأَبْرَصِ وَ اَلْمَجْنُونِ وَ اَلْمَحْدُودِ وَ وَلَدِ اَلزِّنَا وَ اَلْأَعْرَابِيُّ لاَ يَؤُمُّ اَلْمُهَاجِرَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1105 - The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "None of you should pray behind a person with a mutilated limb (al-ajdham), a person with leprosy (al-abrāṣ), a person with a mental disorder (al-majnūn), a person who has been subjected to a legal punishment (al-maḥdūd), the child of adultery (walad al-zina), or a Bedouin (al-a‘rābī) leading a migrant (al-muhājir)."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.1106 - Imam (as) said: "An uncircumcised man (al-aghlaf) should not lead the people in prayer, even if he is the most proficient in reciting the Qur'an among them, because he has neglected one of the greatest aspects of the Sunnah. His testimony is not accepted, and prayers are not performed over him unless he left it (circumcision) out of fear for his life."
arabicText: 1106 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «اَلْأَغْلَفُ لاَ يَؤُمُّ اَلْقَوْمَ وَ لَوْ كَانَ أَقْرَأَهُمْ لِلْقُرْآنِ لِأَنَّهُ ضَيَّعَ مِنَ اَلسُّنَّةِ أَعْظَمَهَا وَ لاَ تُقْبَلُ لَهُ شَهَادَةٌ وَ لاَ يُصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ تَرَكَ ذَلِكَ خَوْفاً عَلَى نَفْسِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1106 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "An uncircumcised man (al-aghlaf) should not lead the people in prayer, even if he is the most proficient in reciting the Qur'an among them, because he has neglected one of the greatest aspects of the Sunnah. His testimony is not accepted, and prayers are not performed over him unless he left it (circumcision) out of fear for his life."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1107 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"A person in chains (al-qayd) does not lead those who are free, and a person afflicted with paralysis (al-falij) does not lead those who are healthy."
arabicText: 1107 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ يَؤُمُّ صَاحِبُ اَلْقَيْدِ اَلْمُطْلَقِينَ وَ لاَ يَؤُمُّ صَاحِبُ اَلْفَالِجِ اَلْأَصِحَّاءَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1107 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A person in chains (al-qayd) does not lead those who are free, and a person afflicted with paralysis (al-falij) does not lead those who are healthy."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1108 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) and Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"There is no issue for a blind person to lead the prayer if the people (praying behind him) are satisfied with him and he is the best among them in recitation and the most knowledgeable in religious jurisprudence."
arabicText: 1108 - وَقَالَ اَلْبَاقِرُ وَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَؤُمَّ اَلْأَعْمَى إِذَا رَضُوا بِهِ وَ كَانَ أَكْثَرَهُمْ قِرَاءَةً وَ أَفْقَهَهُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1108 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) and Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no issue for a blind person to lead the prayer if the people (praying behind him) are satisfied with him and he is the best among them in recitation and the most knowledgeable in religious jurisprudence."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1109 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"Indeed, the truly blind are those who are blind in their hearts, for it is not the eyes that go blind but the hearts within the chests."
arabicText: 1109 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّمَا اَلْأَعْمَى أَعْمَى اَلْقَلْبِ فَإِنَّهَا «لاٰ تَعْمَى اَلْأَبْصٰارُ وَ لٰكِنْ تَعْمَى اَلْقُلُوبُ اَلَّتِي فِي اَلصُّدُورِ» »
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1109 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, the truly blind are those who are blind in their hearts, for it is not the eyes that go blind but the hearts within the chests."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1111 - Imam Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hadi (as) and Imam Muhammad ibn Ali al-Jawad (as) said:
"Whoever believes in anthropomorphism (al-jism), do not give them anything from the zakat, and do not pray behind them."
arabicText: 1111 - وَقَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «مَنْ قَالَ بِالْجِسْمِ فَلاَ تُعْطُوهُ شَيْئاً مِنَ اَلزَّكَاةِ وَ لاَ تُصَلُّوا خَلْفَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1111 - Imam Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hadi (as) and Imam Muhammad ibn Ali al-Jawad (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever believes in anthropomorphism (al-jism), do not give them anything from the zakat, and do not pray behind them."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1112 - Abu Abdullah al-Barqi wrote to Abu Ja'far al-Thani (as), asking:
"May I be your ransom, is it permissible to pray behind someone who stopped at (only accepted the Imamate of) your father and grandfather (as)?"
Imam (as) said: "Do not pray behind him."
arabicText: 1112 - وَ كَتَبَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْبَرْقِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: أَ يَجُوزُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ اَلصَّلاَةُ خَلْفَ مَنْ وَقَفَ عَلَى أَبِيكَ وَ جَدِّكَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَأَجَابَ «لاَ تُصَلِّ وَرَاءَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1112 - Abu Abdullah al-Barqi wrote to Abu Ja'far al-Thani (as), asking:
"May I be your ransom, is it permissible to pray behind someone who stopped at (only accepted the Imamate of) your father and grandfather (as)?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not pray behind him."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1113 - Umar ibn Yazid asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about an Imam who is generally good in all his affairs and knowledgeable, but he raises his voice and speaks harshly to his parents, causing them distress.
He asked: "Should I pray behind him?"
He (as) replied: "No, do not pray behind him as long as he is not openly defiant and severing ties”.
arabicText: 1113 - وَ سَأَلَ عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنْ إِمَامٍ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ فِي جَمِيعِ أُمُورِهِ عَارِفٍ غَيْرَ أَنَّهُ يُسْمِعُ أَبَوَيْهِ اَلْكَلاَمَ اَلْغَلِيظَ اَلَّذِي يَغِيظُهُمَا أَقْرَأُ خَلْفَهُ قَالَ «لاَ، تَقْرَأُ خَلْفَهُ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ عَاقّاً قَاطِعاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1113 - Umar ibn Yazid asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about an Imam who is generally good in all his affairs and knowledgeable, but he raises his voice and speaks harshly to his parents, causing them distress.
thaqalaynMatn:
He asked: "Should I pray behind him?"
He (as) replied: "No, do not pray behind him as long as he is not openly defiant and severing ties”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1114 - Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Halabi narrated from him (as) that He said:
"Do not pray behind someone who declares you to be an unbeliever (kafir), and do not pray behind someone whom you have declared to be an unbeliever."
arabicText: 1114 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ تُصَلِّ خَلْفَ مَنْ يَشْهَدُ عَلَيْكَ بِالْكُفْرِ وَ لاَ خَلْفَ مَنْ شَهِدْتَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْكُفْرِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1114 - Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Halabi narrated from him (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not pray behind someone who declares you to be an unbeliever (kafir), and do not pray behind someone whom you have declared to be an unbeliever."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1115 - Saʿd ibn Ismail narrated from his father, who narrated from al-Ridha (as), that He said:
"I asked him about a man who commits sins ; should one pray behind him or not?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
arabicText: 1115 - وَ رَوَى سَعْدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُقَارِفُ اَلذَّنْبَ يُصَلَّى خَلْفَهُ أَمْ لاَ قَالَ «لاَ.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1116 - It was narrated from Isma'il ibn Muslim that he asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about praying behind a man who denies (or rejects) the decree (Qadar) of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic.
He (Al-Sadiq) replied: "He should repeat every prayer he performed behind him”.
arabicText: 1116 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ أَنَّهُ سَأَلَ اَلصَّادِقَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلصَّلاَةِ خَلْفَ رَجُلٍ يُكَذِّبُ بِقَدَرِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَالَ «لِيُعِدْ كُلَّ صَلاَةٍ صَلاَّهَا خَلْفَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1116 - It was narrated from Isma'il ibn Muslim that he asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about praying behind a man who denies (or rejects) the decree (Qadar) of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic.
He (Al-Sadiq) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He should repeat every prayer he performed behind him”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1117 - Isma'il al-Ju'fi said to Abu Ja'far:
"A man loves The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) but does not dissociate from his enemies, and he says,
'He (Ali) is dearer to me than those who opposed him.'"
He (Abu Ja'far) replied: "This person is of mixed (belief) and is an enemy; do not pray behind him, nor is there any respect (to be shown to him) except if you must do so out of precaution."
arabicText: 1117 - وَقَالَ إِسْمَاعِيلُ اَلْجُعْفِيُّ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: رَجُلٌ يُحِبُّ أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ لاَ يَتَبَرَّأُ مِنْ عَدُوِّهِ وَ يَقُولُ هُوَ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّنْ خَالَفَهُ قَالَ «هَذَا مِخْلَطٌ وَ هُوَ عَدُوٌّ فَلاَ تُصَلِّ وَرَاءَهُ وَ لاَ كَرَامَةَ إِلاَّ أَنْ تَتَّقِيَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1117 - Isma'il al-Ju'fi said to Abu Ja'far:
thaqalaynMatn:
"A man loves The Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) but does not dissociate from his enemies, and he says,
'He (Ali) is dearer to me than those who opposed him.'"
He (Abu Ja'far) replied: "This person is of mixed (belief) and is an enemy; do not pray behind him, nor is there any respect (to be shown to him) except if you must do so out of precaution."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1118 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"The Messenger of Allah (sw) once led his companions in prayer while seated. When he finished, He (sw) said: 'None of you should lead others in prayer while seated after me.'".
arabicText: 1118 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ صَلَّى بِأَصْحَابِهِ جَالِساً فَلَمَّا فَرَغَ قَالَ «لاَ يَؤُمَّنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ بَعْدِي جَالِساً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1118 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Messenger of Allah (sw) once led his companions in prayer while seated. When he finished, He (sw) said: 'None of you should lead others in prayer while seated after me.'".

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1119 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"The Prophet (sw) once fell from a horse, injuring the right side of his body, and he led the people in prayer while seated in the room of Umm Ibrahim”.
arabicText: 1119 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «كَانَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَقَعَ عَنْ فَرَسٍ فَشُجَّ شِقُّهُ اَلْأَيْمَنُ فَصَلَّى بِهِمْ جَالِساً فِي غُرْفَةِ أُمِّ إِبْرَاهِيمَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1119 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Prophet (sw) once fell from a horse, injuring the right side of his body, and he led the people in prayer while seated in the room of Umm Ibrahim”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1120 - Jamil ibn Salih asked:
"Which is better, for a man to pray by himself at the beginning of the time (for prayer) or to delay a little and pray with the people of his mosque if he is their Imam?"
He (as) replied: "He should delay and pray with the people of his mosque if he is their Imam."
arabicText: 1120 - وَ سَأَلَ جَمِيلُ بْنُ صَالِحٍ: أَيُّهُمَا أَفْضَلُ يُصَلِّي اَلرَّجُلُ لِنَفْسِهِ فِي أَوَّلِ اَلْوَقْتِ أَوْ يُؤَخِّرُ قَلِيلاً وَ يُصَلِّي بِأَهْلِ مَسْجِدِهِ إِذَا كَانَ إِمَامَهُمْ قَالَ «يُؤَخِّرُ وَ يُصَلِّي بِأَهْلِ مَسْجِدِهِ إِذَا كَانَ هُوَ اَلْإِمَامَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1120 - Jamil ibn Salih asked:
"Which is better, for a man to pray by himself at the beginning of the time (for prayer) or to delay a little and pray with the people of his mosque if he is their Imam?"
He (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He should delay and pray with the people of his mosque if he is their Imam."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1121 - A man asked him:
"I have a mosque at the entrance of my house. Which is better—should I pray at home where I can make my prayer longer, or should I lead them (in the mosque) and make it lighter?"
He (as) wrote: "Lead them in prayer and perform it well, but do not make it too heavy (burdensome)”.
1122
1122 - وَ إِنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: فِي رَجُلَيْنِ اِخْتَلَفَا فَقَالَ أَحَدُهُمَا كُنْتُ إِمَامَكَ وَقَالَ اَلْآخَرُ كُنْتُ إِمَامَكَ قَالَ «صَلاَتُهُمَا تَامَّةٌ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَا كُنْتُ أَئْتَمُّ بِكَ وَقَالَ اَلْآخَرُ كُنْتُ أَئْتَمُّ بِكَ قَالَ «فَصَلاَتُهُمَا فَاسِدَةٌ فَلْيَسْتَأْنِفَا.
Hadith.1122 - Imam Ali (as) said regarding two men who disagreed, with one saying, "I was your Imam (leader in prayer)," and the other saying, "I was your Imam," that "their prayers are valid."
When asked what if one of them said: "I was following you (as the Imam)," and the other also said: "I was following you,"
Imam (as) said: "Then their prayers are invalid, and they must repeat the prayer”.
arabicText: 1121 - وَ سَأَلَهُ رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ إِنَّ لِي مَسْجِداً عَلَى بَابِ دَارِي فَأَيُّهُمَا أَفْضَلُ أُصَلِّي فِي مَنْزِلِي فَأُطِيلُ اَلصَّلاَةَ أَوْ أُصَلِّي بِهِمْ وَ أُخَفِّفُ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «صَلِّ بِهِمْ وَ أَحْسِنِ اَلصَّلاَةَ وَ لاَ تُثَقِّلْ.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1123 - Jamil ibn Darraj asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about an Imam who becomes ritually impure (junub) and does not have enough water to perform the full ritual bath (ghusl), while the rest of the congregation has water to perform ablution (wudu). He asked whether some of them should perform wudu and then allow the Imam to lead.
Abu Abdullah (as) replied: "No, but the Imam should perform tayammum (dry ablution) and lead them, for Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, has made the earth a purifier just as He has made water a purifier”.
arabicText: 1123 - وَ سَأَلَ جَمِيلُ بْنُ دَرَّاجٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنْ إِمَامِ قَوْمٍ أَجْنَبَ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهُ مِنَ اَلْمَاءِ مَا يَكْفِيهِ لِلْغُسْلِ وَ مَعَهُمْ مَاءٌ يَتَوَضَّئُونَ بِهِ فَيَتَوَضَّأُ بَعْضُهُمْ وَ يَؤُمُّهُمْ قَالَ «لاَ وَ لَكِنْ يَتَيَمَّمُ اَلْإِمَامُ وَ يَؤُمُّهُمْ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ جَعَلَ اَلْأَرْضَ طَهُوراً كَمَا جَعَلَ اَلْمَاءَ طَهُوراً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1123 - Jamil ibn Darraj asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about an Imam who becomes ritually impure (junub) and does not have enough water to perform the full ritual bath (ghusl), while the rest of the congregation has water to perform ablution (wudu). He asked whether some of them should perform wudu and then allow the Imam to lead.
thaqalaynMatn: Abu Abdullah (as) replied: "No, but the Imam should perform tayammum (dry ablution) and lead them, for Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, has made the earth a purifier just as He has made water a purifier”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1124 - It is narrated from him by Umar ibn Yazid that Imam (as) said:
"None of you prays an obligatory prayer at its prescribed time and then prays with them (in congregation) as an act of precaution (taqiyya) while in a state of wudu, except that Allah (swt) will record for him twenty-five degrees (of reward). So strive for this."
arabicText: 1124 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «مَا مِنْكُمْ أَحَدٌ يُصَلِّي صَلاَةً فَرِيضَةً فِي وَقْتِهَا ثُمَّ يُصَلِّي مَعَهُمْ صَلاَةً تَقِيَّةً وَ هُوَ مُتَوَضِّئٌ إِلاَّ كَتَبَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ بِهَا خَمْساً وَ عِشْرِينَ دَرَجَةً فَارْغَبُوا فِي ذَلِكَ.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1125 - It is narrated from him by Hammad ibn Uthman that Imam (as) said:
"Whoever prays with them in the first row, it is as if he prayed behind the Messenger of Allah (sw) in the first row”.
arabicText: 1125 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ حَمَّادُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «مَنْ صَلَّى مَعَهُمْ فِي اَلصَّفِّ اَلْأَوَّلِ كَانَ كَمَنْ صَلَّى خَلْفَ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فِي اَلصَّفِّ اَلْأَوَّلِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1125 - It is narrated from him by Hammad ibn Uthman that Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever prays with them in the first row, it is as if he prayed behind the Messenger of Allah (sw) in the first row”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1126 - It is narrated from him by Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari that Imam (as) said:
"It will be counted for you when you join them (in prayer), even if you do not follow them (in intention); it will be counted for you just as it would if you were with someone you follow”.
arabicText: 1126 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ حَفْصُ بْنُ اَلْبَخْتَرِيُّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «يُحْسَبُ لَكَ إِذَا دَخَلْتَ مَعَهُمْ وَ إِنْ كُنْتَ لاَ تَقْتَدِي بِهِمْ حُسِبَ لَكَ مِثْلُ مَا يُحْسَبُ لَكَ إِذَا كُنْتَ مَعَ مَنْ تَقْتَدِي بِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1126 - It is narrated from him by Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari that Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It will be counted for you when you join them (in prayer), even if you do not follow them (in intention); it will be counted for you just as it would if you were with someone you follow”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1127 - Mas’adah ibn Sadaqah narrates that someone said to Jafar ibn Muhammad (as):
"May I be your ransom! I pass by a group of Nasibis (those hostile to the AhlulBayt (as)), and their prayer has been established while I am not in a state of wudu (ritual purity). If I do not join them in prayer, they will say whatever they wish about me. Should I then pray with them and perform wudu afterward and pray again?"
Jafar ibn Muhammad (as) responded: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! Does he not fear that if he prays without wudu, the earth would swallow him up?"
arabicText: 1127 - وَ رَوَى مَسْعَدَةُ بْنُ صَدَقَةَ: أَنَّ قَائِلاً قَالَ لِجَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنِّي أَمُرُّ بِقَوْمٍ نَاصِبِيَّةٍ وَ قَدْ أُقِيمَتْ لَهُمُ اَلصَّلاَةُ وَ أَنَا عَلَى غَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ فَإِنْ لَمْ أَدْخُلْ مَعَهُمْ فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ قَالُوا مَا شَاءُوا أَنْ يَقُولُوا أَ فَأُصَلِّي مَعَهُمْ ثُمَّ أَتَوَضَّأُ إِذَا اِنْصَرَفْتُ وَ أُصَلِّي قَالَ جَعْفَرُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ أَ فَمَا يَخَافُ مَنْ يُصَلِّي عَلَى غَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ أَنْ تَأْخُذَهُ اَلْأَرْضُ خَسْفاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1127 - Mas’adah ibn Sadaqah narrates that someone said to Jafar ibn Muhammad (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"May I be your ransom! I pass by a group of Nasibis (those hostile to the AhlulBayt (as)), and their prayer has been established while I am not in a state of wudu (ritual purity). If I do not join them in prayer, they will say whatever they wish about me. Should I then pray with them and perform wudu afterward and pray again?"
Jafar ibn Muhammad (as) responded: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! Does he not fear that if he prays without wudu, the earth would swallow him up?"

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1128 - It is narrated from Zayd al-Shahham that He said:
Imam Ja'far Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"O’ Zayd, interact with the people through good character. Pray in their mosques, visit their sick, and attend their funerals. If you can, be the Imams and callers to prayer (mu'adhdhins), then do so. For if you do this, they will say,
'These are the Ja'fariyyah; may Allah (swt) have mercy on Ja'far, how well he trained his companions!'
But if you do otherwise, they will say,
'These are the Ja'fariyyah; may Allah (swt) do with Ja'far as he deserves for how badly he trained his companions!'"
arabicText: 1128 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ زَيْدٌ اَلشَّحَّامُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «يَا زَيْدُ خَالِقُوا اَلنَّاسَ بِأَخْلاَقِهِمْ صَلُّوا فِي مَسَاجِدِهِمْ وَ عُودُوا مَرْضَاهُمْ وَ اِشْهَدُوا جَنَائِزَهُمْ وَ إِنِ اِسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ تَكُونُوا اَلْأَئِمَّةَ وَ اَلْمُؤَذِّنِينَ فَافْعَلُوا فَإِنَّكُمْ إِذَا فَعَلْتُمْ ذَلِكَ قَالُوا هَؤُلاَءِ اَلْجَعْفَرِيَّةُ رَحِمَ اَللَّهُ جَعْفَراً مَا كَانَ أَحْسَنَ مَا يُؤَدِّبُ أَصْحَابَهُ وَ إِذَا تَرَكْتُمْ ذَلِكَ قَالُوا هَؤُلاَءِ اَلْجَعْفَرِيَّةُ فَعَلَ اَللَّهُ بِجَعْفَرٍ مَا كَانَ أَسْوَأَ مَا يُؤَدِّبُ أَصْحَابَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1128 - It is narrated from Zayd al-Shahham that He said:
Imam Ja'far Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O’ Zayd, interact with the people through good character. Pray in their mosques, visit their sick, and attend their funerals. If you can, be the Imams and callers to prayer (mu'adhdhins), then do so. For if you do this, they will say,
'These are the Ja'fariyyah; may Allah (swt) have mercy on Ja'far, how well he trained his companions!'
But if you do otherwise, they will say,
'These are the Ja'fariyyah; may Allah (swt) do with Ja'far as he deserves for how badly he trained his companions!'"

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1129 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Give the call to prayer (adhan) behind the one you recited the prayer behind”.
arabicText: 1129 - وَقَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَذِّنْ خَلْفَ مَنْ قَرَأْتَ خَلْفَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1129 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Give the call to prayer (adhan) behind the one you recited the prayer behind”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1130 - A man said to him (as):
"I pray with my family, then I go to the mosque and they ask me to lead them in prayer."
Imam (as) said: "Go ahead and lead them; there is no harm in it. Pray with them."
arabicText: 1130 - وَقَالَ لَهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ أُصَلِّي فِي أَهْلِي ثُمَّ أَخْرُجُ إِلَى اَلْمَسْجِدِ فَيُقَدِّمُونِي فَقَالَ «تَقَدَّمْ لاَ عَلَيْكَ وَ صَلِّ بِهِمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1130 - A man said to him (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I pray with my family, then I go to the mosque and they ask me to lead them in prayer."
Imam (as) said: "Go ahead and lead them; there is no harm in it. Pray with them."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1131 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from him (as) that He said regarding a man who prays alone and then finds a congregation:
"He may pray with them and count it as his obligatory (fardh) prayer if he wishes”.
arabicText: 1131 - وَ رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي اَلصَّلاَةَ وَحْدَهُ ثُمَّ يَجِدُ جَمَاعَةً قَالَ «يُصَلِّي مَعَهُمْ وَ يَجْعَلُهَا اَلْفَرِيضَةَ إِنْ شَاءَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1131 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from him (as) that He said regarding a man who prays alone and then finds a congregation:
thaqalaynMatn: "He may pray with them and count it as his obligatory (fardh) prayer if he wishes”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.1132 - It has been narrated: "He will be credited with the better and more complete of the two”.
arabicText: 1132 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ يُحْسَبُ لَهُ أَفْضَلُهُمَا وَ أَتَمُّهُمَا.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1133 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man leading a group in prayer while wearing trousers (sarawil) and a cloak (rida).
He (as) replied: "There is no harm in it”.
arabicText: 1133 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ هَلْ يُصَلِّي بِالْقَوْمِ وَ عَلَيْهِ سَرَاوِيلُ وَ رِدَاءٌ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1133 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man leading a group in prayer while wearing trousers (sarawil) and a cloak (rida).
He (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in it”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1134 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"The last prayer that the Messenger of Allah (sw) led the people in was while wearing a single garment, with its ends crossed over one another. Shall I show you the garment?"
I said: "Yes."
He then brought out a cloak, and I measured it—it was seven cubits by eight hand spans.
arabicText: 1134 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِنَّ آخِرَ صَلاَةٍ صَلاَّهَا رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِالنَّاسِ فِي ثَوْبٍ وَاحِدٍ قَدْ خَالَفَ بَيْنَ طَرَفَيْهِ أَ لاَ أُرِيكَ اَلثَّوْبَ» قُلْتُ بَلَى قَالَ فَأَخْرَجَ مِلْحَفَةً فَذَرَعْتُهَا وَ كَانَتْ سَبْعَةَ أَذْرُعٍ فِي ثَمَانِيَةِ أَشْبَارٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1134 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The last prayer that the Messenger of Allah (sw) led the people in was while wearing a single garment, with its ends crossed over one another. Shall I show you the garment?"
I said: "Yes."
He then brought out a cloak, and I measured it—it was seven cubits by eight hand spans.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1135 - Umar ibn Yazid asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the narration that states it is not appropriate to perform supererogatory (nafl) prayers at the time of every obligatory (fardh) prayer.
He asked: "What is the limit for this time?"
He (as) replied: "When the person giving the iqamah (call immediately preceding the prayer) begins the iqamah."
Umar said: "People differ in the timing of the iqamah."
He (as) responded: "The one giving the iqamah is the one with whom the prayer is being established”.
arabicText: 1135 - وَ سَأَلَ عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ ، أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرِّوَايَةِ اَلَّتِي يَرْوُونَ أَنَّهُ لاَ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُتَطَوَّعَ فِي وَقْتِ كُلِّ فَرِيضَةٍ مَا حَدُّ هَذَا اَلْوَقْتِ فَقَالَ «إِذَا أَخَذَ اَلْمُقِيمُ فِي اَلْإِقَامَةِ» فَقَالَ لَهُ إِنَّ اَلنَّاسَ يَخْتَلِفُونَ فِي اَلْإِقَامَةِ قَالَ «اَلْمُقِيمُ اَلَّذِي يُصَلَّى مَعَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1135 - Umar ibn Yazid asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about the narration that states it is not appropriate to perform supererogatory (nafl) prayers at the time of every obligatory (fardh) prayer.
He asked: "What is the limit for this time?"
He (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the person giving the iqamah (call immediately preceding the prayer) begins the iqamah."
Umar said: "People differ in the timing of the iqamah."
He (as) responded: "The one giving the iqamah is the one with whom the prayer is being established”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1136 - Hafs ibn Salim asked: "When the muezzin (caller to prayer) says 'The prayer has been established' (during the iqamah), should the people stand up or remain seated until their Imam arrives?"
He (as) replied: "No, they should stand up. If their Imam arrives, they proceed with him; otherwise, a man from among the congregation should be taken by the hand and brought forward to lead."
arabicText: 1136 - وَ سَأَلَهُ حَفْصُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ: إِذَا قَالَ اَلْمُؤَذِّنُ قَدْ قَامَتِ اَلصَّلاَةُ أَ يَقُومُ اَلنَّاسُ عَلَى أَرْجُلِهِمْ أَوْ يَجْلِسُونَ حَتَّى يَجِيءَ إِمَامُهُمْ قَالَ «لاَ بَلْ يَقُومُونَ عَلَى أَرْجُلِهِمْ فَإِنْ جَاءَ إِمَامُهُمْ وَ إِلاَّ فَلْيُؤْخَذْ بِيَدِ رَجُلٍ مِنَ اَلْقَوْمِ فَيُقَدَّمَ.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1137 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"When the prayer has been established (by the iqamah), speaking becomes forbidden for the Imam and the people of the mosque, except in the matter of appointing an Imam”.
arabicText: 1137 - وروى زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام أنه قال: " إذا أقيمت الصلاة حرم الكلام على الامام وأهل المسجد إلا في تقديم إمام.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1137 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When the prayer has been established (by the iqamah), speaking becomes forbidden for the Imam and the people of the mosque, except in the matter of appointing an Imam”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1138 - It was narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim that he was asked about a man leading two others in prayer.
Imam (as) said: "He should stand in front of them and not between them."
And regarding two men praying together in congregation, Imam (as) said:
"Yes, he (the one leading) should have the other stand on his right”.
arabicText: 1138 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ: أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَؤُمُّ اَلرَّجُلَيْنِ قَالَ «يَتَقَدَّمُهُمَا وَ لاَ يَقُومُ بَيْنَهُمَا» وَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلَيْنِ يُصَلِّيَانِ جَمَاعَةً قَالَ «نَعَمْ يَجْعَلُهُ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1139 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
"Straighten your rows, for I see you from behind me just as I see you from in front of me and from before me. Do not differ, lest Allah (swt) cause discord among your hearts."
arabicText: 1139 - قَالَ وَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ: «أَقِيمُوا صُفُوفَكُمْ فَإِنِّي أَرَاكُمْ مِنْ خَلْفِي كَمَا أَرَاكُمْ مِنْ قُدَّامِي وَ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ وَ لاَ تُخَالِفُوا فَيُخَالِفَ اَللَّهُ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِكُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1139 - The Messenger of Allah (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Straighten your rows, for I see you from behind me just as I see you from in front of me and from before me. Do not differ, lest Allah (swt) cause discord among your hearts."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1140 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
"Praying in the first row is like striving (jihad) in the way of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText: 1140 - وَقَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنَّ اَلصَّلاَةَ فِي اَلصَّفِّ اَلْأَوَّلِ كَالْجِهَادِ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1140 - Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Praying in the first row is like striving (jihad) in the way of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1141 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"I see no harm in rows (of prayer) being between the columns (pillars)."
arabicText: 1141 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ أَرَى بِالصُّفُوفِ بَيْنَ اَلْأَسَاطِينِ بَأْساً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1141 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I see no harm in rows (of prayer) being between the columns (pillars)."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1142 - Imam (as) said:
"Complete your rows when you see a gap, and it does not harm you to move back if you find tightness in the first row to the row behind you, walking at an angle."
arabicText: 1142 - وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَتِمُّوا صُفُوفَكُمْ إِذَا رَأَيْتُمْ خَلَلاً وَ لاَ يَضُرُّكَ أَنْ تَتَأَخَّرَ وَرَاءَكَ إِذَا وَجَدْتَ ضِيقاً فِي اَلصَّفِّ اَلْأَوَّلِ إِلَى اَلصَّفِّ اَلَّذِي خَلْفَكَ وَ تَمْشِيَ مُنْحَرِفاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1142 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Complete your rows when you see a gap, and it does not harm you to move back if you find tightness in the first row to the row behind you, walking at an angle."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1143 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"The rows (in prayer) should be complete and continuous, one row connected to another, and there should not be a gap between the rows that cannot be crossed, such that it should only be the space of a human body when in prostration”.
arabicText: 1143 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «يَنْبَغِي لِلصُّفُوفِ أَنْ تَكُونَ تَامَّةً مُتَوَاصِلَةً بَعْضُهَا إِلَى بَعْضٍ وَ لاَ يَكُونَ بَيْنَ اَلصَّفَّيْنِ مَا لاَ يُتَخَطَّى يَكُونُ قَدْرُ ذَلِكَ مَسْقَطَ جَسَدِ إِنْسَانٍ إِذَا سَجَدَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1143 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The rows (in prayer) should be complete and continuous, one row connected to another, and there should not be a gap between the rows that cannot be crossed, such that it should only be the space of a human body when in prostration”.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1144 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"If a group prays with a gap between themselves and the Imam that cannot be crossed, then that Imam is not considered an Imam for them. Any row whose members are praying following the prayer of an Imam but are separated from the row before them by a gap that cannot be crossed, that is not a valid prayer for them. If there is a barrier or a wall, their prayer is also invalid unless one is directly aligned with the door."
Imam (as) also said: "These enclosures (maqasir) were introduced by tyrants, and there is no valid prayer for anyone who prays behind them, following the prayer of those within."
Furthermore, Imam (as) said: "Any woman who prays behind an Imam but with a gap between her and him that cannot be crossed, her prayer is invalid."
I (the narrator) asked: "If a person comes and wishes to pray, what should they do if She is beside the man?"
Imam (as) replied: "He should enter between her and the man, and She should move slightly."
arabicText: 1144 - وَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «إِنْ صَلَّى قَوْمٌ بَيْنَهُمْ وَ بَيْنَ اَلْإِمَامِ مَا لاَ يُتَخَطَّى فَلَيْسَ ذَلِكَ اَلْإِمَامُ لَهُمْ بِإِمَامٍ وَ أَيُّ صَفٍّ كَانَ أَهْلُهُ يُصَلُّونَ بِصَلاَةِ إِمَامٍ وَ بَيْنَهُمْ وَ بَيْنَ اَلصَّفِّ اَلَّذِي يَتَقَدَّمُهُمْ مَا لاَ يُتَخَطَّى فَلَيْسَ تِلْكَ لَهُمْ بِصَلاَةٍ وَ إِنْ كَانَ سِتْراً أَوْ جِدَاراً فَلَيْسَ تِلْكَ لَهُمْ بِصَلاَةٍ إِلاَّ مَنْ كَانَ حِيَالَ اَلْبَابِ» قَالَ وَقَالَ «هَذِهِ اَلْمَقَاصِيرُ إِنَّمَا أَحْدَثَهَا اَلْجَبَّارُونَ وَ لَيْسَ لِمَنْ صَلَّى خَلْفَهَا مُقْتَدِياً بِصَلاَةِ مَنْ فِيهَا صَلاَةٌ» قَالَ وَقَالَ «أَيُّمَا اِمْرَأَةٍ صَلَّتْ خَلْفَ إِمَامٍ وَ بَيْنَهَا وَ بَيْنَهُ مَا لاَ يُتَخَطَّى فَلَيْسَ لَهَا تِلْكَ بِصَلاَةٍ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ جَاءَ إِنْسَانٌ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُصَلِّيَ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ وَ هِيَ إِلَى جَانِبِ اَلرَّجُلِ قَالَ «يَدْخُلُ بَيْنَهَا وَ بَيْنَ اَلرَّجُلِ وَ تَنْحَدِرُ هِيَ شَيْئاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1144 - Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a group prays with a gap between themselves and the Imam that cannot be crossed, then that Imam is not considered an Imam for them. Any row whose members are praying following the prayer of an Imam but are separated from the row before them by a gap that cannot be crossed, that is not a valid prayer for them. If there is a barrier or a wall, their prayer is also invalid unless one is directly aligned with the door."
Imam (as) also said: "These enclosures (maqasir) were introduced by tyrants, and there is no valid prayer for anyone who prays behind them, following the prayer of those within."
Furthermore, Imam (as) said: "Any woman who prays behind an Imam but with a gap between her and him that cannot be crossed, her prayer is invalid."
I (the narrator) asked: "If a person comes and wishes to pray, what should they do if She is beside the man?"
Imam (as) replied: "He should enter between her and the man, and She should move slightly."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1146 - Ammar ibn Musa narrated that Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about an Imam praying while behind him are people at a lower level than where he is praying.
Imam (as) said: "If the Imam is on something like a platform or at a significantly higher level than their position, their prayer is invalid. However, if he is elevated by a finger's width or slightly more or less, due to a natural rise, or if the land is even but has a raised spot where the Imam stands while those behind him are at a lower level and the land itself is generally flat but sloped in places, then there is no issue."
He was asked about an Imam standing lower than those behind him
Imam (as) said: "There is no issue."
Imam (as) further said: "If a person is above, on a roof or a platform or any other elevated place while the Imam prays on the ground below, it is permissible for the person to pray behind the Imam and follow his prayer even if the person is significantly higher."
arabicText: 1146 - وَقَالَ عَمَّارُ بْنُ مُوسَى: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْإِمَامِ يُصَلِّي وَ خَلْفَهُ قَوْمٌ أَسْفَلُ مِنَ اَلْمَوْضِعِ اَلَّذِي يُصَلِّي فِيهِ قَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ اَلْإِمَامُ عَلَى شِبْهِ اَلدُّكَّانِ أَوْ عَلَى أَرْفَعَ مِنْ مَوْضِعِهِمْ لَمْ تَجُزْ صَلاَتُهُمْ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَرْفَعَ مِنْهُمْ بِإِصْبَعٍ أَوْ أَكْثَرَ أَوْ أَقَلَّ إِذَا كَانَ اَلاِرْتِفَاعُ بِقَطْعِ سَيْلٍ وَ إِنْ كَانَتِ اَلْأَرْضُ مَبْسُوطَةً وَ كَانَ فِي مَوْضِعٍ مِنْهَا اِرْتِفَاعٌ فَقَامَ اَلْإِمَامُ فِي اَلْمَوْضِعِ اَلْمُرْتَفِعِ وَ قَامَ مَنْ خَلْفَهُ أَسْفَلَ مِنْهُ وَ اَلْأَرْضُ مَبْسُوطَةٌ إِلاَّ أَنَّهَا فِي مَوْضِعٍ مُنْحَدِرٍ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ» وَ سُئِلَ فَإِنْ قَامَ اَلْإِمَامُ أَسْفَلَ مِنْ مَوْضِعِ مَنْ يُصَلِّي خَلْفَهُ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ» وَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «إِنْ كَانَ اَلرَّجُلُ فَوْقَ بَيْتٍ أَوْ غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ دُكَّاناً كَانَ أَوْ غَيْرَهُ وَ كَانَ اَلْإِمَامُ يُصَلِّي عَلَى اَلْأَرْضِ وَ اَلْإِمَامُ أَسْفَلَ مِنْهُ كَانَ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يُصَلِّيَ خَلْفَهُ وَ يَقْتَدِيَ بِصَلاَتِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَرْفَعَ مِنْهُ بِشَيْءٍ كَثِيرٍ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1146 - Ammar ibn Musa narrated that Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about an Imam praying while behind him are people at a lower level than where he is praying.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If the Imam is on something like a platform or at a significantly higher level than their position, their prayer is invalid. However, if he is elevated by a finger's width or slightly more or less, due to a natural rise, or if the land is even but has a raised spot where the Imam stands while those behind him are at a lower level and the land itself is generally flat but sloped in places, then there is no issue."
He was asked about an Imam standing lower than those behind him
Imam (as) said: "There is no issue."
Imam (as) further said: "If a person is above, on a roof or a platform or any other elevated place while the Imam prays on the ground below, it is permissible for the person to pray behind the Imam and follow his prayer even if the person is significantly higher."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1147 - Musa ibn Bakr asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who stands alone in a row during prayer.
Imam (as) said: "There is no problem ; indeed, the row is formed one person at a time."
arabicText: 1147 - وَ سَأَلَ مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ: عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَقُومُ فِي اَلصَّفِّ وَحْدَهُ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ إِنَّمَا يَبْدُو اَلصَّفُّ وَاحِداً بَعْدَ وَاحِدٍ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1147 - Musa ibn Bakr asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who stands alone in a row during prayer.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no problem ; indeed, the row is formed one person at a time."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1148 - It was narrated from Abdul Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah that He said:
"I heard Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) say:
"If you enter the mosque and the Imam is in the bowing position (ruku'), and you think that if you walk towards him, he will raise his head, then pronounce the takbir (opening supplication) and bow. When the Imam raises his head, prostrate in your place. If the Imam then stands, join the row. If he sits, remain seated in your place, and when he stands again, join the row."
arabicText: 1148 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: «إِذَا دَخَلْتَ اَلْمَسْجِدَ وَ اَلْإِمَامُ رَاكِعٌ وَ ظَنَنْتَ أَنَّكَ إِنْ مَشَيْتَ إِلَيْهِ رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ فَكَبِّرْ وَ اِرْكَعْ فَإِذَا رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ فَاسْجُدْ مَكَانَكَ فَإِذَا قَامَ فَالْحَقْ بِالصَّفِّ وَ إِنْ جَلَسَ فَاجْلِسْ مَكَانَكَ فَإِذَا قَامَ فَالْحَقْ بِالصَّفِّ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1148 - It was narrated from Abdul Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah that He said:
"I heard Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you enter the mosque and the Imam is in the bowing position (ruku'), and you think that if you walk towards him, he will raise his head, then pronounce the takbir (opening supplication) and bow. When the Imam raises his head, prostrate in your place. If the Imam then stands, join the row. If he sits, remain seated in your place, and when he stands again, join the row."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1149 - It is narrated:
"He should walk during the prayer by dragging his feet and not stepping over (or taking large steps)."
arabicText: 1149 - وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ يَمْشِي فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ يَجُرُّ رِجْلَيْهِ وَ لاَ يَتَخَطَّى.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1150 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"If you reach the Imam while he is in the bowing position (ruku') and you say the takbir (opening supplication) before the Imam raises his head, then you have caught the rak'ah (unit of prayer). However, if he raises his head before you bow, then you have missed that rak'ah."
arabicText: 1150 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِذَا أَدْرَكْتَ اَلْإِمَامَ وَ قَدْ رَكَعَ فَكَبَّرْتَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَرْفَعَ اَلْإِمَامُ رَأْسَهُ فَقَدْ أَدْرَكْتَ اَلرَّكْعَةَ وَ إِنْ رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَرْكَعَ فَقَدْ فَاتَتْكَ اَلرَّكْعَةُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1150 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you reach the Imam while he is in the bowing position (ruku') and you say the takbir (opening supplication) before the Imam raises his head, then you have caught the rak'ah (unit of prayer). However, if he raises his head before you bow, then you have missed that rak'ah."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1151 - Abu Usamah narrated that he asked about a man who reaches the Imam while he is in the bowing position (ruku').
Imam (as) said: "If he pronounces the takbir and straightens his back (stands up properly) and then bows, he has caught the rak'ah."
arabicText: 1151 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو أُسَامَةَ: أَنَّهُ سَأَلَهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِنْتَهَى إِلَى اَلْإِمَامِ وَ هُوَ رَاكِعٌ، قَالَ «إِذَا كَبَّرَ وَ أَقَامَ صُلْبَهُ ثُمَّ رَكَعَ فَقَدْ أَدْرَكَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.1151 - Abu Usamah narrated that he asked about a man who reaches the Imam while he is in the bowing position (ruku').
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he pronounces the takbir and straightens his back (stands up properly) and then bows, he has caught the rak'ah."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1152 - A man said to Imam Abu Ja'far (as),
"I am the Imam of the mosque in our neighborhood, and when I bow (in ruku') with them, I hear the sound of their footsteps while I am in ruku'."
Imam (as) replied: "Remain in your bowing position for as long as your bowing takes, and if they catch up, (continue); otherwise, stand up straight."
arabicText: 1152 - وَقَالَ رَجُلٌ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي إِمَامُ مَسْجِدِ اَلْحَيِّ فَأَرْكَعُ بِهِمْ وَ أَسْمَعُ خَفَقَانَ نِعَالِهِمْ وَ أَنَا رَاكِعٌ فَقَالَ «اِصْبِرْ رُكُوعَكَ وَ مِثْلَ رُكُوعِكَ فَإِنِ اِنْقَطَعُوا وَ إِلاَّ فَانْتَصِبْ قَائِماً.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1153 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"It is appropriate for the Imam's prayer to be suited to the ability of the weakest among those behind him."
arabicText: 1153 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «يَنْبَغِي لِلْإِمَامِ أَنْ يَكُونَ صَلاَتُهُ عَلَى صَلاَةِ أَضْعَفِ مَنْ خَلْفَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1153 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is appropriate for the Imam's prayer to be suited to the ability of the weakest among those behind him."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1154 - Mu'adh used to lead prayer in a mosque during the time of the Messenger of Allah (sw) and would make the recitation lengthy. One day, a man passed by while Mu'adh was reciting a long Surah, so the man recited (the prayer) for himself, completed it, and then rode off on his mount. When this incident reached The Prophet (sw), he sent for Mu'adh and said:
"O’ Mu'adh, be careful not to be a source of hardship (fitnah). Recite from the shorter Surahs like 'By the sun and its brightness' (Ash-Shams) and similar ones."
arabicText: 1154 - وَ كَانَ مُعَاذٌ يَؤُمُّ فِي مَسْجِدٍ عَلَى عَهْدِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ يُطِيلُ اَلْقِرَاءَةَ وَ أَنَّهُ مَرَّ بِهِ رَجُلٌ فَافْتَتَحَ سُورَةً طَوِيلَةً فَقَرَأَ اَلرَّجُلُ لِنَفْسِهِ وَ صَلَّى ثُمَّ رَكِبَ رَاحِلَتَهُ فَبَلَغَ ذَلِكَ اَلنَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَبَعَثَ إِلَى مُعَاذٍ فَقَالَ «يَا مُعَاذُ إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَكُونَ فَتَّاناً عَلَيْكَ بِالشَّمْسِ وَ ضُحَيهَا وَ ذَوَاتِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1154 - Mu'adh used to lead prayer in a mosque during the time of the Messenger of Allah (sw) and would make the recitation lengthy. One day, a man passed by while Mu'adh was reciting a long Surah, so the man recited (the prayer) for himself, completed it, and then rode off on his mount. When this incident reached The Prophet (sw), he sent for Mu'adh and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O’ Mu'adh, be careful not to be a source of hardship (fitnah). Recite from the shorter Surahs like 'By the sun and its brightness' (Ash-Shams) and similar ones."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.1155 - The Prophet (sw) was leading his companions in prayer one day when he heard the crying of a child, so he shortened the prayer.
arabicText: 1155 - وَ إِنَّ اَلنَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ كَانَ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ يَؤُمُّ أَصْحَابَهُ فَيَسْمَعُ بُكَاءَ اَلصَّبِيِّ فَيُخَفِّفُ اَلصَّلاَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1155 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Prophet (sw) was leading his companions in prayer one day when he heard the crying of a child, so he shortened the prayer.

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1156 – Zurarah and Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
Amir al-Mu'minin (as) used to say: "Whoever recites (aloud) behind an Imam whom he follows (in prayer) and then dies will be resurrected on a different (incorrect) natural disposition (fitra)."
arabicText: 1156 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: «مَنْ قَرَأَ خَلْفَ إِمَامٍ يَأْتَمُّ بِهِ فَمَاتَ بُعِثَ عَلَى غَيْرِ فِطْرَةٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1156 – Zurarah and Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: Amir al-Mu'minin (as) used to say: "Whoever recites (aloud) behind an Imam whom he follows (in prayer) and then dies will be resurrected on a different (incorrect) natural disposition (fitra)."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1157 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
"If you are praying behind an Imam whom you are following, do not recite (the Qur'an) behind him, whether you hear his recitation or not, except in a prayer where the recitation is done aloud and you do not hear it—then you may recite."
arabicText: 1157 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «إِذَا صَلَّيْتَ خَلْفَ إِمَامٍ تَأْتَمُّ بِهِ فَلاَ تَقْرَأْ خَلْفَهُ سَمِعْتَ قِرَاءَتَهُ أَوْ لَمْ تَسْمَعْ إِلاَّ أَنْ تَكُونَ صَلاَةً يُجْهَرُ فِيهَا بِالْقِرَاءَةِ فَلَمْ تَسْمَعْ فَاقْرَأْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1157 - Al-Halabi narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you are praying behind an Imam whom you are following, do not recite (the Qur'an) behind him, whether you hear his recitation or not, except in a prayer where the recitation is done aloud and you do not hear it—then you may recite."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1158 - In a narration from Ubayd ibn Zurarah from Imam (as):
"If he (the follower) hears a murmur (of the Imam's recitation), he should not recite."
arabicText: 1158 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ زُرَارَةَ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: «أَنَّهُ إِنْ سَمِعَ اَلْهَمْهَمَةَ فَلاَ يَقْرَأْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1158 - In a narration from Ubayd ibn Zurarah from Imam (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "If he (the follower) hears a murmur (of the Imam's recitation), he should not recite."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1159 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
"Do not recite anything (from the Qur'an) in the last two rak'ahs of the four obligatory rak'ah prayers, whether you are an Imam or not."
I (Zurarah) asked: "So what should I say in them?"
Imam (as) said: "If you are an Imam or praying alone, say: 'Subhan Allah (swt) (Glory be to Allah (swt)), Alhamdulillah (Praise be to Allah (swt)), and La ilaha illAllah (swt) (There is no god but Allah (swt))' three times, making a total of nine glorifications. Then say the takbir and bow (for ruku')."
arabicText: 1159 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ تَقْرَأَنَّ فِي اَلرَّكْعَتَيْنِ اَلْأَخِيرَتَيْنِ مِنَ اَلْأَرْبَعِ اَلرَّكَعَاتِ اَلْمَفْرُوضَاتِ شَيْئاً إِمَاماً كُنْتَ أَوْ غَيْرَ إِمَامٍ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَمَا أَقُولُ فِيهَا قَالَ «إِنْ كُنْتَ إِمَاماً أَوْ وَحْدَكَ فَقُلْ سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ وَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ تُكَمِّلُهُ تِسْعَ تَسْبِيحَاتٍ ثُمَّ تُكَبِّرُ وَ تَرْكَعُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.1159 – Zurarah narrated from Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Do not recite anything (from the Qur'an) in the last two rak'ahs of the four obligatory rak'ah prayers, whether you are an Imam or not."
I (Zurarah) asked: "So what should I say in them?"
Imam (as) said: "If you are an Imam or praying alone, say: 'Subhan Allah (swt) (Glory be to Allah (swt)), Alhamdulillah (Praise be to Allah (swt)), and La ilaha illAllah (swt) (There is no god but Allah (swt))' three times, making a total of nine glorifications. Then say the takbir and bow (for ruku')."

chapter: Congregational Prayer and Its Virtue
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.1160 - Wuhayb ibn Hafs narrated from Abu Basir, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"The minimum that suffices in the last two rak'ahs is to say three tasbihat (glorifications), by saying: 'Subhan Allah (swt) (Glory be to Allah (swt)), Subhan Allah (swt), Subhan Allah (swt).'"
